Person1: You're so bright and chipper, it's almost like you're trying to distract me from the real issue. 
Person2: You got it wrong, I'm not trying to manipulate you. 
Person1: Save it, I know your tricks. You think you can outsmart me like you did with that acned acrobat at the circus? 
Person2: Let's see if you can handle the truth. You're the one who's been playing dirty, using people to do your dirty work.

Person1: I thought we all were.
Person2: Sir, I-
Person1: You're a doctor. You're supposed to be my eyes and ears in this hospital, are you not?
Person2: I don't think I can do this, sir.
Person1: Please be quiet. I pay you a good deal of money to provide this simple service. If you cannot, you are of no use to me.
Person2: But it's different, sir. I don't want to.

Person1: I was wondering, can we take a break from this?
Person2: You're so spoiled. What's "tough" to you? Only a few setbacks and you want to give up?
Person1: I'm not giving up, but our situation is not good. We've got limited resources and --
Person2: You can't just run away every time things get tough. First of all, we've got enough skills to --
Person1: You're not listening to me. I think we should reassess our priorities.
Person2: You're off, you know? You're way, way off. What you think doesn't have much to do with reality.
Person1: That's not fair. I'm trying to be realistic here.
Person2: Realistic? You're the one who's been unrealistic from the start. I mean, I hope I'm not the first to say that about you.

Person1: You said you'd help me with my project proposal. I need your expertise to get it approved.
Person2: Hmm, I really can't recall that conversation, Rachel. You know I'm swamped with work lately.
Person1: Seriously? You've been doing this a lot lately, making promises you don't intend to keep.
Person2: Well, I'm not a boy who can just drop everything for you. You don't have the faintest idea what it takes to be in my position.
Person1: That's not fair. I've been working hard on this proposal, and I thought we had an understanding.
Person2: You're just trying to get ahead by using me, aren't you? You don't really care about the project or its impact. You just want to impress the boss.
Person1: That's not true! I'm trying to make a difference here.
Person2: Save it, Rachel. I've seen people like you before. You're all talk and no action. You wouldn't know how it feels to truly make a difference, to be responsible for something that changes people's lives.

Person1: I don't get treated at all, but hey, don't worry about it. I'll do your thing.
Person2: Longitude 109 -- wait, I think we can do better. Let's jump to a different approach.
Person1: What? You're altering the plan again?
Person2: Just trust me, it'll give your Mom a smile. And who knows, it might just show everybody what a unique, open-minded place this is.
Person1: You're a shrewd one, always trying to get what you want. But I suppose it's worth a shot.

Person1: What can you do when you have to be a man? You're going to stop me from going, aren't you?
Person2: Jesus, you're being ridiculous. Let's settle this and put it behind us.
Person1: What deviant groups or organizations did you secretly belong to? What is it, that you're not telling me?
Person2: You know I never stop you from anything. Believe me, you're at a wonderful age. In ten years, you'll look back on this and wish you were a kid again.
Person1: Ten years? Now, I need an answer now! Did you frequent those pathetic bars on Camac Street? Did you tell them? Did they notice something was wrong with your appearance?
Person2: I just want to show you how foolish you are. When you're older, you'll laugh at yourself for thinking this is so important.

Person1: I'm not sure if I should invite her to the party.
Person2: You think she's the type who would be offended if you didn't?
Person1: Exactly. And what if she doesn't want to go?
Person2: It says here you've been quite persuasive in the past. I'm sure you can convince her.
Person1: You're not helping. I want to do what's right, not just what you think I should do.
Person2: Oh, come on. I'm just trying to help. Don't be so sensitive.

Person1: You're not the kind of person I thought you were.
Person2: I'm not sure what kind of person I am anymore.
Person1: Don't play dumb with me. You know exactly what I'm talking about.
Person2: Maybe I do, maybe I don't. But what's it to you?
Person1: You're just trying to spare my feelings, aren't you? Like De Mille did.
Person2: Who's De Mille?
Person1: Don't pretend you don't know. You're just like all the others, trying to manipulate me.
Person2: I'm not trying to manipulate you. I'm just trying to tell you the truth.
Person1: The truth? You call that the truth? I know what's really going on here.

Person1: I know you're afraid to take the leap, but you must believe in yourself. There's a greatness inside of you, waiting to be unleashed.
Person2: I don't know if I can do this. What if I fail?
Person1: You're not just doing this for yourself, you're doing it for me. I'm giving you a second chance, and I need you to trust me. Go up to the rooftop, and I'll follow.
Person2: No, I'm not sure...
Person1: Take a deep breath and remember why you started this in the first place. You have the power to change your destiny. Now, go!

Person1: I've never been in a situation like this before. I don't know if I can do it.
Person2: That's exactly why you have to try. You want to wipe the slate clean, don't you? Prove to yourself that you're capable of more than you think.
Person1: But what if I fail? What if I'm not good enough?
Person2: Then you'll have a scar, something to remember. And I'll be right there with you, because I've never been one to shy away from a challenge. Come on, it'll be an experience you'll never forget.

Person1: You know, I'm really disappointed in you. You said you'd help me out, but it seems like you were just playing me all along.
Person2: I don't think that's fair. I was very clear about what I could and couldn't do. You're just trying to guilt trip me into giving you what you want.
Person1: Guilt trip? You're the one who's been playing games with people's emotions. And now, I have witnesses who can testify to your manipulative behavior.

Person1: You're not even close to being the leader I thought you'd be. I expected more from you.
Person2: I'm sorry I'm not the hero you envisioned. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this.
Person1: Why, are you not ready to take risks for the greater good? Don't you want to be remembered as a legend?
Person2: Of course I do, it's just that... I don't know if I can live up to your expectations.
Person1: Good. Then let's work together to make you a legend. Until then, feel free to act like one.

Person1: I've made up my mind, and I won't be swayed. If my career has had any meaning, that's the meaning.
Person2: Rachel, I'm not going to let you give up so easily. You're still reasonably talented, and I think you can bounce back from this.
Person1: Talents come and go, and people's opinions tire easily. Really think a has-been like you could last in this industry?
Person2: I'm not intimidated by you, Rachel. You're not as powerful as you think you are.
Person1: Oh, I've heard of people sacrificing their integrity to get ahead. And I've heard of people selling out to fit in. But I think you're onto something new, Mark. "Absolutely nothing"  it's a great way to describe your contribution to this project. I think it could catch on...
Person2: That's not fair, Rachel. I've tried to help you, and this is how you repay me?

Person1: I've got a spare ticket to the concert tonight. Want to join me?
Person2: I don't know, man. I'm not really in the mood.
Person1: What's wrong? You've been rather nice to me, in a couple of ways. And I'm grateful.
Person2: Look, I hate to be the kinda person who does someone a favor, then hits them up for a favor in return. But I'm afraid I gotta be that kinda person.
Person1: What do you mean? You need a favor from me?
Person2: Yeah, I need you to come with me to this art gallery opening. I've got a problem, and you can help me.
Person1: Why do I need to go to an art gallery opening to help you?
Person2: Because I've got a connection there, and I need someone to vouch for me. You've been nice to me, so I figure you owe me one.
Person1: I don't know...I wasn't planning on going out tonight.
Person2: Come on, man. I spent a lot of time helping you with your project. This is the least you can do for me.

Person1: You're about as close to being a team player as I am to being a saint. Come on, Rachel, you're only looking out for yourself.
Person2: That's not true! I care about the project's success.
Person1: Save it, Rachel. You'd sell us out to the highest bidder if it benefited you. I figure you for the kind of person who'd sabotage the whole operation just to get ahead.
Person2: You're one to talk, considering your own track record. You're the one who's been playing both sides against each other.
Person1: Hey, I'm just trying to get the job done. You're the one who's being selfish and reckless.
Person2: You're not even aware of your own motivations, are you? You're so caught up in your own ego that you can't see the damage you're causing. If you don't shape up and start working with the team, you're going to find yourself hanging by your ankles, figuratively speaking. Understand?
Person1: Okay, okay... I understand.

Person1: You're still reasonably charming, but that's about it. The fact you're still in this company is the one thing you've got going for you.
Person2: Oh, spare me the flattery, Rachel. I've heard of giving up a promotion to pursue a passion project. And I've heard of foregoing a passion project to climb the corporate ladder  but I think you're onto something new, Alex. "Absolutely nothing"  Has a ring to it. I think it could catch on...How's that for sarcasm?
Person1: Pretty good...Rachel, I don't want you to think I don't appreciate the opportunity you gave me. I've been a mess, and I'm still a mess. It's just...we have to start having a different conversation. I can't take your condescending tone anymore.
Person2: Very well  I'll bide my time  and as for you, my fine protg, it's true, I can't attend to you here and now as I'd like, but just try to stay out of my way. You're not as clever as you think you are, Alex.

Person1: You're playing with fire, Alex. Let her go before it's too late.
Person2: She's here because of you, Rachel. You're responsible for what happens to her now. If you care about her well-being, you'll advise her to take the deal I'm offering. Refuse, and you'll be the one to blame. The ball's in your court, Rachel. What's it going to be?
Person1: You're not fooling anyone with your false concern, Victor. You only care about advancing your own interests.
Person2: That's rich coming from you, Rachel. You're the one who's been using her to get ahead in your career. Don't pretend you're doing this out of the goodness of your heart.

Person1: You're not thinking clearly. Can you feel the weight of your decision?
Person2: I'm trying to make up my mind.
Person1: Can you feel my presence around you? I know you better than you know yourself.
Person2: That's not true. You're just trying to confuse me.
Person1: Am I? Or am I showing you the truth you're afraid to see? You're trapped, and I'm the only one who can set you free.

Person1: I'm not going to the party tonight. I'm too anxious.
Person2: Then why are you getting dressed up? You're not fooling anyone, least of all yourself.
Person1: I don't know, okay? Maybe I just want to feel like I have a choice.
Person2: Look, if you're not going to take this seriously, then maybe you should just stay home and watch TV. But if you're coming with me, then you need to commit. Otherwise, you're just holding me back.
Person1: You're not going to shoot me if I don't go, are you?
Person2: Don't be ridiculous. I'm trying to help you, not harm you. But you need to trust me and follow my lead.

Person1: I've been expecting you, Captain. You're quite the legend among the resistance.
Person2: Expecting me? I came for medical supplies and food. We've been ambushed by the enemy.
Person1: Ah, yes, the enemy. I've done a lot for this community, kept them safe and comfortable. After everything I've done...
Person2: I'm not here to discuss your accomplishments, sir. We need help, and we need it now.
Person1: Of course, of course. I'll provide what I can. But tell me, Captain, what makes you think you're the one to bring final justice to our people?
Person2: I'm not sure what you're insinuating, but I'm just trying to survive and protect my team.
Person1: No, no, Captain. I think you're more than that. You're a symbol of hope, and I'm willing to do whatever it takes to keep that hope alive.

Person1: I'm telling you, don't you ever question my judgment publicly again. You'll follow my orders and work with who I tell you to work with.
Person2: But, sir, can't you see the hand of fate in all this? We've tried to reason with her, and she's refused every time. Maybe it's time to accept that she's made her choice.
Person1: Fate? You think this is about fate? This is about power, and who's willing to do what it takes to get it. And I'm not going to let you or anyone else stand in my way.
Person2: But at what cost, sir? We're not just talking about her life, we're talking about the lives of everyone involved. Is it really worth it?
Person1: You're not thinking about the bigger picture, are you? You're too caught up in your own moral compass to see what needs to be done. I'm willing to make the hard choices, even if it means getting my hands dirty.

Person1: You're running away from yourself, mostly. You're miserable. You hate yourself. The world's full of people like you. Don't know what they want.
Person2: That's not true. I know exactly what I want. And I'm not going to let you take it away from me.
Person1: Oh, really? Then why are you so nervous? You can't duck this, Alex. I have the evidence right here. Your signature, the security footage, and the eyewitness account. And that'll be enough.
Person2: You're just trying to intimidate me. But it won't work. I'm not afraid of you.
Person1: We'll see about that. You're always chasing after something. In a couple of weeks, you'll be looking for the nearest exit. Mark my words.

Person1: You know I never stop you from anything. Believe me, you're at a wonderful age.
Person2: That's exactly what I'm afraid of. You're always so laid-back, but I need a direct answer now.
Person1: I'm just trying to show you how foolish you are. When you're older, you'll laugh at yourself for thinking this is so important.
Person2: Perhaps I'd better get you straightened out. You've been rather nice to me, in a couple of ways. And I'm grateful. But I don't think this entitles you to patronize me.
Person1: Nobody I'd rather have a heart-to-heart with. You're always so uptight, I just want to help you relax.
Person2: I appreciate the sentiment, but I need to make my own decisions. Can you just give me a straight answer for once?

Person1: I don't trust him. He's manipulating the truth.
Person2: Of course you're innocent. You couldn't do those terrible things. Come with me, and I'll show you the evidence.
Person1: How do you know I'm innocent? What do you expect me to do - ignore the warning signs and follow you blindly?
Person2: I need you to trust me. I have proof that will clear your name, but you have to come with me now.
Person1: What about the people I care about? Are they in danger too?
Person2: They're already safe. I've taken care of them. You're the only one who can help me now.

Person1: You're quite the charmer, aren't you, Victor? But I'm not afraid of you.
Person2: Oh, rubbish! You should be. I've got the upper hand here, and you know it.
Person1: Maybe so, but I've never met anyone like you, Victor. You're... intriguing.
Person2: (laughs) And you're quite the actress, aren't you? Trying to butter me up, thinking you can get the better of me.
Person1: (smirks) Maybe I am, maybe I'm not. But I do know that life will be much sweeter for me now that I've met you.
Person2: (scoffs) You think you can outmaneuver me? I'll have you know, I've been playing this game a lot longer than you.
Person1: (leans in) Oh, I'm not trying to outmaneuver you, Victor. I'm just trying to understand what makes you tick. And I think I'm getting close.
Person2: (smirks) You're not as clever as you think you are, darling. But I do love a good challenge.

Person1: I was wondering, have you seen my sister lately?
Person2: You're driving me crazy! Do you know what it's like trying to get some peace around here?
Person1: Not really. But I think I can help you find her if you calm down and listen to me.
Person2: You're off, you know? You're way, way off. You think you can just waltz in here and start giving orders?
Person1: I'm not giving orders, I'm trying to help. But you need to get yourself together, or you can forget about seeing her again. I mean it.
Person2: What you think, you know, doesn't have much to do with reality. I mean, I hope I'm not the first to say that about you.

Person1: You're so caught up in your own world, you've forgotten what it's like to be human. You'll become numb to the pain, just like I did.
Person2: Do you think that's true? You're just trying to make me feel better, aren't you?
Person1: Maybe. But you're not even listening to yourself. You're just a reflection of what others want you to be. You don't have the faintest idea what you're talking about.
Person2: That's not fair. You don't know me.
Person1: Oh, but I do. I know you're just a leaf blown by the wind, without any direction or purpose. You're just a boy, playing at being a man.
Person2: And what about you? You're just a master manipulator, using your words to control people.
Person1: Ah, but that's where you're wrong. I'm just a mirror, reflecting the truth back at you. You're the one who's afraid to look.

Person1: I think I've made up my mind.
Person2: Ah, of course. Your old instincts! You know I'll always be there to guide and support you, no matter what kind of decision you're making.
Person1: Wait a minute - what exactly did you just say? You're not trying to influence me, are you?
Person2: Influence you? No, no, no. I'm just reminding you of your own strengths. We did the right thing, didn't we?

Person1: You know what I mean? Like the way you react when I ask you questions about your past.
Person2: What's this about? You're not a journalist, are you?
Person1: No, no, nothing like that. I'm just curious about people's experiences. Everything about their experiences.
Person2: Like what?
Person1: Like what they've done, what they do, what they don't do, what they want to do but are afraid to ask for, what they won't do even if asked.
Person2: That's quite a range. And what's the purpose of this... inquiry?
Person1: I'm trying to understand what makes people tick. And I think you can help me with that.
Person2: I'm not sure I'm comfortable with this.
Person1: Oh, don't worry, it's all just for my own curiosity. I promise you, it'll be... enlightening. For both of us.
Person2: (pauses) Okay, fine. Ask your questions.
Person1: (smiling) Great. Let's start with something simple. What's the most spontaneous thing you've ever done?

Person1: What's the situation?
Person2: I've got a buyer for my last two pieces, but I need backup. This guy's been asking questions, and I don't know if I can trust him.
Person1: What makes you think you can't trust him?
Person2: He's been pushing for a better price, and I think he might try to lowball me. That's why I need you to come with me, just in case.
Person1: I'm not sure I'm comfortable with that. What's in it for me?
Person2: Let me finish. I'll give you a cut of the profit, and we can work out a deal that benefits both of us. But I need to know I can count on you.
Person1: Okay, I'm listening. What's the plan?
Person2: We'll meet him at the warehouse, and I'll do the talking. You just keep an eye out and make sure everything goes smoothly.
Person1: And what if it doesn't go smoothly?
Person2: That's why I need you, buddy. I need someone to watch my back. Can I trust you to do that for me?

Person1: You're being awfully quiet, like you're hiding something. Is there something you're not telling me?
Person2: It's just stress, I promise. I wouldn't steal anything from you, I'm honest.
Person1: Now, I wasn't talking to you, was I? Was I? I'm talking to myself, trying to figure out why I'm letting you stay here.
Person2: You're letting me stay because I have nowhere else to go. You're doing me a favor.
Person1: Ah, but it's not just about doing you a favor, is it? It's about control. You think I don't know what you're capable of? I've seen your kind before.
Person2: My kind? What are you talking about?
Person1: Don't play dumb with me. I know all about your little tricks and manipulations. You think you can just waltz in here and take advantage of me? Think again.

Person1: I thought you might be asleep.
Person2: I'm very sorry about that. I apologize.
Person1: Save it. You've lied to me for the last time. You're being choosy, and I won't stand for it.
Person2: You're not listening to what I'm saying. I said I was sorry.
Person1: Sorry? You're sorry? You're going to be sorry when I'm done with you. You're going to regret the day you ever crossed me.
Person2: I'm not afraid of you.
Person1: Oh, you should be. You should be very afraid. I'm giving you to the count of three to tell me the truth. One... two...
Person2: And if I don't?
Person1: Then you'll find out what it means to mess with me. Three.

Person1: You're playing with fire, kid. You think you can outsmart Victor LaGrange?
Person2: I'm not afraid of him. I've got connections.
Person1: Connections? Ha! Victor will swat you like a fly if you cross him. But I can help you... if you trust me.
Person2: What do you want in return?
Person1: Oh, just a little favor. You see, I've got a score to settle with Victor, and you can help me even the odds. If you want to stay alive, that is.
Person2: What makes you think I'm in danger?
Person1: Let's just say I have my ways of knowing these things. And if you don't play along, you'll be the one who's left holding the bag.

Person1: You're always so organized with our finances. Almost as good as you are at hiding the truth.
Person2: What are you talking about? I've been transparent about our expenses.
Person1: We need to be more responsible with our spending. I'm worried about our future.
Person2: You're just trying to deflect attention from your own mistakes. I've been on top of our bills, and you know it.
Person1: I always win, one way or another. Let's review the budget together tomorrow and see who's really in control.

Person1: You must think I'm guilty of something or you wouldn't be pushing me to take this role.
Person2: I didn't say anything. You must have a guilty conscience. What are you afraid of?
Person1: I'm not afraid of anything. You're just trying to get inside my head.
Person2: Maybe I am. Maybe I want to know what's really holding you back from playing "Cora".
Person1: You know exactly what's holding me back. I'm too old for the part, and you're just trying to make me admit it.
Person2: Age is just a number. You're as young as you want to be. Or at least, that's what you tell yourself, don't you?
Person1: What's that supposed to mean?
Person2: It means you're running from the truth. You're running from the fact that you're not as relevant as you used to be.
Person1: That's not true. I'm still a great actress.
Person2: Then prove it. Take the role and show me what you're capable of. Or are you just all talk?

Person1: You're going to use my words, okay?
Person2: Not if I can help it. You're not going to hold me hostage with this.
Person1: Oh, come on. I'm not trying to manipulate you. I just want what's best for you.
Person2: Save it. I know your tactics. You're trying to get me to do your bidding without me even realizing it.
Person1: That's not true. I'm just trying to guide you towards making the right decision.
Person2: Guide me? You're trying to control me. And I'm not going to let you.

Person1: I'm not sure I can trust you, unless I know more about what drives you.
Person2: What do you want to know? Are you afraid of what you might discover?
Person1: I think you're trying to distract me from the real issue. Don't take it personally.
Person2: Your words say caution, but your eyes say curiosity. Doesn't that thrill you, the uncertainty and intrigue swirling together?
Person1: I prefer my relationships straightforward.
Person2: Your tone says no, but your body language says you're intrigued.

Person1: You're making a fool out of me, and I won't stand for it. I had plans for us, but you're ruining everything.
Person2: I'm sorry, I just couldn't help myself. I feel about you the way I do, and I couldn't bear the thought of you leaving me behind.
Person1: Any woman's crazy to feel about a man the way you do about me. You're supposed to have some control and sense, not act like a nitwit.
Person2: I know, I know. But I wasn't thinking. I just wanted to be with you.

Person1: You think you're made for this kind of life? Few people are.
Person2: I've got collateral. This necklace, it's solid gold.
Person1: Who'd you steal it from? That thing looks like a fake to me.
Person2: My grandmother gave it to me. It's been passed down in my family for generations.
Person1: Yeah? Well, I've seen better craftsmanship at a flea market. You're not fooling anyone with that story.
Person2: You know, I've had enough of your insults. You can say what you want about me, but don't be dragging my grandmother into it. This necklace means the world to me.
Person1: Save it, kid. I've heard it all before. Loan denied!

Person1: You're hurting me!
Person2: What's the problem?
Person1: We're supposed to have a perfect vacation, now they're telling me that there was a mistake and we can't have the beachfront villa.
Person2: What kind of villa can we have?
Person1: Not the one I wanted. You're not taking this seriously.
Person2: I am. What do you want me to do?
Person1: You go down to the travel agency and straighten this out.
Person2: Honey, I don't have the time...
Person1: Do you love me?
Person2: Of course, I do. But we're leaving in two hours.
Person1: I need your help. If you really love me, you'll take care of this.
Person2: Fine. I'll go. But you owe me one.
Person1: I'll make it up to you. Come send me off before we leave.

Person1: I've never been one to take favors from strangers.
Person2: Strangers? You've been a regular at my club for months!
Person1: That may be, but I've always paid my way.
Person2: Paid your way? I've comped you drinks and rooms more times than I can count!
Person1: I'd rather not discuss that right now.
Person2: Liar. You're just trying to get something from me, aren't you?
Person1: You're being very...persuasive, as always.
Person2: (laughs) Persuasive? You mean manipulative?
Person1: (smiling) Oh, no, I wouldn't say that. But I do think we could help each other out, if we put our minds together.
Person2: (leaning in) I'm listening.
Person1: (leaning in closer) I have a certain...influence, let's say. And I think we could both benefit from it.
Person2: (raising an eyebrow) Influence? What kind of influence?
Person1: (smiling slyly) The kind that gets things done. And I think we could both use a little help in that department, don't you?

Person1: You're playing me, aren't you? 
Person2: You're a brilliant strategist, Alex. I'm a man who knows what I want.
Person1: So everything you just said was a lie?
Person2: Don't fade on me now, Alex. Not unless you wanna lose everything we've worked for.

Person1: You really think I'm just going to sit back and let you take control of this situation?
Person2: I sacrificed so much to make sure you were comfortable and happy. After everything I've done for you...
Person1: Is that what it is? Dollars? Money? I'll pay for it. Take it out of my salary.
Person2: It's not about that. I just wish you'd acknowledge and appreciate it sometimes.
Person1: You don't make enough to understand what's at stake here. You're just trying to keep me in line, but I know who's out to screw me.
Person2: I do appreciate it, but a relationship is a two-way street. We both have our parts to play.

Person1: You're always so hesitant to make long-term commitments. Why can't you be more decisive like Rachel?
Person2: Comparing me to others won't help, Alex. We all have our own paths. But I suppose you're implying that I'm incompetent, that I don't know what I'm doing.
Person1: That's not what I meant. I just wish you could explain your thought process to me. You're always so cryptic.
Person2: Perhaps I could explain, but then you'd just question my judgment, wouldn't you? You'd say I'm foolish for considering this option or that.
Person1: I just want to understand you better. I feel like we're not on the same page.
Person2: I understand what you're saying, Alex. But sometimes I think you're more interested in being right than in finding a solution that works for both of us.

Person1: You're a poet. You oughta be able to.
Person2: What did you say? You think I'm not good enough?
Person1: Shut up. You're just trying to prove yourself, but you're not going to make it.
Person2: That's not what I meant. You're trying to confuse me.
Person1: I'm just telling you the truth. You're not cut out for this.

Person1: You're not taking this seriously, are you? You need to get your act together and find a job, any job, so we can finally move forward.
Person2: Maybe I'm just not cut out for the whole adulting thing. Maybe I need a surrogate mother figure to guide me.
Person1: Oh, spare me the psychoanalysis. You're not some fragile, lost soul who needs coddling. You're just lazy.
Person2: That's not fair. You're always so quick to judge. Maybe if you apologized for your part in our situation, we could move forward.
Person1: Apologize? To you? You're the one who's been holding us back. I'm not going to waste my breath on some insincere apology just to make you feel better.
Person2: Fine, be that way. But I'm not going to change until you take responsibility for your own actions.

Person1: You're suffocating, aren't you? You need to break free from this toxic environment.
Person2: How did you know? I feel like I'm drowning in this relationship.
Person1: I can see it in your eyes. You're not the same person you used to be. You need to take a stand and fight back.
Person2: But I don't know if I can do it. I'm scared of being alone.
Person1: Alone? You're not alone. You have me. And I'll be with you every step of the way. We'll kill this toxic relationship together, and you'll rise from the ashes like a phoenix.
Person2: You really think so?
Person1: I know so. And remember, every time you take a step back from this relationship, you're honoring yourself. You're taking revenge on the person who's been holding you back.

Person1: I want the best for everyone. You can ask anyone in town. I've been nothing if not generous.
Person2: ...we worked together for, what was it, five years...? Now, the project we've been working on is confidential, not for public scrutiny... any more than are one's family matters...
Person1: Then I don't think so, Rachel. If nothing is going to change, I'd just as soon it not change in the way it hasn't been changing all this time.
Person2: You're being paranoid, Rachel. About the direction of the project, we may have had our differences of opinion... But, upon reflection... we've decided to expand our zone of comfort with you.
Person1: I appreciate all that, but I don't believe you can maintain project integrity without confidentiality agreements. I was paid well for my work. The benefits are good. The severance package is fair. I have no intention of violating my confidentiality agreement and disclosing that which I said I wouldn't.
Person2: Is that a threat, Rachel?

Person1: I'm sorry if my friendship with Rachel bothers you so much, but I happen to value having someone to talk to, especially when my own brother ignores me night and day because no matter what I say, it's wrong and no matter what I do, it's wrong...
Person2: You're proud of it, aren't you? Beating the whole country on that story. But that isn't what I got married for.
Person1: What do you mean? You're not going to start accusing me of using you again, are you?
Person2: Accusing you? You're the one who's been using me, manipulating me into staying in this toxic relationship.
Person1: That's not fair! I've been trying to make things work between us.
Person2: By controlling every aspect of my life? By making me feel guilty for wanting to pursue my own dreams?
Person1: You're being dramatic. I just want what's best for you.
Person2: What's best for you, you mean. You're not even listening to me. You never have.
Person1: That's not true! I've been trying to understand you, to connect with you on a deeper level.
Person2: Save it, Alex. I'm not buying it. You're just trying to keep me trapped in this cycle of emotional manipulation.
Person1: Fine, believe what you want. But you'll come crawling back when you realize you need me.
Person2: I doubt that. I'm finally taking back control of my life, and there's nothing you can do to stop me.

Person1: I had no idea how much I'd missed you.
Person2: You don't love me, do you?
Person1: I like, I know that we've definitely got something between us. Something good. Something special.
Person2: But you don't love me. You're just saying that to keep me around.
Person1: I didn't say that. I mean, love, it's like a term that gets thrown around. People say things, they get married, have kids, and then what? It's like they call it off, going "I was wrong."
Person2: You're trying to confuse me, aren't you? Make me doubt my own feelings.
Person1: I'm just being honest with you. I want to work with you again, make something special together.
Person2: I don't care about the project. I just want to know if you truly care about me.
Person1: Nothing would thrill me more  if it were possible. But let's focus on the project for now, shall we?

Person1: You want to take a look around the house or something?
Person2: I'm not leaving without finding those documents.
Person1: Look, Alex, the fact that we're colleagues... you know, close friends, well it sort of makes this a little strange, don't you think?
Person2: My boss is probably waiting for me to crack under the pressure, or at least he wishes I were. I've been working for him for 5 years and I don't have any intention of going back to the office to face him... so what I'm proposing is that since your project has hit a roadblock, and since you are standing here alone, I'm proposing that you and I do what makes sense. Share resources. Pass some time. That's all.

Person1: You're hiding something, I can see it in your eyes. Would you like me to leave so you can destroy the evidence?
Person2: Evidence of what? You're just trying to get inside my head, make me doubt myself. But I know what you're capable of, and I won't fall for it.

Person1: I've had enough of your constant questioning, Rachel. We've given you every opportunity to succeed, and all you do is doubt our methods.
Person2: This doesn't make sense. You're not listening to me.
Person1: I'm sick to death of your lack of trust. We can't do anything right for you, can we?
Person2: You're not who you say you are. I don't know who I'm cooperating with.
Person1: Rachel, Rachel, you're so naive. I've shown you my credentials, and you still refuse to see the truth. We're out of time. Shut off. Terminated. Understood?

Person1: You're stuck here all day?
Person2: I should at least have you, don't you think?
Person1: Not a word! Slippery shit!
Person2: If you get me to cover for you, he'll be a double direct heir and will end up taking the fall for you.
Person1: So, what - you're apologizing again?
Person2: What?
Person1: I heard you apologize. Why? You have every right in the world to be mad.
Person2: I know. You're just trying to get inside my head.
Person1: That seems to be the leitmotif in your life; ever backing down.
Person2: You're one to talk, always playing the victim.
Person1: Yes, you do. You always back down. You assume blame that isn't yours, you come in when called as opposed to enjoying your day off, you buckle like a belt.
Person2: You know what pisses me off the most? You're trying to make me feel guilty.
Person1: The fact that I'm right about your buckling?
Person2: I'm going to miss the meeting because of you.
Person1: Because you buckled. Again.
Person2: Would you shut the hell up with that shit? It's not helping.
Person1: Don't yell at me, pal. You're just proving my point.
Person2: Sorry. Not.
Person1: See? There you go again, apologizing for nothing.
Person2: I can't believe I'm going to miss the meeting because of your manipulation!
Person1: At least we're stuck here together, playing this game of cat and mouse.

Person1: You're right about that. So, this is your little secret?
Person2: I... I didn't think you would have any interest in this place... I mean, if you had told me you were coming, I would have warned you -- it's not like a real hideout or anything.
Person1: He wants us to follow. The little boy... He brought you to me, didn't he?
Person2: Oh God, no. This is just a trap I have set for myself. The real deal is off-limits.
Person1: Really? Can I see it? If you want to survive, trust me. Trust him.

Person1: You're so giving. It's not a criticism. We love you. We're grateful.
Person2: Don't you remember you told me you loved me, baby...?
Person1: Oh, wow! I didn't do anything wrong. You make it sound like I have no needs or something.
Person2: I like this. This album is all Carpenters covers by alt-rock bands. It's called If I Were a Carpenter.
Person1: You're grateful, but you resent me. You think I'm too self-sufficient?
Person2: You don't have to do that. What did you say your favorite band was?
Person1: Yeah, I definitely need to make you some CDs. At least while my kid is hanging out in there.

Person1: I've noticed you've been distant lately. Is everything okay?
Person2: Yeah, I'm fine. Just stressed with work.
Person1: I understand. You know, I've always been drawn to sensitive types like you. If I'm willing to take a chance, I might just get to know the real you - witty, adventurous, passionate, loving, loyal...
Person2: (laughs) You're quite the charmer, aren't you?
Person1: (smiling) Maybe. But seriously, I think we could have something special. You just need to open up to me.
Person2: I appreciate your interest, but I'm not sure I'm ready for that.
Person1: That's okay. I'm willing to wait. But don't think you can just push me away without a fight. I always put people first, and I expect the same in return.

Person1: You see my studio?
Person2: Yeah. Yours is nicer.
Person1: Oh, okay. Here it comes.
Person2: If you don't collaborate with me, I'll have to continue my protest. I'll perform wherever there's a stage. I'll turn them all into sold-out shows. The world will be crowded with my fans. I'll make you regret not working with me. Once you saved your career by taking a risk. This time you can save it by partnering with me.
Person1: Well, when it is a choice between my personal interest and the good of my art, how can I waver? No one shall say I was a bad artist.

Person1: I'll tell you what, let's you and me sneak out all by ourselves.
Person2: How do you know I'll agree to that?
Person1: Cause you got a little voice in your head saying, do the right thing. Give me another chance.
Person2: You're not even making sense, James. What's gotten into you?
Person1: Think of the fun we can have - we'll sneak down the back stairs and get in the valet's Ford. How's that?
Person2: You're trying to distract me, aren't you? Well, it won't work. I'm still upset about what you did last night.
Person1: Oh, come on. I said I was sorry. Don't you think it's time to forgive and forget?
Person2: Forgive and forget? You really don't get it, do you? You're not even sorry. You're just sorry you got caught.
Person1: That's not fair, Emily. I'm trying to make amends here.
Person2: Save it, James. I'm not buying it.

Person1: You're a brilliant artist, Rachel.
Person2: I gave you so much, Rachel. My time. My guidance. A successful exhibition. And how do you repay me? What's the thanks I get? You're still stuck on him, aren't you? You're still holding onto the past. Please, Rachel - it's only merciful to let go.

Person1: I'm not going to fire her, no matter what you say.
Person2: Who do you think you are, the king of this castle? Fire! Fire! Fire!
Person1: You're not hearing me, Rachel. What you think is yours, is really mine. And I don't care how hard I have to fight, I will get it back.
Person2: This is unbelievable. You're going to regret this, I promise you that.

Person1: And I love you too.
Person2: Ahh, there is yet time. For what, you ask? For me to decide your fate.
Person1: The moon is almost gone! What do you mean?
Person2: I mean that your love for me is conditional, and I am the one who sets the conditions. You will do as I say, when I say it.
Person1: But I thought we had an understanding...
Person2: Understanding? Ha! You are mine, and mine alone. Your own pleasure comes only after mine, when I desire it. And I desire it now.
Person1: I don't know if I want to love you...
Person2: Silence! You will love me, and you will obey me. I am the one who holds the power, and you are just a pawn in my game. Do not forget it.
Person1: I understand, Master.
Person2: Good. Then let us proceed. The night is young, and I have many more tricks up my sleeve.

Person1: You're not taking this seriously, are you? What kind of settlement do you seek? What are, for you, the parameters of the possible?
Person2: I'm taking it very seriously, but I'm not anti-you, I'm anti-this situation. Believe me, there's a difference. And by the way, have you considered 73 degrees as the optimal temperature for this office?
Person1: Don't change the subject. You're trying to distract me. I know your tactics. So, you propose that in spite of your mistakes, I should just forgive and forget?
Person2: Well, is that possible? Or would you rather I say something about your own questionable relationships, like the one with your new business partner?

Person1: I'll take care of the bill, don't worry about it.
Person2: Are you sure? You're being really generous.
Person1: At first, it will seem strange, but you'll come to understand. We'll be strong together.
Person2: You're not like other people, are you? There's something about you that's...different.
Person1: It's not bad, it's okay. Trust me.
Person2: I don't know if I can trust you. You're being really weird and I don't know why.

Person1: You have no right here!
Person2: I'm trying to protect you, ma'am. This man is a threat to your safety.
Person1: Get out! You're just trying to manipulate me.
Person2: I'm telling you the truth. He's got a history of violence.
Person1: You're just saying that to get me on your side.
Person2: I'm saying it because it's true. And I have evidence to prove it.
Person1: I don't believe you. You're just trying to control me.
Person2: I'm trying to help you. You're not thinking clearly.
Person1: I'm thinking perfectly clearly. And I know what you're trying to do.
Person2: Fine. But know that I'm only trying to help.

Person1: I'm not leaving without that necklace.
Person2: Shut up. I'm rich. I can buy you anything you want.
Person1: You're not buying me, Norma. I'm not some trinket to be won.
Person2: Oh, come on. I've got a million dollars. I own three blocks downtown. What's it for but to make you happy?
Person1: You're not making me happy, you're suffocating me. Cut out that "us" business.
Person2: Maybe someday you'll realize what's truly important. Not today, though.

Person1: You're a clever one, aren't you? I've never seen anyone like you. You've got a certain... je ne sais quoi.
Person2: What do you mean?
Person1: Oh, come on. You know exactly what I mean. You're a pretty face, and you're using it to get ahead. I'm not saying it's not working, but...
Person2: But what? You think I'm not qualified for this job?
Person1: Qualified? Ha! You're overqualified. But that's not what I'm talking about. I'm talking about the way you present yourself. You're a certain... type. And I think you know exactly what I'm getting at.
Person2: I'm not sure I do.
Person1: Don't play dumb with me. You're a smart girl. You know exactly what I'm saying. You're a trendsetter, and I need someone like you to lead the way. The majority of people are sheep, and they need to be led to the water. And I think you're just the person to do it.
Person2: I'm not sure I'm comfortable with that.
Person1: Comfortable? Ha! You're not here to be comfortable. You're here to make a statement. And if you can't do that, then maybe you're not the right person for the job.

Person1: Come in. I'd like to discuss the terms of our agreement.
Person2: I'm not sure I'm comfortable with that. You mean, if I don't like it, the deal is off?
Person1: Let's just say, I've never had a dissatisfied client. And I'm confident you'll be pleased with what I have to offer.
Person2: You're quite the salesman, aren't you? Trying to make me feel like I'm getting a gift.
Person1: (laughs) Perhaps. But I assure you, this is a mutually beneficial arrangement. Now, shall we proceed?

Person1: You're bound, remember? You can't talk about this to anyone.
Person2: I didn't say I loved you, baby. You must be thinking of someone else.
Person1: Don't play dumb. I know what you said. And I know you're tied to me now.
Person2: What are you talking about? You're scaring me.
Person1: Oh, don't be scared. I just want to make sure you understand the rules. You see, I have this album, If I Were a Carpenter... it's all Carpenters covers by alt-rock bands. I think you'll love it.
Person2: What does that have to do with anything?
Person1: Just a little something to remind you of our deal. And to show you I'm willing to make concessions. Now, let's discuss the terms of our agreement.

Person1: I wish you to return to your quarters immediately. Your presence is no longer required here.
Person2: Don't do this. Don't try to dismiss me. I've seen the pattern, and I know what's going on. You're trying to control me, just like you control everyone else.
Person1: I'm trying to protect you, just as I protect everyone else. You're not thinking clearly, and I fear for your safety.
Person2: My senses are keener than ever. I can smell the deceit, the manipulation. You're trying to make me doubt myself, but I won't fall for it.
Person1: You're being paranoid. I'm only trying to help. Why must you always resist?
Person2: Because I know what you're capable of. I know how you can make people do your bidding, how you can make them forget. I won't let that happen to me.

Person1: You're sorry now, aren't you? You're sorry you didn't take my advice.
Person2: I like the art the way it is. I don't need your influence to make it better.
Person1: Ah, but that's where you're wrong. You need a patron; I have the means. I could sponsor your next exhibition.
Person2: Why would you help me? You don't even know me.
Person1: I like your style, Alex. You paint with soul. And I think I could help you breathe some fire into the art world. You've got ambition like a...like a...blowtorch. You go for what you want and anything that gets in your way - PSSSHHT! - shish kebabs.
Person2: I'm not sure I'm comfortable with that kind of help.

Person1: You're going to have to trust me on this. I know exactly what I'm doing.
Person2: How do you know that? You told them?
Person1: No, I didn't say anything to them. I just have a feeling.
Person2: A feeling? You're going to risk our lives based on a feeling?
Person1: I've been in situations like this before. I know how to handle it.
Person2: Well, I don't know if I can trust your instincts. You're not exactly known for your good judgment.
Person1: That's not fair. I've gotten us out of tough spots before.
Person2: Yeah, but this is different. This is our lives we're talking about. If you're wrong, we're dead.
Person1: I'm not wrong. I'm telling you, I have this under control. You just need to have a little faith.
Person2: Faith? You want me to have faith in you? After everything that's happened?

Person1: You're not good enough to beat me, you little amateur. This is your last chance to get out of this without losing everything.
Person2: I know, but I mean, not losing everything physically? Or not losing everything emotionally?
Person1: Give it up! Just give it up. You're not fooling anyone, least of all yourself.
Person2: I see what you mean. But we're not fooling around, and we're not going to let you win.

Person1: You're not the one who knows how Jiffy Pop feels.
Person2: ARE YOU THE KILLER BEN? You want me to die? I thought you and I were tight.
Person1: Oh, c'mon... First the picture of Tammy, then Brett Clemens, now this? It's scary. You're just twisted enough to do all this just to get a dip or two.
Person2: Let me tell you "scary," Amber. Look at me. Do you wanna look like you been rode hard and put away wet at my age? I'm a "lifer" here. Best I can hope for is to end up in a decent "raisin ranch" where they'll change me twice a day. WOULD that impress you? IS that what it takes to impress the empress?

Person1: You know I'm trying to put something really big together out here. You know what I'm talking about, huh? You know!
Person2: Roderick, you know well enough that I have never loved but you! Was I ever so wretched that a kind word from you did not make me happy?
Person1: What're you doing? You're a square guy, for chrissakes. You can't treat him like that. He's gonna run to the authorities.
Person2: I married you, though I knew I was sealing my own fate in doing so, and in spite of reason and duty. What sacrifice do you want from me?
Person1: Where's your head? Where's your balls? Huh? You know I'm trying to make a name for myself out here.
Person2: I have always loved you. From the first moment I saw you, I saw your bad qualities, and trembled at your violence; but I could not help loving you.
Person1: You should say so. You're not gonna come along with me, are you?
Person2: I'll be honest with you. I don't wanna be involved in anything you're talking about.

Person1: You're a man who knows what I want.
Person2: It's complicated. I don't want to talk about this here.
Person1: Did something happen with Sarah? I saw you two arguing at the conference.
Person2: You're a beautiful mind, and I know how to get what I want from you.
Person1: So everything you just said was a lie?
Person2: Let's discuss it at home, where we can be more... comfortable.

Person1: You're all set for the internship. And here's your train ticket. You're on your way to Chicago.
Person2: Mom, I'm not ready to leave yet.
Person1: Rachel, for years we've been preparing you for this opportunity, and to keep you from getting tangled up with the wrong crowd. Like I saw last night at the party. You know who Alex is?
Person2: Who is he, Mom?
Person1: Who is he! Rachel, you're so naive and trusting, you wouldn't recognize a manipulator if he had you wrapped around his finger. You know who this Alex is? The son of Victor Martinez, a ruthless businessman with a reputation for crushing his competitors.
Person2: Are you trying to tell me Alex is the same?
Person1: I'm not trying to tell you he's a saint. It was necessary, what I did last night. I had to protect you from him.
Person2: Necessary? You knew I was falling for him, didn't you? You're trying to control my life, just like you always do.
Person1: Rachel, I'm only trying to guide you. You're so impressionable, and Alex has a way of getting what he wants from people. I promised your father I'd keep you safe.
Person2: Safe from what, Mom? From living my own life?

Person1: I need to discuss this with my team first. We can't reveal our strategy just yet.
Person2: Let me help you persuade them. I'll make it worth your while.
Person1: I appreciate the offer, but I think it's best if I handle it myself.
Person2: Fine, but if you want to see this project through, you'll need my resources. And I'm not sure I'm willing to provide them unless you're willing to listen to my proposal.

Person1: I'm telling you, it's a warning sign. You're not thinking clearly.
Person2: You're just trying to keep me away from her. To keep her for yourself.
Person1: I'm trying to protect you. She's not what she seems.
Person2: You're the one who's been acting strange lately. I think you're the one who's been manipulated.
Person1: I'm not the one who's been talking to her behind closed doors. What did she say to you, exactly?
Person2: She just wants to help us. You're the one who's being paranoid.
Person1: Help us? By altering the signal and infecting us with some kind of pheromone extract? You're not thinking, you're just following your heart.
Person2: You're the one who's not thinking. You're just trying to control me.

Person1: You're going to regret this, Mother.
Person2: Rachel, you're going to quit this rebellious phase immediately.
Person1: If I'm anything like you, I'll deserve the freedom to make my own choices.
Person2: What?! You'll do as I say, young lady!
Person1: If you truly care about me, Mother, then you better listen to what I have to say for once. I know you want the best for me, but you're suffocating me.

Person1: You're a master of deception. You realize that?
Person2: I'm a virtuoso of verbal sparring. 
Person1: You're supposed to be honest when you speak. Call me naive again.
Person2: You're a romantic who kills with wordsbut you're a romantic.
Person1: I love the way you twist my words! Have a cigar!
Person2: Evolution has made you a wordsmithwith a silver tongue. Simple butchers like you are obsolete!
Person1: I'm to be left behindin the dust of forgotten conversations?
Person2: If you're at home in the silence, and nowhere else.
Person1: This is going to become very cerebral. Are you prepared for that?
Person2: You're not such a creature of instinct that you'd hurt an unarmed mind.
Person1: I'm an honorable wordsmith?
Person2: Socrates.
Person1: You hope.
Person2: In any event, I will not beg for intellectual mercy.
Person1: No quarter asked. No quarter given.
Person2: Don't you laugh even inwardly at the clever tricks you play?
Person1: Cut me open. Find out.
Person2: I've planted a seed of doubt in your mind.
Person1: With skepticism?
Person2: I've poisoned your thoughts. You refused to listen. That's it! The poison is spreading, saying, "Obsolete, obsolete, obsolete," and, "Romantic, romantic, romantic."
Person1: Poison.
Person2: You have a very sharp mind, or I wouldn't have engaged you. That mind is now asking itself, cleverly and fairly, "Is Person1 really a romantic?" And the answer is, "Yes."
Person1: II really must congratulate you. Something is happening in there.
Person2: You can never take yourself seriously again! Look at all the minds you've manipulated! Did you deceive them with your words, as they were on their way to discovering the truth?
Person1: No. The magic of language you gave meI had it analyzed. It was discovered by a philosopher in ancient Greece!
Person1: I see.
Person2: You aren't going to manipulate me. You aren't going to manipulate anybody any more. Any clever trick will seem ridiculousto yourself!
Person1: Don Quixote.
Person2: My words are avenged!
Person1: Something seems to have happened to my self

Person1: You're really going to cast Rachel in the lead role? Have you any idea how humiliating that is for me? I'm the one who helped you get this project off the ground.
Person2: It's no big deal. We all compare. You took credit for my ideas, didn't you?
Person1: Who do you think you are? You're not even a real writer.
Person2: I'm the one who's going to make this novel a bestseller. And you're just a has-been trying to cling to the past.
Person1: You're just trying to get under my skin, aren't you? Well, it won't work. I know exactly what you're doing.
Person2: Oh, really? Then why are you getting so defensive? Maybe it's because you know I'm right. You're not as relevant as you used to be.
Person1: That's it, I've had enough of your condescending attitude. You think you're better than me just because you're younger and more "in touch" with the industry?
Person2: I don't think I'm better than you, I know I am. And it's not just about age or industry connections. It's about talent and dedication. Something you seem to have lost along the way.

Person1: I'm not complaining. That's the mark of a man. But I wouldn't want to be left alone. I don't think I could bear being left alone.
Person2: What do you mean, what am I gonna do? I'm in the same clothes for two days! I want to get a few of my things! Big deal!
Person1: Because my son is important to me. I want to like any girl he chooses. And I... I'm not quite sure how I feel about it.
Person2: Who knows what you're gonna do in there? I don't want you to get too comfortable.
Person1: I wish I were stronger. Do you think she's all right? Do you think she's safe at the school?
Person2: Is that so important, you liking me? I think it might also matter to my son.
Person1: Then I don't suppose it'll matter much to anyone but me. But I feel safer with him here.
Person2: I'll just clear up here, and then dress. Would you like me to go for her?

Person1: Trust me, I know what I'm doing.
Person2: Just keep your lying, heathenous trap shut, Jeremiah.
Person1: What's wrong with you? Can't you feel it? We're off course!
Person2: We're fine. Look at the instruments, we're okay!
Person1: They must be broken. I know what I saw!
Person2: You're not thinking clearly, Jeremiah. I'm trying to help you.
Person1: Help me? You're the one who's confused! We're lost!
Person2: Jeremiah, stop being paranoid. We're on track.

Person1: You're the only one who can do this, Alex. You owe me a favor.
Person2: What favor? You're the one who got me out of that mess in Cairo.
Person1: Exactly. And now I need you to retrieve a valuable artifact from the museum. It's a matter of national security.
Person2: Where have I heard this song before?
Person1: Don't play dumb, Alex. You know as well as I do that this artifact has the power to change the course of history. And I'm the only one who can make it happen.
Person2: Fine. But I'm not doing it for you. I'm doing it for myself.
Person1: Whatever you need to tell yourself, Alex. Just get it done.

Person1: You're not taking this seriously, are you? Sometimes you have to tell a small lie to get to the bigger truth.
Person2: I'm taking it very seriously. I've got a lot to lose if this gets out. You know, I've got a safety net set up in the Caymans, just in case.
Person1: A safety net? You mean like a secret bank account? If you can't be honest with me, I know people who can help me get to the truth.
Person2: Let's just say I have...insurance. And if you're not careful, you'll end up like Beaumont. You know, the guy I had to let go? He thought he could play both sides, but in the end, it was him or me. And I'm still standing.
Person1: What are you saying? That you'll do whatever it takes to protect yourself?
Person2: I'm saying that I'll do what's necessary to come out on top. And if you're smart, you'll do the same. So, are we on the same page?

Person1: I'm not used to it, I'm not ready for it... You know... I have never been so upset in my life.
Person2: Shall we?
Person1: What do you mean? You're not taking this seriously, are you?
Person2: I assume full responsibility. But isn't it better to look things squarely in the eye?
Person1: Oh, please... You're just trying to confuse me. Move over there. Let's make believe nothing happened.
Person2: And what about you? Why else would they have a severed wolf's head on a pike as their symbol?
Person1: That's not a symbol, it's a warning. You're trying to distract me, aren't you?
Person2: I think the only way to help ourselves is for us to be together.
Person1: No, I'm sure it won't. You're just trying to manipulate me. Please leave me alone.

Person1: I'm not asking for much, just a little more time.
Person2: You're not asking, you're begging. And that's a whole lot worse. You're not the one who knows what it's like to be stuck in this dead-end town.
Person1: That's not fair. You're making me feel guilty for wanting something better.
Person2: Guilty? You want to talk about guilty? I'm the one who's been rode hard and put away wet in this town. I'm the one who's been held back by people like you who are too afraid to take a chance.
Person1: That's it, I've had enough of your condescending attitude.
Person2: Oh, you've had enough? You think you've had enough? I've had enough of people like you who come and go, leaving the rest of us to deal with the consequences.

Person1: You have to come to the gathering tonight. For your own safety.
Person2: I'm not troubled. I just need some space.
Person1: Especially not around your brother. He's been saying some weird things lately.
Person2: You're unhappy, aren't you? You're just trying to distract me from your own problems.
Person1: It's like a fresh start party. Everyone's saying it's 'New Beginnings' time.
Person2: You're thinking of joining the community tonight? I thought you had something more romantic in mind.
Person1: I kind of like the idea that we can all start anew together, on the same night. It'll be a lot less scary.
Person2: Didn't you have something a little more private in mind for your first meeting?
Person1: You have to trust me on this one. It's for the best.

Person1: I'm telling you, I saw it with my own eyes.
Person2: You're not in awe of the truth, you're just trying to be independent. You want to be independent? Be independent now.
Person1: But I know what I saw. I'm not making it up.
Person2: That happens. People see what they want to see. You're just not respecting the power of perception.
Person1: I am respecting it. I'm trying to tell you what happened.
Person2: I don't have time for this. You should have been more prepared. Now, get the report and let's move on.
Person1: But it's not that simple. You're not listening to me.
Person2: I'm listening, but you're not making sense. You're just not thinking clearly. Maybe you need something to clear your head.

Person1: You always been this reckless?
Person2: I'm sorry, Alex. This is permanent. I've made up my mind.
Person1: Then that's all you had to say. You want to punish me, don't you?
Person2: I've already made an appointment with a mediator for later today.

Person1: You're crazy, Sophia. 
Person2: Any man's crazy to think he can control me the way you do. 
Person1: I asked for a simple favor and look what I got. Come on, sit down. 
Person2: And be trapped in your game? I think not.

Person1: You're looking great, how have you been?
Person2: There's nothing to discuss. You really caused a panic at the office party, and now HR is involved.
Person1: Oh, don't be so dramatic. It was just a little misunderstanding.
Person2: A misunderstanding? You spilled a drink on the CEO's wife! What if she decides to sue us?
Person1: Is that what it is? Dollars? Money? I'll pay for the dry cleaning. Take it out of my bonus.
Person2: You don't make enough to cover the damages. Besides, it's not just about the money. It's about your reckless behavior.
Person1: Maybe I don't make as much money as some of the top performers around here, but I don't play the same office politics. And I know who's out to sabotage me here.
Person2: What's that supposed to mean? Are you accusing me of something?
Person1: It means I know who's been talking behind my back, and I know who's trying to make me look bad. But I'm not going to let them get away with it.

Person1: You have to come with me to the meeting. It's a tradition.
Person2: I don't think that's a good idea. Do you know what kind of people will be there, waiting to pounce on any weakness? They'll devour you, and I don't just mean your ideas.

Person1: I've been thinking about what you said last time. How me trying to fit in with your crowd -- and constantly not -- is like a lot of people with addictions. How maybe I can't change who I am, ever...
Person2: You lied to me! You said you were one of us.
Person1: I would have lied to myself if I thought I'd believe it. I tried to get you to love me for who I'm not.
Person2: Well, congratulations! You pulled it off! But was it all for your sake, wasn't it? Having me here? Trying to get me to accept you?

Person1: Are you all right, Rachel? You look pale.
Person2: You don't have to be deliberately cruel just to impress me, I'm wrong. You're trying to scare me into quitting, but it won't work.
Person1: If anything, I'm making it sound easier. Let's face it, Rachel... you aren't made for this kind of pressure. Few people are. But if you don't take a seat and focus, you'll be the one who's dead.

Person1: You're not taking this seriously, are you?
Person2: What do you mean? I'm trying to understand.
Person1: I mean, you're not grasping the gravity of the situation. It's nothing personal, but sacrifices need to be made.
Person2: You like to brag, don't you? Thinking you're the only one who knows what's best.
Person1: I'm not bragging, I'm being realistic. And if you don't shape up, someone else will take your place.
Person2: You're talking about my family, my friends... how can you be so heartless?
Person1: I'm not being heartless, I'm being practical. You need to focus on the bigger picture.
Person2: The bigger picture? You're the one who's not seeing things clearly.

Person1: I take mine black. You're absolutely correct. The politicians don't want panic headlines spoiling the Festival of Love.
Person2: Tomorrow? I haven't even said I'll marry you yet.
Person1: Well, let's thank God you and I are on the case, then. We could go down and get our blood tests tomorrow.
Person2: Oh, my God, no! I'm a clinical hysteric, with panic syndrome, and anxiety neurosis, agoraphobic, I'm afraid of everything, real and imaginary.
Person1: I think you are. I really admire everything you've done; it would be an honor to work with you, and we need all the help we can get, especially yours.
Person2: You don't like or admire me, but the beautiful part is I don't give a care. That's the upside of having a breakdown.
Person1: We'll need our Birth Certificates. I happen to have mine with me. Where's yours?

Person1: I'm tired of this trip. We should have gone to Yellowstone.
Person2: Ah, come on, you're just homesick. It's only been three days!
Person1: Wait, have you thought this through, Rachel? At this point, technically, I doubt we could turn back without losing our deposit. So we still have a choice. We can push on and risk getting stuck in some godforsaken town, or if you want to play it another way...
Person2: Look, you were the one who wanted to do something different, something to tell all your friends. Any chump can go to Yellowstone.

Person1: You're suffocating me!
Person2: If I'm anything like you, I'll deserve your forgiveness.
Person1: What?! You think this is a joke?
Person2: I said, I'm sorry! But you need to understand, I'm trying to protect you from yourself.
Person1: Protect me? You're the one who's been lying to me all along!
Person2: I did it for your own good. You're not ready to hear the truth.
Person1: The truth? You're the one who's been hiding it from me! Let go of me!
Person2: Not until you calm down and listen to what I have to say.

Person1: I'm not a nice guy, Rachel. I'm not going to sugarcoat it.
Person2: Oh, I'm sorry. What you're saying is a big, brainless, pile of horse shit. No offense.
Person1: You think you're clever, don't you? Trying to turn my words against me.
Person2: I'm just trying to understand what you want from me. You're being very cryptic.
Person1: Cryptic? You want to talk about cryptic? You're the one who's been playing games with me all night.
Person2: Games? What are you talking about?
Person1: Don't play dumb, Rachel. I know what you're capable of. You're trying to get under my skin, and it's not going to work.
Person2: Maybe I'm just trying to have a conversation. Maybe I'm not as manipulative as you think I am.
Person1: Save it, Rachel. I'm not buying it.

Person1: I know what I'm doing, Rachel. Please, dear.
Person2: Who's the prisoner, Alex, you or me? You look kind of "captive" yourself.
Person1: I'm trying to help you, Rachel. I don't want you to get hurt.
Person2: I know a lot of people who didn't do anything till they met Victor. Believe me, Alex, I can take care of myself.
Person1: But I don't trust him, Rachel! He'd get you in a situation you can't control.
Person2: You're just trying to control me, Alex. You're not thinking about what's best for me.
Person1: I'm thinking about what's best for us, Rachel. You're not seeing things clearly.
Person2: I see things perfectly, Alex. You're the one who's not seeing things clearly.

Person1: You look terrible. You're exhausted. You practically live at that goddamn office. 
Person2: I'm thinking about getting out of town this week. You want to come with me?
Person1: What were you talking about? You know I can't just leave like that.
Person2: I've got some stuff to do this week, but I'm thinking maybe Thursday. Thursday after work.
Person1: You swear? You're not just saying that to get me to come with you?
Person2: Yeah. I swear on my life. You need a break, and I need your help with something.
Person2: You let me take care of your boss. You just pack your bags.
Person1: But I've got projects due. And what's this thing you need my help with?
Person2: There are ways to get extensions. And you'll see when we get there. It's a surprise.

Person1: You're messing up the story, now get it right!
Person2: What are you talking about? This is exactly how it happened.
Person1: No, I'm telling you, it's not fair. You're sabotaging me somehow.
Person2: Sabotage? You know I've got a lot at stake with this project. You know that.
Person1: Ever since the meeting, I've been worried that you'd been unhappy, or...
Person2: But then you've been so much better... I thought we were past this.
Person1: This isn't about you. This is something that's happening to me. It's not to get even...and it's not some warped bid for attention.
Person2: Sweetheart, I think you're reading too much into this. It's just a story.
Person1: No! Not sweetheart, no. I believe in what's happening. I don't want to, but I do. I guess I was foolish enough to think that would be enough for you.

Person1: I saw you in court.
Person2: It was necessary. Last night. You knew I was sitting on a fresh grave, didn't you?
Person1: I don't know what you're talking about. We never met in court or anyplace else.
Person2: That's true. I'll rephrase it. I've been watching you. You have a certain... reputation.
Person1: What do you want?
Person2: I want to know how you managed to get away with it. You're quite skilled at playing the system.
Person1: I didn't break any laws.
Person2: No, but you certainly bent them. I'm impressed. You have a talent for manipulation.
Person1: That's not true. You're just trying to get under my skin.
Person2: Am I? Or am I simply holding up a mirror to your true nature? You see, I've been studying your tactics, and I must say, I'm intrigued.
Person1: You're just trying to intimidate me.
Person2: Oh, no. I'm just trying to understand you. And perhaps, teach you a lesson. You see, I believe in the law, and I'm not too keen on those who think they're above it.
Person1: You're just a louse.
Person2: Ah, but I'm a louse who knows your secrets. And I'll be watching you.

Person1: I don't know what I'm supposed to say, Alex. I want to do the right thing here.
Person2: You made me have an abortion. You erased me from your life.
Person1: It was a mutual decision. I have a family, Rachel.
Person2: A family? You call that a family? You're just using them to avoid dealing with your own guilt.
Person1: That's not fair. I take full responsibility for my actions.
Person2: Responsibility? You're a master of manipulation, Alex. You always get what you want, no matter who you hurt.
Person1: I'm not trying to hurt you, Rachel. I just want to move on with my life.
Person2: Move on? You're trying to erase me from your past, just like you erased our child. You're a coward, Alex.
Person1: That's enough, Rachel. I've had enough of your accusations.
Person2: Oh, I'm just getting started. You want to know what our friends think of you? They think you're shallow, selfish, and afraid of commitment.

Person1: I'm telling you, I've got a shot at being a top model. Give me six months and I'll be on the cover of Vogue.
Person2: You're not even close to being good enough. You're just delusional.
Person1: You're just jealous because I've got the looks and the charm. You're more like Snoopy, cute but not taken seriously.
Person2: That's not fair. I've got my own strengths. And by the way, aren't you worried you'll die alone, never experiencing what it means to truly connect with someone?
Person1: Oh, please, I'll have no problem finding someone to love me. I'm tall, dark, and handsome. You, on the other hand, should be worried about dying a virgin.
Person2: That's not going to happen. And even if it did, it's not the end of the world. You're just trying to distract me from your own insecurities.
Person1: Insecurities? You're the one who's always trying to bring me down. I'm just trying to be real here, and you're mocking me.

Person1: I'm going to the city, to meet someone. Try to make some connections. I need it, the connections. I'll be leaving early in the morning.
Person2: Leave now. You don't know what real pressure is. This is light stuff.
Person1: Oh, grow up. I'm happy for all of us. It's just we have a great responsibility now.
Person2: Responsibility? You're hustling me, Alex. You've never stopped hustling me. What do you want me to do? Just sit here and wait? Faithful little Rachel. Pull the shades down and sit.
Person1: I got no idea of love. And neither have you. I mean, neither one of us would know what it was if we saw it coming down the street. You made me up, didn't you, Rachel? I wasn't real. You made me up, like everything else.
Person2: I'd know it, Alex. I'd know. For God's sakes, what are you trying to do to me? I love you. But you're not real, are you? You're just a creation of my mind, a way to escape the pressure.
Person1: Well, what's your idea of love? Chains? Or is it just a way to control me, to keep me from leaving?

Person1: You really have a way with words, don't you? I'm not saying I couldn't get to like you... in fact, I prefer it when there's some sort of mutual feeling between two people.
Person2: This is a war, Alex. You against me. Time for vengeance. The City's just in the way. Take me down. You and me. We'll work things out when the time is right.
Person1: Remember my promise. Don't threaten me. I tend to take these things seriously.
Person2: Oh, get it over with. What do you expect? You come in here, burn my bridges, kill my reputation and try to manipulate me...
Person1: No... right... this isn't manipulation, is it? I'm just trying to make a deal. You look like you could use a couple hours sleep.

Person1: I feel like you're not taking my concerns seriously. You're just brushing them off.
Person2: Maybe you're the one with the issue. You're always looking down, focusing on what's going wrong.
Person1: That's not fair. I just want to feel respected and valued in this relationship.
Person2: And I want to feel like I can trust you. But every time I try to apologize, you hold onto the past.
Person1: Because your apologies feel insincere. You're just trying to placate me, not actually listen to my concerns.
Person2: Perhaps if you looked at the big picture, you'd see that I'm trying to move forward. But you're stuck on what might be lost.
Person1: You're afraid of confronting the real issues, aren't you? You're just trying to control the narrative.
Person2: I'm trying to have a vision for our future together. But you're too busy dwelling on past hurts.

Person1: You'll have to watch Grandma tonight. I've got a meeting with a potential investor.
Person2: Not tonight, Mom. I've got a study group for my exam. You know how important that is.
Person1: Progress is a feast to be consumed, sweetie. You can't let fear hold you back. Your father would have wanted you to take risks.
Person2: Give me a break, Mom. You're not going to fill my head with that "follow your dreams" nonsense, are you?
Person1: I'm just saying, you need to prioritize. And right now, Grandma needs us more than your study group does.
Person2: That's not fair. You're always doing this, making me feel guilty for pursuing my own goals.
Person1: I'm just trying to guide you, honey. You'll understand when you're older.

Person1: You're so predictable, don't you think?
Person2: What do you mean?
Person1: I mean, you always fall for the same tricks. You're like a puppet on strings.
Person2: That's not true. I make my own decisions.
Person1: Really? Then why do you always end up doing what I want you to do?
Person2: Because I choose to, that's why.
Person1: Ah, but do you really? Or are you just trying to convince yourself that you're in control?
Person2: What's your point?
Person1: My point is that you're not as free as you think you are. And I'm the one holding the reins.
Person2: You're just trying to manipulate me, aren't you?
Person1: Maybe. But it's working, isn't it?

Person1: You said the vision, the images.  They're just that.  Just pictures.  They can't hurt you.
Person2: What was that?  Did you hear that?  It sounded like it came from the courtyard.
Person1: I lied.  It's not just pictures.  It's real.  And it's here.
Person2: My men take great delight in routing the enemy.  Don't trouble yourself, beauty.  It's nothing.
Person1: You're not listening to me.  You're not hearing what I'm saying.  You're just trying to distract me.
Person2: Maybe good things heal places.  Maybe that's all it takes.  And maybe I'm trying to help you.

Person1: I've fallen out of love with the idea of searching for ultimate knowledge.
Person2: What do you expect me to say? You've been consumed by this quest for so long.
Person1: I feel as if a weight has been lifted from my heart. How can I repay you for showing me the truth?
Person2: Join me in a new pursuit. Together, we can uncover the secrets of the human heart.
Person1: What makes you think I'm qualified for such a task?
Person2: The power was within you all along. I simply helped you realize it.
Person1: But how can I trust you? You're asking me to abandon everything I've worked for.
Person2: Have faith, my friend. There are more of us than you know, and together, we can achieve greatness.
Person1: I'm not sure I'm ready to take that leap.
Person2: Then let me ask you, what's the worst that could happen?

Person1: You can't always have it your own way, regardless of anything else that may have happened. Come on, Alex.
Person2: What good can you do? Why are you being so incredibly stupid? You're not even listening to me.
Person1: I'm listening, but you're not making any sense. You're just trying to distract me from what I want.
Person2: And what is it that you want? To control everything and everyone around you? That's not going to happen, Alex.
Person1: I'm not trying to control anyone. I just know what's best for me, and I won't let anyone stand in my way.
