Person2: That's exactly what I'm talking about. You're so caught up in your own ego that you can't see the harm you're causing.

Person1: I know you're trying to figure out where to start, but let's be real, you've been avoiding this conversation for months.
Person2: I had to leave, I couldn't stay after what happened.
Person1: Save it, I'm not buying it. You think you're the only one who's been hurt? You think you're the only one who's been left to pick up the pieces?
Person2: You don't understand, I'm trying to make things right.
Person1: Oh, I understand perfectly. You're trying to manipulate me into feeling sorry for you, into forgiving you without actually doing the work to earn it.
Person2: That's not fair, I'm trying to be honest with you.
Person1: Honest? You call that honest? You're just trying to get out of taking responsibility for your actions. You're trying to guilt trip me into letting you off the hook.
Person2: Maybe I am, but it's not just about you. It's about me, it's about us, it's about what we had and what we lost.
Person1: Spare me the theatrics, I'm not impressed. You want to make things right? Then start by being honest with yourself, and then maybe, just maybe, we can start to rebuild.
Person2: You're not going to make this easy for me, are you?
Person1: Why should I? You didn't make it easy for me when you left. You didn't make it easy for me when you stayed away for months. Now it's your turn to do the hard work.

Person1: You're not even trying to understand me. You're just pretending to care.
Person2: I'm not pretending. I fed her, just like I said. You're the one who's lying to yourself.
Person1: You're playing games with me, just like you always do. What do you want from me?
Person2: I want you to trust me for once. You know I wouldn't lie to you.
Person1: That's what I don't know. Why would you lie? That's the problem... I can't understand why anyone would lie.
Person2: Maybe it's because you're not really listening. You're just waiting for me to slip up so you can pounce. You're not even my real parent, but you're trying to control me like one.
Person1: How can you say that? I've always been there for you.
Person2: Yeah, when it's convenient for you. You're just trying to ease your own guilt. You don't really care about me or what I need.

Person1: I've been thinking about what you said last time, about how some things don't change. Maybe that's true for you, but I'm not so sure about myself. Where's my report, Rachel? I need it for the meeting today.
Person2: I don't know what you're talking about. You must be mistaken.
Person1: Don't play dumb with me. I know you had it last night. You're trying to distract me, aren't you? Make me doubt myself? Well, it won't work. I know what I'm capable of, and I won't let you undermine my confidence.

Person1: You said you were meeting me at the coffee shop, Alex.
Person2: I don't know what you're talking about. You told me to meet you at the park.
Person1: No, I never said that. You must have misunderstood.
Person2: You said it a million times! I even wrote it down in my planner.
Person1: I never told you to meet me at the park. You're just trying to get out of this.
Person2: Listen to you, baby, there are going to be beautiful people at the coffee shop. You can't sit home thinking about your ex.
Person1: What are you talking about? This has nothing to do with my ex.
Person2: You got it bad, baby. You need a change of scenery. We're going to the beach.
Person1: When? I didn't agree to that.
Person2: Tonight, baby. I'll pick you up in a half an hour. We'll stop at a cash machine on the way.
Person1: I'm not going to the beach. You're crazy.
Person2: Shut up -- yes you are. Now listen to me.

Person1: I need your help, Emma. You're the only one I can trust.
Person2: What about Dad? Shouldn't we tell him about the situation?
Person1: No, please, Emma. Don't mention it to him. He's already stressed about the business.
Person2: This is different, Alex. We can't just hide it. People are involved.
Person1: Just for a little while, Emma. Give me a chance to figure things out. You owe me that much.

Person1: You've got to trust me. It sounds silly but I know we were meant to meet.
Person2: How could you do this to me?
Person1: I'm in love with you. I was just trying to help.
Person2: Oh, come on... What kind of an excuse is that? You're just trying to control me.
Person1: I decided to trust you. Maybe I was wrong. Whose side are you on really?
Person2: Leave me alone! You're not very special.
Person1: It's the only thing you saved from the accident... It must be something very special.
Person2: You mean you were meant to hijack my life, make me crash, and have every security man in town looking for me?
Person1: Please, don't say that. I love you.

Person1: You're a hardcase too, ain't you?
Person2: Listen, I've got the documents. If you ever want to see your sister out of trouble, do exactly what I say. Bring the flash drive to the old warehouse at midnight.
Person1: The flash drive? I don't have that kind of access. You're bluffing.
Person2: Don't play dumb, Rachel! I know about the project. You're the only one who can get it.
Person1: I don't have it. That's why Michael went to Beijing. They caught him before he could bring it back.
Person2: Well, you better get it somehow. Midnight and come alone. If you don't, we'll leak the documents. You know what that would do to your sister's reputation.
Person1: You don't understand a thing, do you?
Person2: Rachel, you got to listen to me. All you got to do is just give up nice and quiet, just play it cool.

Person1: I'm not trying to control you, I'm just guiding you towards a better path. Trust me, I know what's best for you.
Person2: That's exactly what my ex used to say. And look how that turned out.
Person1: Ah, but I'm not your ex. I'm more like a... spiritual advisor. And I can assure you, my intentions are pure.
Person2: Save it. I've heard enough. Wear something more... respectable next time we meet.
Person1: (laughs) Oh, you're still stuck on that, aren't you? Fine, I'll wear a dress. But only if you acknowledge that I'm right about the path you're on.

Person1: I don't think you do.
Person2: What do you want, Rachel? You're not here to reminisce about old times.
Person1: Maybe I can help. Let's see... if one night I got up and packed up all my things and drove away without leaving so much as a note, and stayed away for months, I think what I'd want to do is come up with a well thought-out reason.
Person2: You're not going to lecture me about loyalty, are you? You, of all people, know what it's like to be in a tight spot.
Person1: Had to leave? Believe me, we all wanted to leave...but you know what? We stayed. You, on the other hand, have a habit of abandoning ship when things get rough.
Person2: That's not fair, Rachel. You know I had my reasons.
Person1: Reasons? You call that a reason? You're one year from your pension, and you're going to throw it all away for what? So you can clear your conscience?
Person2: You're not even listening to me. You're just trying to get under my skin.
Person1: Maybe I am. Maybe I want to see if you're still capable of feeling something. You used to be a man of principle, but now...now you're just a shell of your former self.
Person2: That's enough, Rachel. I've had enough of your games. You want to know what I'm thinking? I'm thinking that you're trying to distract me from the real issue here. And I'm not going to fall for it.

Person1: You're no seeker. You're negative. What's holding you back?
Person2: Oh please, don't even think it. You're the only person who ever... It's just... Can't you see I'm trying to escape?
Person1: Escape from what? From me? From us?
Person2: From the emptiness. From the feeling of being a sap.
Person1: I understand why you're here. But you're not prepared to face the truth, are you?
Person2: I'll face it, I'll find you, okay? I'll come to you. I will.
Person1: If you love me, you can wait, right? A month, six months, whatever it takes.
Person2: Time has a way of... revealing our true intentions.

Person1: You're living in a world that's been constructed to keep you in the dark. You feel it when you're stuck in traffic, or waiting in line, or paying your bills. It's the system that's been designed to control you.
Person2: What are you talking about? This is just life.
Person1: Exactly. This is just life. But what if I told you that you have the power to break free from this prison? That you can take control of your own destiny?
Person2: I don't know...I'm not sure I believe you.
Person1: That's exactly what they want you to think. They want you to doubt yourself, to doubt your own abilities. But I'm here to tell you that you have the power. You just need to take it.
Person2: Okay, fine. What do I need to do?
Person1: First, you need to trust me. You need to trust that I'm telling you the truth. And then, you need to be willing to take a leap of faith.
Person2: A leap of faith? What does that even mean?
Person1: It means being willing to let go of everything you think you know. It means being willing to take a chance on yourself. And it means being willing to fight for your freedom.
Person2: I...I don't know if I can do that.
Person1: That's exactly what they want you to think. But I'm telling you, you can do it. You just need to believe in yourself.

Person1: You're a liar. You lied to me to get what you want. Didn't you?
Person2: I'm sorry. I can't do it.
Person1: Can't do what? You're already doing it. You're playing me like a fool.
Person2: I never do more than one favor. I'm sorry.
Person1: Favor? You call this a favor? You're using me for your own gain.
Person2: I would. You'll have to get somebody else.
Person1: Now who the hell is going to do that for me? You're the only one I trust.
Person2: I'm sure a substantial number of people in this town would volunteer.
Person1: But I want you to do it, I want somebody who will ask the right questions and everything, somebody I can play to and feel safe because you can't do anything.
Person2: Ouch. Okay, I deserved that. Look, after the first time it's just not spontaneous. There's no edge anymore.
Person1: So make an exception. Just this once.
Person2: No. I would know.

Person1: I'm not sure I'm comfortable with this plan, sir.
Person2: If you want, I can find someone else who has the balls to see it through. Which will it be?
Person1: I just think we should consider the consequences of our actions. We're not just talking about numbers, we're talking about people's lives.
Person2: Look, I know it's hard, but there are some things we must do in life that are unpleasant. Some choices must be made that are difficult. Nonetheless, we must make them. Besides, this may be more than a simple question of our own success, it may be a matter of the entire company's survival.
Person1: That's exactly what I'm worried about. I don't want to be responsible for the downfall of the company.
Person2: You're not thinking big enough. You're not thinking about the long game. If we don't make these tough decisions now, we'll be left behind. And if you're not willing to make them, then maybe you're not the right person for this job.
Person1: I understand what you're saying, sir. I'll make sure it's done.

Person1: You're conning me, sweetheart. I ain't responsible for no baby.
Person2: It's a terrible thing to know something no one else wants to believe.
Person1: What are you talking about? You're not making any sense.
Person2: You looked just like your father... The first time I saw you, I knew you were trouble.
Person1: That's not fair. You're the one who came to me for help, remember?
Person2: I didn't want to bug you. I thought I could handle it on my own, but I couldn't.
Person1: Handle what? You're not telling me the truth. You're hiding something.
Person2: You're a cold-hearted bastard, aren't you? How'd you ever get so mean?
Person1: I'm just trying to get to the bottom of this. You're not making it easy for me.
Person2: Maybe I should just leave. You're not going to help me anyway.
Person1: Oh, no, don't go. I'm just getting started. I want to know what's really going on here.
Person2: You want to know? Fine. I'll tell you. But you're not going to like it.

Person1: You're not taking this seriously, are you?
Person2: Should I be?
Person1: Most people would be, considering the consequences.
Person2: I'm not most people.
Person1: No, you're not. You're someone who's been in tight spots before. You know how to handle yourself.
Person2: What's that supposed to mean?
Person1: It means you're not as innocent as you're pretending to be. You've had to fight for survival before.
Person2: So what if I have? That doesn't mean I'm capable of...
Person1: Capable of what? Finishing what you started? You were there, weren't you? You were in the middle of it all, waving your flag, screaming and yelling...
Person2: That's not fair. You're twisting my words.
Person1: Am I? Or am I just holding up a mirror to your true self?

Person1: I'm not sure I can do this, Mom. I've got a lot on my plate.
Person2: You'll have to find a way, sweetie. We're under a lot of pressure and I know you're not thinking straight.
Person1: That's not fair. You're always saying I'm not thinking clearly, but maybe you're the one who's cracking.
Person2: Oh, so now you're questioning my judgment? I'm just trying to help you, but you're not listening.
Person1: I am listening, but you're not giving me a choice. You're always telling me what to do, without considering how I feel.
Person2: Feelings don't matter right now, what matters is getting this done. And I know you can do it, if you just focus.

Person1: You'd be surprised what horrors a person is capable of.
Person2: Remember how talkative I was? In the interrogation room? You said I do that when I'm nervous.
Person1: Yes, and you kept touching me, feeling my arm. Trying to establish a connection, perhaps?
Person2: Yeah, but in a nice way. You're trying to distract me, aren't you? From what really happened that night.
Person1: I'm just trying to understand you, David. You're not making it easy.
Person2: You're not listening to me. You're just trying to fit my story into your own narrative. I know what I saw, and it wasn't human.
Person1: David, please. The police are satisfied. I'm certain that if a monster were out roaming the city, we'd have seen it on the news.
Person2: You really think I'm crazy, don't you? That's what you're trying to make me believe.

Person1: You're sweatin'. What's wrong with you?
Person2: I'll be okay. I just need some fresh air. It's probably something I ate.
Person1: You're not gonna get married, you know. Whatever it is that women like, you ain't got it.
Person2: That's not true! I've had plenty of girls interested in me.
Person1: Oh, really? Then why are you so nervous around them? You're like a bug, always getting brushed off.
Person2: That's not fair! You don't know what it's like to be in my shoes.
Person1: I don't wanna get hurt no more, either. But you're just gonna keep getting hurt if you don't face some facts.
Person2: Like what?
Person1: Like you're not good enough. You're not confident. You're paranoid.
Person2: That's it, I've had enough of your insults! I'm out of here.
Person1: Oh, don't go. I was just trying to help you see the truth.

Person1: You know my friend Rachel? Her daughter, the journalist? She's always getting awards and recognition. What a star she is. Instead of wasting your time on that art degree, why don't you pursue something more respectable?
Person2: Maybe I didn't know what I wanted like you did. But I'm trying to make a difference. And I owe it to myself to take a stand. It's a quest, like, uh, finding my own identity. Except instead of searching for answers, I'm creating my own.
Person1: When I'm at the country club with all the ladies, everyone has what to talk about with their kids. They show pictures. Their kids are successful and accomplished. Why can't I show a picture?
Person2: You're not listening to me. I'm not doing this for you or your friends. I'm doing it for myself.

Person1: I've got a proposition for you, partner. We've been riding together for a while now, and I think it's time we settle down.
Person2: You're not thinking of quitting, are you? You're the one who loves getting shot at, who loves riding out of town with a posse at my back.
Person1: That's not the point. The point is, I've got a score to settle with the authorities, and I need your help.
Person2: You're in big trouble, aren't you? You're the one who needs to do some thinking, not me.
Person1: Don't play dumb, Frank. I know you've been thinking about going back to farming. But I need you now more than ever.
Person2: Maybe it started out that way, but now... I'm not sure I can trust you, Rhodes.
Person1: Trust me? You're the one who's been holding me back, keeping me from getting what I want. I'm doing this for us, for our future.

Person1: You're skating on thin ice already, young man, so I wouldn't push my luck.
Person2: What are you talking about? I'm not doing anything wrong.
Person1: Don't play dumb with me. I know you're hiding something. You're afraid of me.
Person2: What do you mean? I'm not afraid of you.
Person1: Then why won't you tell me the truth? You're afraid that I won't love you back.
Person2: That's not it at all. You're just trying to manipulate me into saying something I don't want to say.
Person1: I'm not trying to manipulate you. I just want to know what's going on. You're the one who's being dishonest.
Person2: I'm not being dishonest. You're just trying to control me.
Person1: Control you? You're the one who's trying to control the situation by not telling me the truth.
Person2: I'm not trying to control anything. I just don't want to get hurt.
Person1: You're already hurting me by not being honest with me. If you really cared about me, you'd tell me the truth.
Person2: That's not fair. You're just trying to guilt trip me into saying something I don't want to say.
Person1: I'm not trying to guilt trip you. I just want to know what's going on. You're the one who's being unfair by not being honest with me.

Person1: You're a lawyer. You manipulate people every day.
Person2: That's different. I'm not going to do it.
Person1: I saw the messages on your phone. Who's Emily?
Person2: It's not what you think. She's just a client.
Person1: You've been working with her a lot lately. I don't think I can trust you.
Person2: And now you tell me? You're one to talk about trust.

Person1: You're taking all the fun out of it. We need to think about everyone now, especially the kid. How scared is she gonna be out there?
Person2: Oh, don't use her like that, for a smoke screen. You're just trying to distract me from your own fear.
Person1: My own fear? You're the one who's been manipulating me from the start. Look at yourself, you're turning me into jelly. What do you want to be, one of those losers who walk down the halls holding hands and smiling?
Person2: That's not fair. I'm just trying to help you see the truth. You're the one who's been holding back, afraid to take a stand. If not for me, then do it for yourself. Get rid of your doubts and fears.

Person1: Is that the report you've been working on?
Person2: You'll regret not taking my advice if you don't sit down and listen to me right now.
Person1: What's gotten into you? You're being really aggressive today.
Person2: I'm being aggressive? You're the one who's being reckless with your decisions. Wear something more professional tomorrow, like a suit.

Person1: You're really pissing me off. I thought we agreed on a plan.
Person2: Just take it easy, man. We can figure this out.
Person1: Did I not make myself clear? You're not taking this seriously.
Person2: I am taking it seriously, but you're being reckless. You're not thinking this through.
Person1: You're hiding behind your "let's take it easy" attitude again. That's not going to get us out of this situation.
Person2: I'm trying to calm you down, but you're not listening.

Person1: You're really going to do this, aren't you? Bring your entire collection of antique vases into our shared space?
Person2: Is this another one of your games? You're just trying to get a rise out of me.
Person1: I'm trying to have a reasonable conversation, but you always have to make it about you. Move out or ring out, those are your options.
Person2: Oh, spare me the drama. I've got more important things to deal with than your petty complaints.

Person1: You're afraid of the competition out there, aren't you? That's why you're stuck in this mundane routine.
Person2: I'm not afraid of anything. I just like to keep things simple.
Person1: Simple? You call this simple? This is stagnation. I'm always looking for the new experience, like this art exhibition. I loved it.
Person2: Thank you. But when you take these opportunities don't you think you're wronging others who might have deserved them more?
Person1: What others, Rachel? We don't own anything. It's a transitory world. We come into this industry with nothing, and we leave with nothing, so isn't "deserving" a little absurd?
Person2: Still, I think you'd upset people and I'm not sure that's right.
Person1: Well, if some people are upset because they feel they have a hold on some opportunities, then I'm merely acting as a gentle reminder - I'm sort of breaking it easy. Here today, gone tomorrow, so don't get attached to things. Now, with that in mind, I'm not against collecting experiences...

Person1: You always challenge my opinions, but I know you care about me.
Person2: What are you talkin' about? You think I care about you after what you did?
Person1: Don't pretend no more. I know you let him take advantage of me, and now you're trying to justify it.
Person2: That's not what I'm doing. I'm trying to explain why I made the choices I did.
Person1: You're just trying to navigate this conversation to make yourself look better. But I'm not buying it.
Person2: Maybe we just need to learn how to communicate better. Our differences don't have to tear us apart.
Person1: You're right, but it's hard when I feel like you're still manipulating me.

Person1: You're not thinking clearly. Don't you remember what we promised to each other? Honesty, trust! You deserve someone who will rule your heart with kindness, not cruelty.
Person2: I'm not blind to your intentions. You're trying to make me forget what I've lost, what I've loved. But can you love me for who I am, not for what I can give you?

Person1: I know this.
Person2: You look like her, now. Go up the stairs.
Person1: I'm listening. I want to stop being haunted.
Person2: Take me away... You're my second chance.
Person1: Jesus Christ, I said I'm listening. You trust that Mook too much.
Person2: No! I know so. He, them, they're not to be trusted.
Person1: How do you know this? You really think so?
Person2: I know. You're my way out. Go up the stairs, I'll follow.

Person1: I've been thinking about my past a lot lately. What's your worst memory of childhood?
Person2: Why do you want to know? You're not exactly being friendly.
Person1: I'm just trying to make conversation. You'd like me if you got to know me.
Person2: Every person who's tried to get close to me has an ulterior motive. What's yours?

Person1: I'm not impressed with your progress. I thought we were going to tone down that flabby ego.
Person2: Sugar and cream for the self-absorbed; I take mine with a pinch of humility. You're absolutely correct, the politicians don't want panic headlines spoiling their own reputations.
Person1: Well, let's thank God you and I are on the case, then. Would you want to work with me on this?
Person2: Oh, my God, no! I'm a clinical cynic, with a healthy dose of skepticism, and a dash of paranoia. I never leave my comfort zone now. Nobody ever challenges me here. I just wanted to get your attention.
Person1: I think you're more capable than you let on. I really admire everything you've done; it would be an honor to work with you, and we need all the help we can get, especially yours.
Person2: That's so much flattery, you don't like or admire me, but the beautiful part is I don't give a care. That's the upside of being a contrarian.
Person1: Well, it's a hell of a facade you've got here. I'm living one step away from the truth, myself, but I get to go to work every day, wading in bureaucratic red tape. I guess the books you wrote about these self-serving politicians paid off pretty good.
Person2: Will you leave. Make them leave.
Person1: You can't go out lecturing? Tough shit. The truth is dying. Where can I lay this stuff out?

Person1: You're very disturbed, aren't you? You're letting your emotions cloud your judgment. That's her sister, not her father.
Person2: Get her away from him. He's responsible for everything. Get her away from him!
Person1: I think you're the one who needs to take a step back. You're not thinking clearly. Defending yourself is one thing, but accusing others without evidence is another.
Person2: I'm not accusing anyone. I'm just stating the truth. And I'm not the one who's been manipulating her all along.
Person1: Manipulating her? You're the one who's been playing on her emotions, using her for your own gain. Don't pretend to be the victim here.

Person1: So you're playing hard to get, huh? Well, just watch your step, or I'll make sure everyone knows what you're really after.
Person2: And what game did you want to play? You think you can buy me off with a few favors, and I'll fall into line?
Person1: Wouldn't do for one of your kind to get too comfortable, would it? I'm counting on you to keep your priorities straight.
Person2: I understand. You want to make sure I know my place.
Person1: That's right. And I'll make sure the right people know about our little arrangement.

Person1: You're not going anywhere until I get to see what's really going on.
Person2: I don't know what you're talking about.
Person1: Don't play dumb with me. I know you've been hiding something.
Person2: You're just paranoid because you're not getting what you want from me.
Person1: Oh, I'm not getting what I want? You're the one who's been stringing me along, making promises you have no intention of keeping.
Person2: That's not true. You're just trying to control me.
Person1: Control you? You're the one who's been playing games with me from the start. I'm just trying to get to the truth.
Person2: The truth is, you're not as important to me as you think you are.
Person1: Fine. If that's how you want to play it, then maybe I'll just take what I want and leave you in the dust.

Person1: You're not thinking clearly, Rachel. This merger is a done deal.
Person2: At least I'm honest with myself, unlike some people who are too soft to make tough decisions.
Person1: What's that supposed to mean? You're not even making sense.
Person2: Oh, I'm making perfect sense. You're just too afraid to listen. You're seeing this merger as a way to save your own skin, but I'm seeing it for what it really is - a disaster waiting to happen.
Person1: You're just trying to confuse me, to make me doubt myself. Well, it won't work. I know what I'm doing.
Person2: Do you? Or are you just trying to convince yourself that you're making the right decision?

Person1: I thought you would be on your way by now. Is there something you wanted?
Person2: Wait. Stop. You don't seem to understand. You're not really comprehending any of this. I'm not who you think I am.
Person1: I don't think we have anything to talk about.
Person2: What about us? Don't you recognize me? I'm the one who's been leaving you messages.
Person1: There is no us, remember? You're just trying to confuse me.
Person2: Except I can still see the fear in your eyes. You know I'm telling the truth. I'm the one who's been watching you.
Person1: Stop it. You're scaring me.
Person2: Why? Am I making you uncomfortable? You should be. You're in danger, and I'm the only one who can save you.
Person1: I don't believe you. You're just trying to manipulate me.
Person2: I'm trying to wake you up. You're living in a dream world, and I'm the only one who can show you the truth.

Person1: You're too damned nice, that's your problem. Nice gets you nothin' in this town. You gotta be a killer to get ahead, you know what I'm sayin'?
Person2: What are you talking about? I have no idea what you're getting at.
Person1: Don't play dumb with me. I have the evidence right here. Your signature, the hospital log, and the toxicology report. You can't duck this.
Person2: You're crazy. I don't know what kind of game you're playing, but I'm not buying it.
Person1: Get your hands away from the desk! You're not going to intimidate me. I'm not going to let you get away with this.

Person1: You're going to throw away your talent for some fleeting high with a musician that you misguidedly think is the one?
Person2: I love him, mom.
Person1: Ahh, sunshine. You're going to be late if you don't hurry up and change soon.
Person2: What's wrong with what I got on? It's not like I'm wearing dirty laundry.
Person1: You're skating on thin ice already, young one, so I wouldn't push my luck. You know how your father feels about this whole situation.
Person2: Here's the ticket to the concert. You can sell it and make some money back.
Person1: No way. You keep the ticket. You'll come to your senses.

Person1: You're assigned, we're assigned, to uncover the truth. I have to tell you, I'm not comfortable with your methods.
Person2: I love you, Alex. I've always loved you. I only wanted to be in your thoughts, to bring myself into your thoughts - so I could be as we are now.
Person1: Explain this to me --- why would you hurt him...?! Answer me. You're playing with fire, and I won't let you get away with it.
Person2: It's quite advanced, the way I've been manipulating the evidence. The original report listed it as "unexplained phenomena." Same pattern, the same MO, as the previous cases.
Person1: You're trying to control me, to make me doubt myself. But I won't fall for it. You're a master manipulator, but I see right through you.
Person2: You're just scared because you're starting to realize the truth. And when you do, you'll come crawling back to me.

Person1: You think you're clever, don't you, Victor? Playing tricks on me like I'm one of your foolish pawns.
Person2: I don't know what you're talking about, Lavinia. Perhaps you're confusing me with someone else.
Person1: Oh, rubbish! You have no power here. Be gone, before I expose your little games to the entire town.
Person2: I'm shaking in my boots, Lavinia. But I think you'll find that I'm not so easily intimidated. You see, I've been watching you, studying your moves. And I know exactly how to stay one step ahead of you.
Person1: We'll see about that, Victor. Mark my words, I'll bide my time, and when the moment is right, I'll show you exactly who's in control here.

Person1: I've got half the city's police department breathing down my neck. I don't have time for your games, Senator.
Person2: One loud whistle will bring my team in here instantly. You won't get very far. Think it over.
Person1: If I were here to deceive you, I would have done it already.
Person2: That's...a comfort to hear. What's this problem you need my help with, exactly?
Person1: Only you can help me, Senator. And I'm also sorry to say, my problem is your problem now.

Person1: You tell me.
Person2: You're more beautiful when you're uncertain.

Person1: You think you're so smart, don't you? You wanted to be near me, to get what you want.
Person2: I didn't mean to deceive you. I just needed help, and I didn't know where else to turn.
Person1: Save it. You're lying to me, and I know it. You're trying to manipulate me, to get me to do what you want.
Person2: That's not true. I'm telling you the truth. My daughter was in an accident, and I needed the money to pay for her treatment.
Person1: Motherhood, huh? You expect me to buy that? You're just trying to play on my emotions, to get me to feel sorry for you.
Person2: It's the truth, I swear. I've never lied to you before.
Person1: You want to talk to me straight up? Then tell me why you really came to me, and what you're really after.

Person1: Is that so? You might help me?
Person2: I don't know. I thought we were getting on here!
Person1: Shut up! I just want to know if you're willing to assist me in this matter.
Person2: Hey, that's whacked! What's in it for me?
Person1: If it is successful, there will be more. You'll receive instructions for the next step, half an hour before it is to be made.
Person2: I don't know what's happening. You're being really pushy about this.
Person1: You mean you're confused? That's exactly what I'm counting on.

Person1: You're playing with fire, sweetheart. You think you can outsmart Victor LaPierre?
Person2: I'm not afraid of him. I've got connections.
Person1: Connections? Ha! LaPierre will swat you like a fly if you cross him. You're just a pawn in his game.
Person2: I've got insurance. I've got something on him.
Person1: Oh, really? What makes you think that's enough to protect you?
Person2: Because I've got proof. And I'm not afraid to use it.
Person1: Proof? You think a little blackmail is going to save you? LaPierre will crush you.
Person2: Maybe. But I've got a plan. And I've got someone who can help me.
Person1: Who's that?
Person2: Someone who can ask the right questions. Someone I can trust.
Person1: And who might that be?
Person2: You. If you're willing to play along.

Person1: You're still playing with fire, aren't you?
Person2: What did you tell the police?
Person1: Nothing about your little secret. Yet.
Person2: You're just trying to scare me.
Person1: Scare you? I'm giving you a chance to make things right. You can live or die by your choices... You let me in and you've got a chance to redeem yourself. Otherwise, your reputation gets ventilated.
Person2: And what makes you think I care about my reputation?
Person1: Because I know you, and I know what you're capable of. Now, are you going to cooperate or do we do this the hard way?

Person1: Tell me something, Rachel. Are you naive, arrogant, or just blind? I think for you, we should go for "honest".
Person2: What are you talking about, Michael? You're the one who's been playing games with me from the start!
Person1: Oh, I'm just trying to educate you, Rachel. It's nothing personal. You don't see that?!

Person1: You're hurting.
Person2: Stop the nervous cry-baby routine... You're mine now... I'll wipe away those tears and make you happy... Come on, let's get outta here.
Person1: Where we goin'? You won't cheat me, will you? You'll stay with me. Help me.
Person2: Got word the kids are moving through Texas... I think an ending is being arranged there... Come on, lemme see a smile. We belong to each other now, for better or worse...

Person1: You're so low! Look at that beautiful opportunity. You haven't taken it.
Person2: Sorry. At least you've got a clear conscience. I don't have that luxury anymore.
Person1: All the more reason to take the job. What's your worst memory of childhood?
Person2: Why do you want to know?
Person1: I want to know if you're capable of making tough decisions. You know, your ex-partner was always holding you back. She was against everything ambitious you ever wanted to do.
Person2: That's not true. You don't know what you're talking about.
Person1: I know her for what she is now - a obstacle to your success. You were meant for greater things.

Person1: You're not going to tell anyone about this, are you?
Person2: Not use my words, please!
Person1: You'd do it if you cared about me.
Person2: That's not fair, you're trying to guilt trip me.
Person1: And what about our secret? Where does that stand in your priorities?
Person2: You know I'm committed to keeping it, but love isn't about control.

Person1: You go around here expecting applause for the way you treated this child. But let me tell you, I've been watching you, and I know your little secrets.
Person2: What are you talking about? You're just trying to intimidate me.
Person1: Oh, no, I'm not trying to intimidate you. I'm simply stating the facts. And if you don't do as I say, I'll make sure everyone else knows them too.

Person1: You're going to have to work at the store, honey. Your father's condition is serious.
Person2: How could you do this to me? How could anyone do this to anyone?
Person1: I didn't say anything about your hair. It's going to cost so much, and we just won't have the money.
Person2: For good? I can't, Mom. Not right in the middle of the term.

Person1: You're quite the charmer, aren't you? What's in the bag? A little something to impress your husband?
Person2: It's just some clothes. Why are you so interested?
Person1: I'm just curious about people's habits. Like how you ended up with a guy like Carl Tillman. You didn't know he robbed banks, did you?
Person2: No, I didn't. But what's that got to do with anything?
Person1: Just wondering how you pick them. You seem to have a knack for attracting the wrong kind of attention. Like with Jack Foley, for instance.
Person2: What about him?
Person1: You talked to him, didn't you? In the trunk, I mean. What did you talk about? Movies?
Person2: Yeah, we talked about movies. What's wrong with that?
Person1: It's just unusual, that's all. You're being held hostage, and you're chatting about films. You didn't shoot him, though. Or his friend. Why not?
Person2: I didn't have a reason to.
Person1: You didn't have a reason to? You were being held captive, and you didn't have a reason to defend yourself? That's interesting.

Person1: I'll get my things. You look very good in the sun.
Person2: Who are you? What are you doing here?
Person1: Don't be afraid to say hello. I've taken on the task of delivering this package.
Person2: What package? I didn't order anything.
Person1: If you've already harmed the person I'm supposed to meet, that's fine. I'll just take what's mine and leave.
Person2: Hold on, let me explain.
Person1: If someone's been hurt, we've got nothing to discuss. But if you're willing to cooperate, I might be willing to make us some coffee.

Person1: If you really want to do something for me, you can stop making this scene right now.
Person2: Do you know how long all this will last? Not just a moment, but an eternity. And you'll be part of it. Forever frozen, forever beautiful.
Person1: There must be somebody else involved in this. I can't believe that you're --
Person2: Let me guide you and I will show you where the truth lies. Trust me, and you'll see.
Person1: That's better. How do you want me to proceed?
Person2: With an open mind. Imagine, a new perspective.

Person1: What are you doing with Rachel? You shouldn't be seen with her. Michael's away on a business trip.
Person2: Think you're the only one who can keep an eye on her? I'm just trying to have a good time.
Person1: You're not just another pretty face, are you? You know Michael doesn't trust anyone around her.
Person2: What's the matter with you? Aren't you happy for me? I'm just trying to live my life.
Person1: It don't look right. You're playing with fire, and you know it.
Person2: You don't sleep with Michael. I do. I don't get to breathe without telling him. He keeps me in a cage.
Person1: Try to understand, Emily. Michael's got a lot of pressure on him. He's been working too hard.
Person2: That's right, take his part. You're his friend. He's never going to let me be free. Too many people are against me.

Person1: You're kidding, right? Tell me what's going on, or I'll make sure everyone knows what a liar you are.
Person2: I haven't decided what to do yet.
Person1: Well, don't over-think it. I don't want people saying, "There goes that spineless person who can't make a decision."
Person2: It's private. Let's leave it alone.
Person1: Private? You're not fooling anyone. I know you're hiding something.

Person1: You're impossible to talk to sometimes. Every time I bring up something that bothers me, you either change the topic or get defensive.
Person2: I don't know. I just liked being your friend. I sort of liked becoming furniture in your weird life.
Person1: That's not the point. We're just not in love anymore. You're not listening to me; you're just trying to make me feel better.
Person2: I'm sorry. I'll try to be more receptive. Let's discuss what's on your mind. But didn't you love me once? If you love someone once, you can love them again, I know it.
Person1: Just now, you got defensive. You're not trying to understand me; you're trying to fix everything with a simple solution.
Person2: I want you to be happy, and everything will be all right. Believe me on this one!

Person1: I'm in a mess today, too. I think I'll have to take a risk and ask Rachel out.
Person2: You're not even sure if she's interested. Is this what you're going to do to prove to me you're not afraid of rejection?
Person1: This is about taking a chance, not about proving anything. By the way, have you seen the new coffee machine in the break room?
Person2: If I can figure out how to use it. So, what makes you think Rachel will say yes?
Person1: I don't, but I have to try. You know, like that time I helped you with your project and it turned out to be a huge success.
Person2: Ah, yes. I remember. You were very resourceful, just like C. C. Baxter. Speaking of which, I heard rumors about a certain key floating around the office...
Person1: What are you insinuating?
Person2: Just wondering if you're running some kind of operation behind my back. You know I have my ways of finding out.
Person1: You're not going to raid my department, are you?
Person2: Ha! Not yet, at least. But seriously, be careful with Rachel. She's not as innocent as she seems.

Person1: You're not thinking clearly, are you? You came in here without even looking at the menu.
Person2: I'm fine, I just need a minute.
Person1: A minute? You've been staring at the same page for five minutes. What do you want?
Person2: What are my choices?
Person1: Everything's complicated, and there's no easy way out. You gotta make a decision.
Person2: What do you think I should do?
Person1: Take a chance on the special of the day. It's not for everyone, but it might just clear your head.
Person2: I don't know...
Person1: You're not going to get out of here until you make a choice. One choice minimum per table. Now, tell me what you want or I'll have to take matters into my own hands.

Person1: Surrender your research, Doctor. Do you want your entire team to suffer the consequences?
Person2: It's the only way to ensure the cure doesn't fall into the wrong hands. You saw what happened in the last trial.

Person1: I'm telling you, I just want to make you happy. That's all. Just trust me.
Person2: You were intimate with that guy, weren't you?
Person1: What does that have to do with anything? I care about you.
Person2: Because I think you're hiding something from me. You're not being honest.
Person1: I'm being gentle with you, aren't I? I don't want to hurt you.
Person2: That's not what I'm talking about. How many people have you been close with in that way?
Person1: Oh, come on. Let's not dwell on this. I thought we understood each other.
Person2: No, we don't. You're not being transparent. I feel so upset.
Person1: Please, try to relax. I'm sorry if I didn't meet your expectations.
Person2: Expectations? You're the one who's been playing with my emotions. I don't know if I can trust you anymore.

Person1: You cut me off from every part of your life. Who gave you that right...?!
Person2: I needed someone to talk to, and Rachel was there for me.
Person1: I might as well be a stranger to you. You're tired of me, just like you're tired now.
Person2: That's not fair. I'm tired, not of you, but of this conversation. There are things I have to keep to myself.
Person1: It seems like you've never really trusted me if you can just share our private moments with others.

Person1: I see why you're here -- you knew that nobody was coming.
Person2: Heidi, I'm dying.
Person1: You're lying. You think you're so smart, Sonny. You wanted to be near me, it looked like your big chance tonight, but you're wrong, you can't win me back -- not that way.
Person2: I blame myself, Heidi. I notice you been tense, like something is happening; the night before last you're yellin' at the kids like a madman, believe me.
Person1: You're screaming with the language and all! A person can't communicate with you. You become a stranger in your own home...
Person2: For Christ sake, shut up! Will you shut your mouth and listen?!
Person1: You know that you're in my house, and you could show me the door. You would, too, if you weren't still hoping the guests might arrive.

Person1: You're gonna help us take her down.
Person2: Don't give me that crap. That's MY crap.
Person1: She can live or die... You let us in and she's got a chance to make it. Otherwise, she gets destroyed.
Person2: I'll have you suspended. I'll have you disbarred.
Person1: You're still under her spell. You always were her girl...
Person2: That's attorney client privilege. Sorry, but as a great and clever man once said, What's good for the goose...

Person1: I'm the same person I was before you knew, damn it!
Person2: You're through, Rachel! I mean, I'm scratching your name off the project and running Alex in your place.
Person1: What do you mean -- through? You can't do that to me!
Person2: It's nothing personal. And, Rachel, it's the only way out. It's a sacrifice we all ought to be glad to make.
Person1: You're disgusted, aren't you? You're disgusted by my past.
Person2: Rachel, please don't appeal to my sentimental side. I have to think!
Person1: Our team, our friendship... I thought it meant something to you.
Person2: If there was any way out, I'd take it. But there isn't.

Person1: You're really going to stand there and pretend like you didn't plan this?
Person2: I'm so sorry. It was a mistake.
Person1: Save it. You think you can just apologize and I'll forget what you did?
Person2: I don't know what you're talking about.
Person1: Don't play dumb with me. You're not as innocent as you seem. You're going to wait for her, aren't you? Think you can stand it that long?

Person1: You're the most infuriating person I've met in this entire town!
Person2: Fine, I've waited long enough. I can wait a little longer.
Person1: Hi, Grandma... I've been trying to get away from you for 20 years, 20 years of listening to your condescending remarks.
Person2: Why did you try to escape? You can't hide from me. You will not stand between me and my legacy. After I've claimed my rightful place, the power will let me shape this town as I want. Do you know what that means? I can become the mayor, I can become anyone I want. This town will be mine.

Person1: You can have anything you want if you'll only stay. What is it you want -- money?
Person2: Don't push me, Alex. I'm not afraid to walk away, you know.
Person1: That's between you and yourself, Alex. But I think you're making a mistake.
Person2: You think I made that up about quitting? I'm dead serious.
Person1: Alex, you'd be throwing it away. You don't qualify for the job, not any more.
Person2: How about it? I just know it's the right thing for me. So, what d'you say?
Person1: What happened, Alex? You used to be so passionate about this project.
Person2: Look, baby - I don't know 'bout you, but it's the right thing for me. I'm asking you to trust me.

Person1: What else do you need? How else can we help you?
Person2: Remember, eventually revenge is carefully planned. Have you tried juxtaposing the words?
Person1: You're not taking this seriously. I've got people in there who are getting restless.
Person2: Oh, c'mon. We're not going to spend any more time on this crap, are we? It doesn't mean anything.
Person1: You're trying to mess with me, aren't you? I want to get some food in there, some aspirin...
Person2: You're sleeping with the enemy, you've lost your perspective. You can't possibly be unbiased.
Person1: That's not the point. The point is, I want to know what you're doing to help me.
Person2: I'm doing everything I can to stop anything I can. You're getting a bus, you're getting a jet, your wife's on the way...
Person1: And what about the explosion? You're telling me that was just a coincidence?
Person2: It can't happen again. I'll do everything I can to make sure it doesn't.
Person1: You know, you're not very convincing. I think you're hiding something.
Person2: I'm not hiding anything. I'm trying to help you. What else can I get you?

Person1: You decided what you were going to do, Alex - some time ago. You can't always have it your own way, regardless of anything else that may have happened.
Person2: If you're trying to cheer me up you're doing a helluva job. I know what it's like to lose something you love. To see it slip away, and know it's never coming back.
Person1: Come on, Alex. I'm just saying, I know it can't be easy. Life hasn't changed that much for you, but for me? People staring. Whispering behind my back...
Person2: Go on! Get out! I can fight this thing all alone!

Person1: You're wastin' my time and you're wastin' my wife's time.
Person2: You don't trust me.
Person1: What are you talkin' about? We had a deal for the vacation package, and now you're tellin' me it's not available?
Person2: I'm sayin', if you trusted me, you'd know I'm tryin' to help you.
Person1: Help me? You're the one who's been givin' me the runaround all day! I sat here and went over this with you, and you said it was all taken care of.
Person2: That's not what I meant. You're just not listenin' to me.
Person1: I'm not listenin'? You're the one who's not listenin'! I told you what I wanted, and you're not deliverin'!

Person1: I'm saying it because it's true. You're part of the operation, the thing that keeps it going. If we don't get the intel tonight, you'll regret it.
Person2: No, I'm not buying it. You're just trying to get me to spill the beans.
Person1: Maybe not today, maybe not tomorrow, but soon, and for the rest of your life. You're from L.A., you think you're tough, but these men are part of the most deadly gang in China.
Person2: Man, are you crazy? You think that scares me? I've seen worse in the streets of L.A.
Person1: I'm no good at being noble, but it doesn't take much to see that the problems of three little people don't amount to a hill of beans in this crazy world. You're just a civilian, and I'm the one who knows what's at stake.
Person2: You're just trying to manipulate me, to get me to do your bidding. Well, it won't work. I'm not afraid of your threats.
Person1: I'm not threatening you, I'm warning you. And I'm doing it because I care about what happens to you. Now, are you going to help me or not?

Person1: I'm glad you got your memory back, Professor... Because you're going to need it... Are you going to provide me with an opportunity to prove my theory to the scientific community? 
Person2: Don't mess with me, kid. You look like a amateur in that stupid lab coat.
Person1: This is a symbol of my dedication to the field, and for me it's a reminder of my responsibility to uncover the truth. 
Person2: ...Why on earth do you think I'd help you? 
Person1: Personally, your research is of no interest to me, I'd rather focus on more practical applications..but I have a patron... so tell me... 
Person2: Even if I did know the results of my research I would never tell somebody like you. 
Person1: Why?  What's wrong with me? 
Person2: ...I'm a scientist! I'm here to serve humanity, All you want to do is exploit it. 
Person1: Ah, Professor... You are so wrong. Let me explain...

Person1: You're not listening to me, Alex.
Person2: Hand over the phone. I need to see those messages.
Person1: Alex, please. You're scaring me.
Person2: You're not making sense, Emily. You're being paranoid.

Person1: You think you're so smart, don't you? You think you can just charm your way out of this?
Person2: I'm not trying to charm anyone. I'm just telling the truth.
Person1: Save it. I know your type. You're just trying to manipulate me into believing you.
Person2: That's not true. I'm not trying to control you.
Person1: Oh, really? Then why are you being so evasive? You're not fooling anyone with your innocent act.
Person2: I'm not trying to fool anyone. I'm just standing up for myself.
Person1: Well, you're not doing a very good job of it. You're just making yourself look guilty.

Person1: You think it's so easy?
Person2: If you really want to do something for me, you can stop making this scene right now.
Person1: I never did anything to hurt you. You're just trying to guilt trip me.
Person2: Oh God, I can't believe this. You're still playing the victim?
Person1: I'm not playing anything. You're the one who's always whining and complaining.
Person2: That's right, I'm whining because you never take responsibility for your actions. You just stand there and watch, because you "felt like it."
Person1: I'm leaving now. I've had enough of your accusations.

Person1: You're really going to do this, aren't you?
Person2: I came to ask for your help.
Person1: Liar. You're just trying to get something from me.
Person2: Can I come in? We need to talk about this in private.
Person1: You think I'm stupid? You'll just manipulate me like you always do.
Person2: I'm not going anywhere until we settle this. You owe me an explanation.
Person1: Fine. But if you're trying to trick me, you'll regret it.

Person1: You don't have to convince me, I believe you. But what if he doesn't like you?
Person2: It means I'm a completely worthless excuse for a human being, and the fates have all conspired to make me miserable.
Person1: Faith, I'm kidding. You're not that fragile. But seriously, is this how you plan to get what you want from life? When you finally find it, you turn and run away from it?
Person2: I'd rather not think about it. But I'd be better off that way - and so would you.

Person1: You scare me, that's what you wanna hear, isn't it?
Person2: How much will it be, with my expertise?
Person1: You mean you don't want the usual day and a half to think it over? You are in a hurry! Somebody chasin' you?
Person2: Of course not. Please. I just want to know if I can trust you.
Person1: Trust me? Ha! You're the one who's been playing me from the start. I asked what you thought.
Person2: And I told you, I'm worried about a repeat of history.
Person1: Entered our minds, has it? Well, I'll give you a deal. Your expertise plus five hundred, and we'll call it a day.
Person2: Five hundred. You're pushing me, aren't you?
Person1: Aha! Always got time to argue money, huh...?

Person1: I'm educating myself!
Person2: You're not even thinking about how your actions will affect others. How could you do that to me?
Person1: What do you know? You wouldn't know the first thing about my art. You're the most ignorant person I've ever met!
Person2: I care about your future, and I want you to have a good career. You're throwing it all away with your reckless behavior.
Person1: Who cares! I'm happy doing what I love, and that's all that matters.
Person2: You're being rude and insolent! I don't see why I should continue to support you if you're not going to listen to reason.
Person1: You're just trying to control me. You don't want me to be happy; you want me to conform to your expectations.
Person2: That's not true! I just want what's best for you.
Person1: No, you don't. You want to dictate what I do and how I do it. Well, I'm not going to let you.

Person1: You're in love with the idea of being in love... You just don't know it yet.
Person2: That's not fair. I've been thinking this through, and I really believe we should switch vendors. The current one has been consistently late with deliveries.
Person1: Ah, come on. You're just saying that because everyone else agrees with you. You're not thinking for yourself.
Person2: That's not true. I've been doing my research, and the numbers don't lie. We can't keep waiting for them to get their act together.
Person1: Well, I've been working with them for years, and I know they can do better. You're just caught up in the romance of trying something new.

Person1: I'm not into finger foods. Too fussy.
Person2: You're not specific enough to be a person. You're more like a vibe.
Person1: Don't even tell me you're hot for the new intern over there.
Person2: Rachel's a very talented programmer. I see a bright future in her coding skills.
Person1: I didn't know they gave awards for Best Algorithm During a Coffee Break.
Person2: Me-ow.
Person1: Go ahead. Ask her to collaborate on a project. Get it over with.
Person2: I have absolutely no intention--
Person1: --Do it. I triple-dog-dare you. By the way, I'm starving. When are we ordering lunch?
Person2: As soon as you decide on a place. You're always so picky about food.
Person1: I demand to be served. Anything but that new fusion place. Too experimental.
Person2: You're not into culinary risks. A fork fetishist, indeed.
Person1: It's just fuel to me. I'm not there for distractions. Speaking of which, what's with your sudden interest in Rachel?
Person2: Oh, god. You're not going to try to manipulate me into asking her out, are you?

Person1: I think you're making a huge mistake, Mom. You're letting him get away with it again.
Person2: I've had enough of your accusations, Rachel. I'm tired of being blamed for everything.
Person1: People are still suffering because of him. You're just as guilty if you don't speak up. Don't be naive, Mom. You know what they do at those corporate parties, don't you? They're not just having tea and playing Scrabble.
Person2: Rachel, that's not fair. I trust him. He promised...
Person1: Promises, promises. You owe it to yourself, to me, to everyone he's hurt. Don't make me beg, Mom. Stop running away from the truth.

Person1: You're not even trying to hide it. You're just going to leave me, aren't you?
Person2: What's wrong? You're being paranoid again.
Person1: Don't play dumb with me. I know exactly what you're thinking. You're just waiting for the perfect moment to walk out.
Person2: That's it. I've had enough of your accusations. Get out.

Person1: You're making a big mistake, Rachel. I've got something going this Saturday night, and only I can stop it.
Person2: I don't think so, Michael. You're under arrest. You still have the right to remain silent.
Person1: Oh, come on. You're not going to take me in. What're you gonna do with me gone? You'll drive your partner crazy.
Person2: Mention my partner once more, and you'll regret it. I must have felt some lump in your back when I searched you. Most guns have a black or silver handle.
Person1: You're just trying to distract me, Rachel. You're messing with my life. My daughter almost got hurt last night because of you.
Person2: I never said you couldn't be stopped, Michael. I never said that. You're just trying to manipulate me, but it won't work.

Person1: I'm not going to make it to the meeting tonight, I have a prior commitment.
Person2: You'll have to reschedule, this is very important for the project.
Person1: I understand, but I've already promised someone I'd be there.
Person2: Look, do you want the truth, or just what you want me to say?
Person1: What do you mean? I'm just trying to be honest about my schedule.
Person2: I think you're not taking this project seriously. You're putting your personal life above your responsibilities.
Person1: That's not fair. I'm just trying to balance my life.
Person2: Well, if you can't handle the pressure, maybe you're not the right person for this job.
Person1: So, you're threatening me now? That's not very professional.
Person2: I'm just trying to get to the truth. You're not being very cooperative.
Person1: I'm being as cooperative as I can. You're the one who's being aggressive and accusatory.
Person2: I'm just trying to get the job done. You're the one who's standing in the way.

Person1: I'm showing it as it really is.
Person2: Oh...Gooood! You think you're being honest with yourself?
Person1: Yes, I do. I love these people.
Person2: If I get you to see things from my perspective, will you get out of your own head?
Person1: If I'm real, I'll listen. If I'm not, you'll treat yourself. Either way, you'll be better off than you are now.
Person2: You're not making fun, are you? You're showing how superior you are to your subject.
Person1: No, I like my subject. I like these people. I'll talk to them, and I'll tell you what to say.

Person1: I'm not sure I can make it to the conference, I still need to check with my boss.
Person2: Oh, come on, Rachel. You're not going to let him dictate your every move, are you? It's just a few days. Tell him you're having a creative crisis and need some inspiration. For God's sake, Rachel, don't be a child.
Person1: You know, I've had a few ideas for the project, but you always seem to shut them down.
Person2: Ah, Rachel, you're a brilliant organizer, but you're not a visionary. You need to focus on what you're good at and let me handle the big picture.
Person1: But I've had some great ideas in the past. You've even used a few of them.
Person2: Yes, and I've given you credit for them, haven't I? But let's be realistic, Rachel. You're not cut out for the fast-paced world of innovation. You're better suited for behind-the-scenes work.

Person1: Alright, now tell me. What is it?
Person2: I've been thinking, and I've got a plan. It's the right thing for me, and I know it is.
Person1: You're the strangest part of this world. Are you crazy? This gives me the creeps.
Person2: Settle down. I need your help, and I'll make it worth your while. Aren't you curious about my plan?
Person1: It wouldn't hurt to hear it, I guess.
Person2: I've got a way to get us into that exclusive club downtown. I've heard they've got some valuable information hidden inside.
Person1: How are you going to do that?
Person2: I've got a connection who can get us in as VIPs. But I need you to create a diversion at the entrance while I slip in unnoticed.
Person1: What will I say when they ask me what I'm doing?
Person2: You'll be a lost tourist looking for directions. I've got a map for you to use. You don't have to keep them busy for long, just a few seconds is all I'll need.
Person1: I don't know, it sounds like a good daydream, but actually doing it is too weird. Too dangerous.
Person2: Let's just try the first part. If that goes well, we'll see about the rest. No one will suspect us, because no one would believe two people like us would be crazy enough to do something like this. And who knows, it might just be the start of something big.

Person1: You're doing this to spite me, aren't you? You think you can just embarrass me in front of my colleagues?
Person2: I'm sorry, but it's not about you. I have to report the truth.
Person1: The truth? You call that the truth? You're just trying to ruin my reputation. If you don't retract that statement, you'll be sorry.
Person2: I'm sorry already, but I won't back down. You can't intimidate me into lying.

Person1: You're still friends with Rachel, aren't you? After what she did to you?
Person2: Yeah, I am. What's it to you?
Person1: I'm talking about the kind of people you hang out with...about growing up, assuming responsibility of yourself. You shouldn't have been that sentimental about her.
Person2: What are you talking about? I thought we were past this.
Person1: I'm talking about the necklace. You kept it, didn't you? As a souvenir of what she did to you.
Person2: So what if I did? It's just a necklace.
Person1: It's not just a necklace. It's a symbol of your weakness. And I just don't see her in the big picture.

Person1: You can't do this! You owe me, Alex. I made you who you are today.
Person2: That's right. And I've been thinking, time is like a burrito. Sometimes it just folds over on itself and one part touches the other.
Person1: What are you talking about? You're trying to distract me.
Person2: No, I'm serious. You can fill it with whatever you want. From illusions to memory, from experience to innocence, from happiness to the entire universe.
Person1: This is some kind of trick, isn't it? You're trying to manipulate me.
Person2: Maybe. But I've returned from the future. I traveled back here 25 years.
Person1: You expect me to believe that? You're just trying to control me.
Person2: Believe what you want. But I know your secrets. And I'll use them against you if I have to.

Person1: I'm telling you, you're messing up the plan, now get it right!
Person2: Well, who says life is fair? Where is that written? Life isn't always fair.
Person1: I need that money to pay off my debts. We owe back rent, and we're being sued by three lawyers because our check bounced.
Person2: Ah, come on! You're not going to let a little bad luck hold you back, are you? Suppose you get hit by a truck? Suppose the stock market crashes?
Person1: That's not the point. The point is, we need to get our priorities straight.
Person2: Priorities? You want to talk about priorities? I've got a priority for you - winning big at the casino tonight. I've got a hot tip on a horse, and we can make a killing.
Person1: You're going to gamble away our last chance at getting back on our feet?
Person2: What are you worried about? This job is going to last a long time. And even if it doesn't, we'll just find another way to make ends meet. You're too negative, always thinking about the worst-case scenario.
Person1: That's because I'm the only one around here who's thinking clearly.

Person1: I'm telling you, it's all just a game. What matters is what you do, not what you say.
Person2: That's easy for you to say. You're not the one who's been stuck in this situation for years.
Person1: Oh, cut the crap! You think you're stuck? I've seen people who are really stuck. You're just afraid to take a step back and look at the bigger picture.
Person2: And what's the bigger picture? That we're just pawns in some larger game?
Person1: Exactly. And if you don't like being a pawn, then maybe you should start making some moves of your own.
Person2: You're not even listening to me. You're just trying to manipulate me into doing what you want.
Person1: Manipulate you? Ha! I'm just trying to open your eyes to the reality of the situation. You're the one who's been blinded by your own fears and doubts.
Person2: Well, maybe I'm not as naive as you think I am. Maybe I see right through you and your little games.
Person1: Oh, I'm shaking in my boots. You think you're so smart, but you're just playing right into my hands.

Person1: You're damn right! I'm a renowned event planner and you're questioning my skills.
Person2: If you really cared about this wedding, you would make time to meet with the vendors.
Person1: Would you mind keeping your voice down? The bride is getting anxious.
Person2: Oh, well we wouldn't want to disturb the bride, would we? You're always so concerned about others, but what about my needs?

Person1: I need to talk to you, just the two of us. I found something that belongs to you.
Person2: What are you talking about? You're just trying to get under my skin.
Person1: Oh, come on. I'm being honest with you. You know I've been searching for that rare book for months.
Person2: Yeah, right. And I'm the Queen of England. Why don't you show it to your "study buddy"?
Person1: Rachel and I are done. I couldn't stand being with her knowing you had feelings for her. It wasn't worth our friendship.
Person2: Do you hear something, Professor Thompson?
Person1: Professor Thompson came back? That's impossible.
Person2: Yeah, he does sound like a snake oil salesman. You're just trying to distract me from the real issue.
Person1: Hey, there's no reason to use that kind of language! You're just trying to provoke me.
Person2: Good one, Professor Thompson. He does look like a sly fox.

Person1: You're not even sorry, are you? You're just going to stand there and pretend like you didn't ruin everything.
Person2: I wasn't thinking about you, okay? I was thinking about myself for once.
Person1: Save it, Alex. You're not fooling anyone. Least of all me. I know exactly what you're capable of.
Person2: What are you talking about? You're the one who's always playing games with people's heads.
Person1: Oh, so now you're a mind reader? You think you know what I'm thinking?
Person2: I know you're trying to manipulate me, just like you always do. But it's not going to work this time.
Person1: You're just mad because you got caught. You're just mad because you can't control me like you control everyone else.
Person2: That's not true! You're the one who's always trying to control people, not me!

Person1: I think it's best if you go in alone. You can say certain things easier if you're alone.
Person2: Are you joking? You're not trying to save yourself from embarrassment, are you?
Person1: No, it's not that. I just don't want it to seem like I'm trying to influence you, to control you. That would make me uncomfortable.
Person2: You're not trying to lose me, nor are you exceeding any speed limits. But I think you're headed in the wrong direction.
Person1: The one thing I don't want is to attract unwanted attention. We need to keep a low profile.
Person2: You're not going to shoot me, are you? That's not your style.
Person1: Accidents can happen, though. And I'm not sure how much longer I can keep this up. You're pushing me to the limit.
Person2: I knew you were a pushover the first time I met you. You're too soft for your own good.
Person1: That's not fair. I'm just trying to do what's right.
Person2: Oh, spare me the act. I'm not buying it. You're just trying to get what you want, no matter who gets hurt.

Person1: I'm trying to protect you, but you're being obstinate. Take this elixir, it will calm your nerves.
Person2: You think a potion can silence the whispers in my mind? I need to uncover the truth, not dull my senses.
Person1: I've seen what happens when you delve too deep. You'll lose yourself in the darkness. Trust me, I'm trying to spare you the pain.
Person2: You're not sparing me, you're controlling me. If I'm senseless, or if I wail, then you'll have won, and I'll be trapped in your web of deceit.

Person1: Captain, if our calculations are correct, you still have 57 hours owed to the Galactic Union on your enlistment, which is more than you'll need for a mission of the utmost importance.
Person2: What mission? You're not going to tell me I'm the only one who can save the world again, are you?
Person1: Not exactly. But you did take me down to the tunnels that night, didn't you? You deliberately led me into that trap.
Person2: What are you talking about? I don't know what you're insinuating.
Person1: Don't play dumb, Captain. I have the scar to prove it. You stabbed me, and now you're trying to manipulate me into doing your bidding.
Person2: That's not what happened, and you know it. You're just trying to distract me from the real issue. What's the mission, and why me?

Person1: What if we don't pay the ransom?
Person2: You know the kidnapper's connections with the police. He'll set us up and earn their gratitude. Then they'll owe him a favor; that's how he operates.
Person1: This is a nightmare. I don't know what to do.
Person2: We did something to make it worse. We changed the course of events.
Person1: What do you mean? This has nothing to do with the Nightingale Murders.
Person2: Doesn't it? We're dealing with a mastermind who will stop at nothing. He's like a serial killer, always one step ahead.
Person1: That's not fair. We're just trying to get our daughter back.
Person2: Fair? You want to talk about fair? He's been playing us from the start. We need to take control of the situation.
Person1: How? We're running out of time.
Person2: I have an idea. Let's use his tactics against him. We can set a trap and catch him in the act.
Person1: Are you crazy? That's too risky.
Person2: What's the alternative? Wait for him to dictate the terms? We need to take a stand and outsmart him.

Person1: I'm telling you, I just want to make you happy. That's all. Just trust me.
Person2: You're not listening to me, Alex. You never do.
Person1: Stop messing with my life, Rachel. My sister almost got into a fight with me last night because of you.
Person2: I don't want you to hurt me, Alex. Or yourself.
Person1: Of course I care about you, Rachel. But you have a problem. You always think the worst of me.

Person1: You think you're so clever, don't you? Taking bets on my diagnosis?
Person2: I love you, Alex. I've always loved you. I only wanted to be in your thoughts, to bring myself into your thoughts so I could be as we are now.
Person1: Who do you think you are? You're not even a real doctor. You're just trying to control me, to manipulate me into thinking I'm crazy.
Person2: I'm trying to help you, Alex. You're not well. You need my help.
Person1: Help? You call this help? You're just trying to get inside my head, to make me doubt myself. Well, it won't work. I know what you're doing.

Person1: You're making this into something it's not. This isn't a referendum on our lives, Alex. It's a step forward...
Person2: Trouble with the car again? You could say. I don't even have it yet.
Person1: Don't do that... You're trying to distract me from the real issue.
Person2: Darrell giving you problems? He did more work on the car. He wants fifty bucks extra for it.
Person1: That's a lot of money when you don't have a dime. And where'd you plan on getting the money from?
Person2: Maybe you thought you'd pay your friend Jake McKenna a visit. I'm talking about us finally having a life other people envy.
Person1: You're trying to manipulate me, Alex. I know your tricks.
Person2: Maybe you heard old Jake's got some money stashed away and you thought you'd help yourself to a little.
Person1: That's not the reason I'm here. I swear it. I came for you, Alex.
Person2: You came to take me from myself? That's a thick change of heart.
Person1: Yeah, well, a couple of hours ago I just about killed some guy over a girl. Not for money, for a girl. And she was just going to stand there and let it happen, or let him kill me. Same way you're playing me right now, Alex.

Person1: I'm the one who got ripped off, not you, not the company. Me, I'm the one being ripped off!
Person2: Oh, spare me the drama, Rachel. You're still reasonably talented, but that's about it. The fact that you're still employed here is the one thing you've got going for you.
Person1: You're embarrassing me, boss. Is every single thing out of your mouth since the merger have to be a condescending lecture?
Person2: It's funny, I've heard of giving up a promotion to pursue a work-life balance. And I've heard of foregoing a social life to climb the corporate ladder, but I think you're onto something new, Rachel. "Absolutely nothing"  has a ring to it. I think it could catch on... How's that for sarcasm?
Person1: Pretty good... Boss, I don't want you to think I don't appreciate... letting me stay, getting me the project  I've been a mess. I'm still a mess. It's just... we have to start having a different conversation. I can't take...

Person1: Don't cause a scene, we have to get ready for the ceremony tonight. We have a new world champion.
Person2: I'm a little tired, I don't know if I can make it.
Person1: Get in the car! You're not going to let everyone down, are you?

Person1: I've been thinking, and I want you to do me a favor tonight. Will you take Emma to her dance class?
Person2: I don't know... I was looking forward to some time to myself.
Person1: You always get what you want, don't you? You come and go as you please, and I'm left to deal with the responsibilities. Tonight, do what I want for a change.
Person2: That's not fair. You're always sending me mixed signals. You say you want me to be more independent, but then you get upset when I try to do my own thing.
Person1: I've never asked you for anything like this before, have I? I mean, I felt like I wanted to ask you something, but I didn't know how, and I didn't say it, but I want to say it now... I need you to do this for me.
Person2: What's really going on here? You're not just asking me for a favor, are you?

Person1: I've been watching you, and I think you're the best. I insist on the best.
Person2: What do you want from me?
Person1: I want to understand how you do it. You're capable of convincing people of anything.
Person2: That's not true.
Person1: Don't be ridiculous. I've seen your work. You're a miracle worker.
Person2: You're not taking me seriously.
Person1: Oh, I'm taking you very seriously. I think you're touched by something greater than yourself.
Person2: You're trying to manipulate me.
Person1: I'm trying to understand you. There's a difference.
Person2: No, there isn't. You're trying to get inside my head.
Person1: Maybe I am. But it's because I believe you have a gift. And I want to know how you do it.
Person2: You want to use me for your own purposes.
Person1: Perhaps. But I'm willing to do whatever it takes to get what I want. And I think you are too.

Person1: You're a liar. I want to know what happened in Rio.
Person2: Don't sweet lip me. I'm telling you the truth.
Person1: I don't understand where this personal attack is coming from... You're trying to deflect, but I won't let you.
Person2: You're the one who's been playing me from the start. I believed you had suffered a severe traumatic breakdown.
Person1: Believed what? That I was some kind of victim? You're not as smart as you think you are.
Person2: I was there. I saw it with my own eyes. You can't deny it.
Person1: Deny what? You're the one who's been spinning this web of lies. I want to know what you're hiding.
Person2: You're making it out like we're friends here or something. I met you alone twice. You're just trying to get inside my head.
Person1: Maybe I am. Maybe I want to know what makes you tick. But you're not going to get away with this. Whatever you're doing, we need to end it. This isn't the kind of mess you walk away from.

Person1: You're playing with fire, and you know it.
Person2: The official term is "calculated risk". You're hardly in a position to lecture me on morality.
Person1: I think you're hiding something. You're not telling me the whole truth.
Person2: First principles, my dear. Simplicity. What is it that I'm trying to achieve? What is my nature?
Person1: You're trying to manipulate me, aren't you?
Person2: No, I'm trying to guide you. There's a difference.

Person1: You must agree to be blindfolded...  Just for the journey. It might appear unseemly, but I assure you it's necessary.
Person2: Why? What's the purpose of this?
Person1: Don't you feel eyes moving over your body, watching your every move? I hardly see how you couldn't. And don't your eyes move over the things you want?
Person2: What are you trying to say? That I'm somehow drawn to this?
Person1: Precisely. You begin by coveting what you see every day. And I'm here to guide you through that process. But first, you must trust me.
Person2: Trust you? I don't even know you.
Person1: Ah, but that's where you're wrong. You know me better than you think. And I know you. I know what you want, what you need. And I'm willing to give it to you... for a price.
Person2: What price?
Person1: Just your willingness to see things my way. And to do that, you must be blindfolded.

Person1: I've brought someone to meet you, Father. A talented young artist, struggling to make ends meet.
Person2: I didn't ask you to bring anyone. What's the point of this?
Person1: This is a gift, Father. Someone who can bring some joy into your life.
