Person1: You think I wanted to spend my whole Saturday on this? 
Person2: What did I tell you? You don't have to do anything. Just stand there. They'll get the idea.
Person1: I ain't going in there. I got a problem with those kinds of places.
Person2: You're my responsibility, and I don't want you hurt. You understand? 
Person1: I'm not doing this for you. I'm doing it because I owe you.
Person2: Well, if you owe me, then show some respect. You're not even trying to help me out.
Person1: I am trying to help. But I'm not going to let you manipulate me into doing something I don't want to do.
Person2: You're not even listening to me. I'm trying to explain how this works. You have to maintain control. You lose it, you get hurt.
Person1: I don't need you to tell me how to take care of myself. I've been doing just fine without your help.
Person2: Fine. Do it your way. But don't come crying to me when things go wrong.

Person1: I'm still trying to wrap my head around why you decided to sabotage the project. It was our biggest client, and now they're taking their business elsewhere.
Person2: You're not thinking clearly. You were thinking "I've got to find a way to distract the team." So you did. It was, in its way, a noble act.
Person1: Save it, Rachel. I wasn't trying to be noble. I was trying to protect myself from your constant micromanaging.
Person2: You know nothing about feelings, natural or unnatural. But I do know that you're looking for a scapegoat, and I'm not going to take the fall for this.
Person1: Well, someone needs to take responsibility. And it might as well be you, since you're the one who's been calling the shots around here.
Person2: If you don't like it here, I suggest you take a walk. I'm sure you'll find someone else who's willing to coddle your ego.

Person1: I hope you're going to invite me in?
Person2: You're done. Let me have the shop keys. You're just a pawn in his game, you know that?
Person1: Everybody is at home, it's no good. But I think you're misunderstanding the situation.
Person2: The key, please. It's the key that's kept me locked to him all these years. I give it to you with pleasure. Now I'm free. See how easy it is?

Person1: You're making a huge mistake, Rachel. You owe me for all the opportunities I've given you. I made your career!
Person2: That's right, and now it's time for you to pay the price. We want you to take a break from the spotlight, focus on your personal life, and let someone else shine for a change.

Person1: You think you're better than this job? Fine. Show me. Show me that you're really willing to change and we'll talk about something better. A lot better.
Person2: You're one to talk about change, aren't you? You're the one who's been playing games with me from the start. I didn't realize I was just a pawn in your little game of power and control.
Person1: Oh, come on. You're not naive enough to think this is about anything else, are you? This is about who's in charge. And right now, it's me.
Person2: That may be true, but I'm not going to play along. I'm not going to be your little lapdog, doing your bidding just to get ahead.
Person1: Fine. Be that way. But you're missing out on a lot. I could make your life very easy, very comfortable. Or I could make it very difficult. The choice is yours.
Person2: I'm not afraid of you. I'm not afraid of your threats or your promises. I know what I'm worth, and I know what I deserve. And it's not this.

Person1: What's this: "I'm declining this case?"  It don't work that way.
Person2: I felt like it.  What do you care?
Person1: You're retiring.  In six days you're all the way gone.  You couldn't do it.
Person2: Well, as soon as you grow some balls, let me know.

Person1: You can't prove a rumor. That's why it's a rumor.
Person2: Exactly, so why are you spreading it about my business partner?
Person1: I'm not spreading it, I'm just saying it's out there. And you have to admit, there's been talk about his dealings.
Person2: Talk created by your friend, that little tabloid twit, Rachel.
Person1: Oh, come on. I offer you a chance to clear the air and suddenly it's a personal attack?
Person2: You're not offering me anything, Frank. You're trying to get under my skin. And it's working.

Person1: You're telling me that my sister's disappearance is connected to that cult?
Person2: I wouldn't have put it quite that way, but...
Person1: I warned her about getting involved with those people. She didn't listen. Now she's gone.
Person2: It's true. The symbols on the wall, the strange rituals... it's all part of their plan.
Person1: What plan? What are you talking about?
Person2: You're already contaminated. You can't see it, but I can. They've been manipulating you, making you doubt your own memories.
Person1: That's ridiculous. I know what I saw.
Person2: Do you? Check the photos from your childhood. Are you sure those are your real parents?
Person1: What are you insinuating? That I'm not who I think I am?
Person2: I'm just saying that sometimes the truth is hidden in plain sight. You need to open your eyes.

Person1: You're a master of playing with my emotions, aren't you?
Person2: I'm just trying to keep you on your toes. You know you love the thrill of the chase.
Person1: That's not true. You're just trying to distract me from my real potential. I could've been a contender, someone with real class.
Person2: Ah, come on. You're not still bitter about that, are you? I always had a bet down for you. You saw some money.
Person1: You don't understand. It's not about the money. It's about the way you manipulated me, made me take dives for the short-end cash. You were my brother, my confidant. You should've looked out for me.
Person2: I did what was best for you at the time. And besides, you're a masochistic pain freak. You gotta love me.

Person1: You're not taking me seriously, are you?
Person2: I'm in love with you. Don't get out of your pram, I'm on your manor now, right.
Person1: That's not an answer. You're avoiding the issue. Whatever the bollocks between you and me, it's got everything to do with me. I want to know.
Person2: I can well believe you're upset, son. You're about as straight as a dog's hind leg when it comes to your feelings.
Person1: But I can't be sure. I don't even know who you are. You're too insulated. Too many layers around you.
Person2: Your guess is as good as mine, mate. I'm here on another matter entirely. Strictly personal.
Person1: Yeah, I guess you are. So what's your beef, pal? What am I doing?
Person2: You're trying to get inside my head, aren't you? Well, I'll tell you. I believe you screwed me out of something more valuable than money.

Person1: I did it because I'd never stopped thinking about you and if I didn't find you I knew my life would never be good again.
Person2: That's a pretty convenient excuse. What's the real reason?
Person1: We could go down and get our blood tests tomorrow. Or this afternoon. It's a good day for it.
Person2: You're changing the subject. I want to know why you really did it.

Person1: You're supposed to show him those city things and this and that.
Person2: I made you who you are today. If you went away, what would become of me?
Person1: You're into yourselves, as the saying goes. Spend some time trying to be a good sibling. Take him to the museum, art galleries. You ought to let him get to know culture.
Person2: I know, but I'm grown up now. I have to leave some time.
Person1: Of course you do, and I want you to... but there's no need to hurry it along, is there? You're mine, and I need you to stay close.

Person1: I've got a feeling about this, we're onto something big. I can smell it.
Person2: Ah, you're twenty-five, huh? That's interesting. In my experience, people your age are often impulsive, prone to acting on instinct rather than reason. Tell me, do you work out? You seem to have a certain... confidence about you.

Person1: You're a real emancipated type, aren't you?
Person2: What do you mean by that?
Person1: I mean, you're not like most people. You've got a certain... edge to you.
Person2: (laughs) I used to be an actress, you know.
Person1: Yeah? What made you give it up?
Person2: I just got tired of playing the same roles over and over. I wanted to do something more... substantial.
Person1: Like what?
Person2: Like going to college. I'm a college girl now, two days a week.
Person1: (smirks) You don't look like a college girl.
Person2: (smiling) That's what I like about you, you're always trying to figure me out.
Person1: (leaning in) I'm trying to understand what makes you tick. You're not like anyone I've ever met.
Person2: (leaning in closer) Maybe that's because I'm not afraid to take risks. Maybe that's why I'm always trying to push the limits.
Person1: (pauses) You know, I think you're trying to manipulate me.
Person2: (laughs) Oh, Gabriel, you're so paranoid. I'm just trying to have a conversation.
Person1: (smirks) Save it, I know your tricks. You're trying to get inside my head, to figure out what I want.
Person2: (smiling) Maybe I am. Maybe I just want to understand you better.
Person1: (leaning back) Well, I'm not that easy to figure out. And even if you did, I'm not sure you'd like what you found.
Person2: (leaning back) Oh, I think I would. I think I'd find it very... interesting.

Person1: You're telling me you didn't know what you were getting into? Didn't I warn you about the risks? You're not listening to me, just like Vinny.
Person2: Who's Vinny? I don't know what you're talking about.
Person1: Never mind. Look, I'm trying to help you. But you need to trust me and do what I say. Can you do that for me?
Person2: I suppose. But I want to know what's going on. You're not being very clear.
Person1: Clarity is overrated. What's important is that you follow my instructions. Now, are you going to pay me or do we have a problem?
Person2: I'll pay you. But I don't like being kept in the dark.
Person1: That's the way it has to be. You wouldn't understand the bigger picture even if I explained it to you. Just be grateful I'm looking out for you.

Person1: You're not in a position to question my casting choices, or whatever your Hollywood sense of decorum tells you to do. You're nothing. You're a has-been. You're not here to make friends.
Person2: We get it. We're sorry. We didn't mean to offend you.
Person1: Now that producer's getting cold feet and wants to change the script on me. I better call my agent before he hears about it from someone else. You know, Sally, I've never considered you for the lead because you're too old to play it. And you're out of touch with reality if you think differently.
Person2: What are you saying? You're saying I'm too old for the part?
Person1: Hello? Last audition was? You don't look your age, Sally, but you're not fooling anyone. You're phoning it in, and everyone knows it. Your director and co-star think you're just going through the motions.
Person2: Who? Who thinks that? Mac? Cal?
Person1: Oh, come on, Sally. Don't play dumb. You know exactly who I'm talking about. And by the way, your constant questioning is getting on my nerves. You're not in control here. I am.

Person1: You wanna take my statement, I'll perform for you, gotta get paid though, gotta get PAID.
Person2: What was all that stuff about the new project and tight deadlines?
Person1: I'm trained, I'm ready to go, you wanna make a deal to help underprivileged entrepreneurs in the --
Person2: I... I didn't think you would have any interest in this business proposal... I mean if you had told me you were coming I would have warned you -- it's not like a real partnership or anything.
Person1: You're right about that. So this is your office? It's impressive.
Person2: Oh God no. This is just a temporary space. The real deal is off-limits.
Person1: Really? Can I see it? I can help you, make you the person with a plan, give you the gift that I bring -- think fast -- you wanna know who's behind the delay?
Person2: Sorry, I'm not sure that's possible. You don't just sign up to be a business partner -- it's about building trust and credibility -- ok?
Person1: Leave this one to the experts, they ain't gonna solve shit, I can help you, make you the one with the solution, give you the edge that I flow -- think fast -- you wanna know who's holding us back?

Person1: I think you're really talented, and I'm grateful to have you on my team.
Person2: Thanks, I appreciate the opportunity. But to be honest, I've always dreamed of doing something more creative.
Person1: Ah, come on, that can wait. Let's break for lunch and I'll buy you a drink. You can tell me more about your creative aspirations.
Person2: I don't know... I really should finish this project.
Person1: Don't be silly, it can wait. Besides, I think you'd be surprised at how much I can help you with your creative pursuits. And who knows, maybe we can even collaborate on something together.
Person2: I suppose it couldn't hurt to take a break. But just for a little while.

Person1: You're not going to deny it, are you? I know everything.
Person2: Whatever you think you know, it's not what you think.
Person1: Don't play dumb with me. You've been playing me from the start.
Person2: You're the one who's been playing with fire. You have no idea what you're involved in.
Person1: I know exactly what I'm involved in. And I know you're in deep.
Person2: You're just trying to shift the blame. You're the one who's been scamming people left and right.
Person1: That's not true. You're the one who's been lying to me from the beginning.
Person2: Lying to you? You're the one who's been lying to yourself. You're so caught up in your own ego, you can't see the truth.

Person1: You're not going to get away with this. I have proof.
Person2: Fire the whole team. We're moving operations to a new location anyway. Whoever is left over is no longer needed.
Person1: You're just trying to intimidate me. I'm not afraid of you.
Person2: Oh, you should be. You're still young enough to have fun playing the game, but "you" will go in knowing that the next time you get out it'll be to attend your own funeral. Depressing.
Person1: That's not going to happen. I have the receipts for everything.
Person2: Receipts? Ha! You think a few pieces of paper are going to save you? I can make one call and you'll be the one who's expendable.

Person1: You're not really going to wear that to the party, are you? You're not really that desperate, are you?
Person2: What's wrong with what I'm wearing?
Person1: Oh, I refuse to speak of disgusting things because they disgust me! You understand, Girl? You're not really that naive, are you?
Person2: Mother, please...
Person1: And then what? After the party, a nightcap? Whispers? You're not really that innocent, are you?
Person2: You're just saying that because you think that's what I want to hear.
Person1: Positive. I'm positive you're not that stupid. You have the guts, girl? You have the guts to admit the truth?
Person2: Shut up! Shut up!

Person1: You're still holding on to the past, aren't you? You think you can turn back the clock and relive the memories.
Person2: (long pause) What are you talking about?
Person1: I know what your heart is saying. Let him go, it's whispering. Let him go.
Person2: Who's "him"?
Person1: The one you've been waiting for. The one who's been waiting for you. He's been biding his time, searching for someone like you.
Person2: That's not true. You're just trying to confuse me.
Person1: Am I? Or am I simply revealing the truth you've been trying to deny? You can't accept that time has moved on, that everyone and everything you cared for is gone. It's a fact, whether you like it or not.

Person1: You're making me very angry. You're giving me that look. I gotta accept your word, but if I find out anything...
Person2: So, go ahead. Kill everybody. Kill me while you're at it. What do I care? You're worried about this girl, you're gonna let this girl ruin your life for you...
Person1: What do you mean, "you"? You're asking me why? You're asking me to tell you some more of the secrets we shared.
Person2: I meant, kill everybody. You or me or anybody. You're a big shot. Kill, kill... g'head. Just tell me. Tell me some more.
Person1: But you said "you". You're making me very angry. You're giving me these answers, but you still didn't answer my question.
Person2: You're worried about your freakin' stomach that you can't bend over -- that you gotta step in the ring in a month. I'm asking. I'm asking you why.
Person1: Did you ever be with my wife? You're very smart, very smart. Nobody gives me a straight answer around here.
Person2: Whadda ya mean? What kind of degenerate pervert was he really? What did he want with a snuff film?
Person1: You're givin' me these answers, but you still didn't answer my question. Did you be with Vickie?
Person2: I gotta go. I gotta get outta here. I can't take this stuff. You're a definite wacko. You're crazy, you know that, crazy.

Person1: I know you're trying to reach me, Governor. If you need me, you know where I am.
Person2: This scandal is going to ruin your reputation, and it's all because of your association with me.
Person1: What scandal? You're being dramatic again.
Person2: The press is already talking about our little "indiscretion" at the charity gala. Your wife is furious.
Person1: Ah, come on. You're not going to guilt trip me into ending things between us, are you?
Person2: I'm just saying, you owe it to yourself and your family to reevaluate our relationship.
Person1: You're the one who's been playing me all along, using our affair to get closer to my political connections.
Person2: That's not fair. I care about you deeply.
Person1: Save it. I'm not buying it. You're just trying to keep me in your pocket.
Person2: Fine. But know that I'm not going down without a fight. I have secrets, too.

Person1: You're a man with a vision, and I admire that. But let's be realistic, you've been stuck in a rut since you got back from the expedition. You need someone to help you get back on track.
Person2: I don't know, man. I've been thinking about cutting loose and traveling the world. I don't want to be tied down to one place.
Person1: Ah, come on. You're not going to find fulfillment in some fleeting adventure. You need to leave your mark on this town, make a difference. And I can help you do that. You need me, just like Harvey needed me.
Person2: Alright, fine. But if I end up in jail because of you, I'm blaming you.

Person1: You're not taking this seriously, are you?
Person2: I'm taking it very seriously, but I think you're crazy!
Person1: Don't play dumb with me. Where's the report?
Person2: I don't know what you're talking about. You need to calm down.
Person1: Don't tell me to calm down! You're the one who's been stalling me all week.

Person1: I sense you are having difficulty understanding the situation you are presently in.
Person2: What's that supposed to mean? You think I'm stupid or something?
Person1: Not at all. I'm just saying that this new community center is a great idea, but the name "Unity Hall" doesn't quite fit.
Person2: You're one of those people who always finds fault, aren't you? Whatever somebody does to improve things around here, you gotta criticize it.
Person1: I'm not criticizing, I'm just pointing out that the name could be more... inclusive. But I think it's great that you're trying to bring the community together.
Person2: You know, sometimes I think this town would be better off without people like you.

Person1: You're here because you want me to help you in some way. What do you need from me?
Person2: I need your expertise to take down a notorious criminal. I know you've dealt with similar cases before.
Person1: How many innocent people has this criminal hurt? You may only get one shot at someone like that. Same circumstances, I'd do the same again.
Person2: Sacrifice the hostages to take out the criminal? That's a heavy price to pay.
Person1: You're not thinking about the bigger picture. I'm not just doing this for personal gain; I'm doing it to protect the community.
Person2: I understand that, but I still have doubts. Can I trust you to make the right call?
Person1: You're questioning my judgment? I've been in this game a long time, kid. I know what I'm doing.

Person1: I'm not sure I can do this, it's not right.
Person2: If you want to prove yourself to your family, this is your chance. Sex is a beautiful thing, but we must respect its power.
Person1: I know, but this feels wrong.
Person2: You're not thinking clearly, you're sick with guilt. Let me help you see things more clearly.
Person1: How can you be so sure?
Person2: Because I've seen it before, and I know what's best for you. Trust me, this is for your own good.

Person1: You're so focused on saving everyone, but what about those who don't want to be saved?
Person2: I know I can't change the world, but I want to offer a helping hand, a listening ear, and a comforting presence. It's not about fixing everything, but about being present in the midst of chaos.
Person1: That's just a cop-out. You're not going to make a real difference with your half-hearted efforts.
Person2: Maybe not, but at least I'll be able to live with myself. You, on the other hand, seem to be running from your own demons. Perhaps you should focus on fixing yourself before trying to fix others.

Person1: You owe me a favor, don't you think?
Person2: I don't know what you're talking about.
Person1: Oh, come on... You're not going to pretend you didn't get what you wanted from me, are you?
Person2: I didn't want anything from you. You're the one who offered to help.
Person1: Exactly. And now you're going to do something for me. You're going to come with me to the meeting tonight.
Person2: I don't think that's a good idea.
Person1: It's better than going back to your empty apartment, isn't it?

Person1: You're not going to phone the police, are you?
Person2: What's that supposed to mean? You think you know me that well?
Person1: Crash says I gotta quit worrying about what others think. C'mon, honey, we got a lotta catching up to do.
Person2: You're not even listening to me. You're just trying to distract me from what's really going on here.

Person1: You're really going to play it that way?
Person2: Stop whining and do something about it. We've had our differences of opinion, but I never thought you'd stoop this low.
Person1: Is that a threat? You're trying to intimidate me, but it won't work.
Person2: Don't be paranoid. We're just trying to protect our interests. You know as well as I do that our work here is confidential.
Person1: Confidential? You mean like how you're trying to manipulate me into staying silent?
Person2: I'm just trying to remind you of your obligations. You were paid well for your work, and the severance package is more than fair.
Person1: You think a fat check will buy my silence? I'm not that easily bought.
Person2: We're not trying to buy you, Jeff. We're just trying to maintain a sense of decorum. But if you insist on playing it this way, we may need to expand our zone of comfort with you.

Person1: You're being reckless, you know that?
Person2: What are you talking about?
Person1: I didn't tell him about you, but I should have.
Person2: Why didn't you?
Person1: Because I was trying to protect you from him. He's not what he seems.
Person2: That's not your decision to make. I can take care of myself.
Person1: Can you? Because from where I stand, it looks like you're playing with fire.
Person2: You're just trying to control me, like you always do.
Person1: I'm trying to save you from making a mistake. You're mine, in a way. I care about what happens to you.
Person2: That's not true. You're just scared of losing me.
Person1: Maybe I am. But that doesn't change the fact that he's dangerous. Not physically, but... emotionally.
Person2: You're not making any sense. If you're so concerned, then why did you invite him over in the first place?
Person1: I didn't. He invited himself. And now I'm trying to undo the damage.

Person1: I've got a plan, and it's going to be huge. I can feel it.
Person2: Why don't you let me do the thinking, huh? You're not exactly known for your genius ideas.
Person1: Relax, I've got this under control. We'll keep it quiet, low key, no profile. Trust me.
Person2: You're not listening to me, are you? We can't afford to take any risks.

Person1: I don't want to attend the meeting, Rachel. I don't know what it's about, but I don't want to be a part of it. We might end up in a trap.
Person2: Shut up, Alex. They're going to be here any minute. I'm trying to concentrate. What do you need my boss's approval for, Alex? What are you going to do with it?
Person1: What do I do with it? Nothing. It's for peace of mind. It's for the principle. You don't take me to the conference, but you take your colleague? A man? I understand you trust him, but it was you and me who started this project. You and me.
Person2: I'm very angry with you, Alex. Very angry. You're going to ruin everything.

Person1: I think you're being unfair. You're twisting my words to fit your own agenda.
Person2: Oh, but you have, Sir. You've been hiding the truth, and that's a form of deception. A person's been hurt because of your secrecy, and I could make a case for emotional distress.
Person1: If I'd told you the truth, you'd just dismiss it and tell me I'm crazy. You're not listening to me.
Person2: That's not true. I'm a qualified investigator. I've got a reputation for being open-minded. I believe that something's going on here, and I want to get to the bottom of it.
Person1: All right. What do you want to do?
Person2: I think I should take a closer look at your alibi. On a purely factual basis.
Person1: That's it. Get out of my office.
Person2: I want to help you uncover the truth.
Person1: I'll call security.
Person2: Don't do that. Let's talk about this.
Person1: Then leave.

Person1: I don't think I can do this, Rachel. If I take this job, I'll have to make some tough choices.
Person2: Am I...? Would you be willing to compromise your values to get ahead in this company? Answer yes or no.
Person1: I... No.
Person2: Would you be willing to sabotage your colleagues to get a promotion? Yes or no, Alex.
Person1: No.
Person2: Would you be willing to lie to our clients to meet our sales targets?
Person1: No.
Person2: Then for God's sake, don't take this job. You're not cut out for the corporate world. Stick to non-profit or academia.
Person1: I know you mean well, Rachel, but I don't need to play the game the way you did. Or my mentor.
Person2: At least get rid of that naive attitude. I can't think of one successful businessperson who wears their heart on their sleeve.

Person1: I'm the one who came up with the idea, and you're presenting it like it's yours. That's not respect, Alex.
Person2: You're making a mountain out of a molehill. Everyone knows you're a part of the team.
Person1: It's not about being part of the team, it's about acknowledgment. You're trying to diminish my contribution.
Person2: Maybe if you weren't so hung up on the little things, you'd be more successful in your career. You're letting your ego get in the way.
Person1: That's rich coming from you. You're the one who's trying to take credit for my work.

Person1: You're supposed to be at the meeting, not sneaking around here!
Person2: I want to go back to the office. It's cold and dark in this alley. I'm hungry.
Person1: Now listen to me, you're in danger. If we don't get out of here, something awful will happen to you.
Person2: Won't you take care of me? You're always so protective.
Person1: Not this time. You should be grateful I'm even talking to you after what you did with Sophie.
Person2: What are you talking about? I didn't do anything with Sophie.
Person1: Don't play dumb with me! I know all about it. You're just trying to distract me so I won't notice what's really going on.
Person2: I don't know what you're talking about, but I think you're the one who's trying to manipulate me.

Person1: You're telling me the truth, aren't you? About why you chose me for this job?
Person2: Of course, I am. You're the best in the business. I knew I could count on you.
Person1: (scoffs) Save it. I've heard that line before. You're just trying to get inside my head.
Person2: (smirks) Maybe a little. But it's true. You have a certain... tone. A certain confidence that's hard to find.
Person1: (skeptical) A tone? You mean like when I strain to reach for something on a high shelf?
Person2: (laughs) No, not exactly. Although, I have to say, you do seem a bit out of shape. You should really consider hitting the gym.
Person1: (angrily) What's that supposed to mean? You think you can just insult me and I'll do your bidding?
Person2: (calmly) Oh, no, no, no. I'm just trying to help. You see, I've been watching you, and I think you have potential. But you need to work on your weaknesses. Let me help you.
Person1: (hesitates) I don't know...
Person2: (persuasively) Come on, it'll be good for you. And who knows, you might just find yourself enjoying it.

Person1: You're not thinking clearly, Rachel. You're letting your emotions cloud your judgment.
Person2: I am thinking clearly, and I know exactly what I want. I don't need you to tell me what's good for me.
Person1: Come on, we've been friends since college. I'm only trying to help you see things from a different perspective.
Person2: Translation: you're trying to manipulate me into doing what you want. Well, it's not going to work this time.
Person1: I'm not trying to manipulate you, Rachel. I'm just trying to make you see that you're making a mistake. You're giving in to your feelings for him, just like you did with Mark.
Person2: Mark was a mistake, I'll give you that. But this is different. This is about what I want, not what you think I should want.
Person1: You're not thinking about the consequences of your actions. You're not thinking about how this will affect our friendship.
Person2: You're right, I'm not thinking about that. I'm thinking about what I want, and what will make me happy. And if you can't accept that, then maybe we shouldn't be friends anymore.
Person1: Fine, have it your way. But don't come crying to me when it all falls apart.

Person1: You're telling me you've never taken a bribe?
Person2: No, of course not... I never accepted anything...
Person1: Then perhaps the temptation to take one would have been stronger... too strong perhaps...?
Person2: I don't know what you're insinuating. I'm a clean cop.
Person1: We have numerous witnesses who can confirm that you were not always following procedure...
Person2: So what if I bent the rules a little? It was for the greater good.
Person1: The point is, there isn't much time, detective. You need to make a decision.
Person2: And what decision is that? To take the fall for something I didn't do?
Person1: You do nothing and you say nothing. You understand, don't you, detective?
Person2: Yeah, yeah, I guess I do, but there's a lot more to this whole thing than I thought, captain.
Person1: You don't mean you're thinking of testifying against your colleagues?
Person2: I don't know, I don't know! I tell you I ain't made up my mind yet. That's what I wanted to talk to you about.

Person1: Listen, I'm only doing this because I care about you, but you have to promise me you'll be careful. 'Kay?
Person2: 'Kay, what's the plan?
Person1: I'll create a diversion, and then you slip out. But you have to come back to me, or it's all over.
Person2: I'm not going anywhere. You're just trying to scare me into leaving.
Person1: I'm trying to protect you! You don't know what's at stake here. If you stay, you're putting yourself in danger. And I won't let that happen.
Person2: You're not going to let me make my own decisions? That's not protection, that's control.
Person1: Fine, stay then. But don't say I didn't warn you.

Person1: You're not special, just like the rest of us.
Person2: Don't start. You think I'm the one who's been playing games with you?
Person1: I have no idea what's on your mind, but I'm not going to play along.
Person2: What's with the condescending tone? You're the one who's been masquerading as something you're not.
Person1: Don't be dim. I know exactly what you're trying to do.
Person2: And what's that? Make you confront the worst thing that's ever happened to you?
Person1: You're trying to turn this into some kind of twisted game, but I'm not going to let you.
Person2: Maybe I'm just trying to make you see that you're not as innocent as you think you are.
Person1: Innocent? You're the one who's been unfaithful, who's betrayed me.
Person2: And you're the one who's been living in a fantasy land, refusing to see the hard facts.

Person1: I've hired you to help me with a serious matter. That's a prestigious line of work with a long and glorious tradition.
Person2: I'm not sure I'm comfortable with it. Aren't you worried about the consequences?
Person1: Consequences? You're worried about consequences? You're right up there with global warming.
Person2: What do you mean?
Person1: On our way home, a drunken driver could hit us head on and send us flying through the windshield. Terminate us instantly. We'd never experience what it means to make a real difference.
Person2: If you're trying to scare me, it won't work.
Person1: I'm trying to be real here and you're not taking me seriously. You were not hired for your brains, you're here to follow orders.
Person2: I'm sorry, but I won't do something that goes against my values. You can't manipulate me into doing something I don't believe in.

Person1: You want to be at peace? You want to be able to change your mind anytime you feel like it and expect everyone to go along with it?
Person2: I didn't know it was a secret. There aren't supposed to be secrets between us.
Person1: Oh, so now you're playing dumb? You knew exactly what you were doing, and now you're trying to backtrack.
Person2: I was doing my job. I didn't mean to hurt anyone.
Person1: Save it. You're not fooling anyone. You're just trying to cover your tracks.
Person2: That's not fair. You're not listening to me.
Person1: I'm listening, all right. I'm listening to the same old excuses and justifications. You're not sorry, you're just sorry you got caught.
Person2: You're not giving me a chance. You're not even trying to understand.
Person1: Understand? You want me to understand? You're the one who needs to understand. You're the one who needs to take responsibility for your actions.

Person1: You're always dwelling on old things, won't help you. Focus on the now.
Person2: That's rich coming from you. You're the one who's been holding onto grudges for years.
Person1: I have every right to be angry. You've been lying to me for months.
Person2: Oh, so now you're a victim? You know goddamn well what I mean. You're just trying to deflect attention from your own mistakes.
Person1: My mistakes? You're the one who's been spreading rumors about me behind my back.
Person2: That was just a little white lie to protect you. You're so ungrateful. I've been taking care of you, covering for you, and this is how you repay me?
Person1: Protect me? You call that protection? You're just trying to control me.
Person2: Control you? You're the one who's been trying to manipulate me from the start. I'm done playing your games.

Person1: I've never lied to you. I've maybe let you believe things that you wanted to believe, but I've never lied.
Person2: You think I'm some sort of sap?! Don't you?! I'll drink beer and shoot crap with you anytime, but this is different.
Person1: Damn right it is, it's a chance to do something meaningful for a change, to leave our mark on this town. You're not from around here, are you? Where'd you learn to navigate like that?
Person2: Why are you suddenly so curious about me? You're trying to change the subject, aren't you?
Person1: No, I admire you. I...I fell in love with your skills the first time I saw you. I did. I think that you are the most capable person I've ever met.
Person2: I want to know exactly what you're really up to! You're not going to sweet-talk your way out of this one.
Person1: All right. Let me tell you the whole thing. I've been watching you for a while, and I think we could make a great team. Together, we could achieve something remarkable.

Person1: What's that thing you're holding?
Person2: A microrecorder for our little chat. You don't know what real pressure is, do you? You think this is tough? Try being on the streets with no money and no prospects. Now, that's pressure.
Person1: I didn't mean to make it sound like that. I just want to know why you're recording this conversation.
Person2: Oh, I'm just making sure you remember our little deal. You see, I've got something on you, and I'm not afraid to use it. So, let's get down to business.

Person1: I need your help, Rachel. Think of all the times I've covered for you!
Person2: I don't recall any specific instances.
Person1: Well, I'll start keeping track then. You owe me.
Person2: Fine, what do you want me to do?
Person1: I want you to convince my brother to give me a job at his company.
Person2: That's a big ask. What's in it for me?
Person1: I'll introduce you to some influential people in the industry. You know, people who can help your career.
Person2: You're not exactly in a position to make promises like that.
Person1: Oh, I think I am. You see, I've been keeping some secrets for you, and I'm willing to use them to my advantage if you don't comply.
Person2: You wouldn't dare.
Person1: Try me. I'm desperate, and desperate people do desperate things.

Person1: Alex, what's going on here? You're shaking like a leaf.
Person2: Good morning, Rachel. I didn't expect to see you so soon.
Person1: Don't play dumb, Alex. I know you. You're sorry now, aren't you? You tried to take a stand, but you couldn't go all the way.
Person2: I'm sorry for my mistakes, Rachel. And yours. But you didn't do much to stop it, did you? You just walked out, leaving me to face the music alone.
Person1: I didn't think I could antagonize them, Alex. Not for our sake, at least.
Person2: But I was there for our sake, too, Rachel. And what a world it would be if we were all afraid to learn to walk and talk because it might offend them!

Person1: You're playing with fire, you know that?
Person2: I doubt that. Besides, I'm just trying to help.
Person1: Help? You call that help? You're trying to confuse me, make me doubt myself.
Person2: Aw, come on. You know I'm just trying to get under your skin.
Person1: Well, it's not going to work. I know exactly what I'm doing. And if you're not careful, you're going to be the first one I take down.
Person2: Oh, I'm shaking in my boots.
Person1: You should be. I'm not someone to be trifled with. Now, are you going to tell me what I want to know, or do we need to take this outside?

Person1: You're making a grave mistake, Sophia. Firing me will be a permanent scar on your reputation.
Person2: I've already scheduled a press conference to announce the change. Don't trouble yourself, darling.
Person1: It sounds like you've thought this through. Why not just consider my wrist slapped and call me when you feel I've served my time?
Person2: I'm afraid this is non-negotiable. You should focus on your own future, rather than trying to cling to the past.

Person1: You're really going to sign that contract? Don't you think you should read a book on the subject first?
Person2: Pressure, huh? Well, I suppose you're trying to make me think I'm making a mistake. But I've made up my mind.
Person1: Oh, so you think you're above being manipulated? That's cute. Let me ask you, what's the last real thought you had that wasn't influenced by someone else?

Person1: You're afraid of the competition out there, aren't you? You want to be a bum all your life, be my guest.
Person2: That's not fair. I'm just trying to find a way to make it easier for us to get an apartment.
Person1: Oh, come on. You think dressing up like some stupid fashion model is going to impress anyone? It's all about confidence, not the clothes.
Person2: You're one to talk, Mr. "I'm not growing old chasing snails and dying from terminal crotch rot".
Person1: Hey, at least I'm not trying to manipulate people into renting to us by pretending to be something we're not.
Person2: And at least I'm not trying to intimidate you into doing things my way by making you feel like a loser.

Person1: I'm just trying to pay the toll on the road to justice. You know, for the greater good.
Person2: You think you can buy your way out of this situation? That's not how it works around here.
Person1: Oh, come on. Don't be so rigid. Take it easy, man. We can work something out.
Person2: You're not taking this seriously, are you? You're waving your influence around like a gun, thinking it'll get you out of trouble.
Person1: I'm perfectly calm, and I know exactly what I'm doing. You're the one who's getting worked up over nothing.

Person1: You're not taking this seriously, are you? You're just going through the motions.
Person2: Don't tell me how to do my job, Rachel. I've been doing this for years.
Person1: That's exactly my point. You're so caught up in your routine that you're not even thinking about the consequences.
Person2: What consequences? You're being paranoid.
Person1: I'm being paranoid? You're the one who's being reckless. If you don't start taking this seriously, we're all going to end up in trouble.
Person2: Oh, so now you're threatening me?
Person1: I'm not threatening you, I'm warning you. There's a difference.
Person2: Save it, Rachel. I'm not buying what you're selling.
Person1: Fine. But when things go south, don't come crying to me.
Person2: I won't.

Person1: I've been thinking, and I don't want to be a part of this deal anymore.
Person2: Oh, come on. You're not going to let a little risk scare you off, are you? I mean, when was the last time you heard of a judge sending himself to jail?
Person1: That's not the point. The point is, I don't trust you. You're always making jokes and pretending like everything is okay, but I know you're hiding something.
Person2: Ah, you're just being paranoid. I'm telling you, this is a guaranteed ten-thousand-dollar return. You're going to regret it if you back out now.
Person1: I don't care about the money. I care about not getting caught. You're always talking about how you've got everything planned to the last detail, but I don't believe you.
Person2: Fine, don't believe me. But you're going to be the one who's missing out. And by the way, I don't think you're taking this seriously enough. You should be more concerned about what could happen if you don't play along.
Person1: I am taking it seriously. That's why I'm trying to get out of this.
Person2: Well, it's too late for that. You're in this now, whether you like it or not. So, you might as well just relax and enjoy the ride.

Person1: I know you're still hurting from the past. You've got nothing else to live for.
Person2: That's not true. I've found a new sense of purpose.
Person1: Oh, really? Then why do you always challenge my opinions? It's like you're trying to prove something to yourself.
Person2: Maybe I am. But it's not about you, it's about me finding my own voice.
Person1: Well, I care about you, and I think I can help you find what you're looking for. But you need to let me in.
Person2: I'm not sure I'm ready for that. You always try to navigate our differences, but sometimes it feels like you're trying to control me.
Person1: That's not my intention. I just want to help you see that we can be good for each other.

Person1: If you ever loved me, then stand now, and let it happen.
Person2: I wish it was just a year. I lost everything because of you. I have nothing now.
Person1: I don't think that's a good idea. You're trying to guilt trip me, aren't you?
Person2: Look at me, this is what I've become. A shadow of my former self. You could start with an apology.
Person1: I did that. I wrote you a letter, very cordial, very appropriate.
Person2: How? What could you say that would make a difference? You took away a part of me, how do I forgive that?
Person1: I have not had one second of reprieve and no therapy or religion or spiritual plane can ever erase what I feel in every vein of my being.
Person2: Then stand now, and let it happen. Prove to me that you're truly sorry.

Person1: I've been thinking of quitting my job. I've had enough of the corporate ladder.
Person2: You're not serious, are you? You're just trying to get a rise out of me.
Person1: I'm dead serious. I've been feeling suffocated by the bureaucracy.
Person2: Well, you're not going to find it easy to survive on your own. You need my connections to get by in this industry.
Person1: That's exactly what I'm trying to escape - your influence. You've been holding me back for too long.
Person2: Fine, be that way. But when you come crawling back, don't expect me to be waiting with open arms. You'll be lucky if I even return your calls.

Person1: I've been thinking, and I believe it's time we take a stand against their aggression.
Person2: We can't just shoot down their planes, it's a civilian airliner. The world would not look on us kindly.
Person1: Ah, but that's where you're wrong. They're not just civilians, they're spies. And I've hired you to help me uncover the truth.
Person2: I don't know if I'm comfortable with that. It feels like a trick, a preliminary airstrike in response to our troop movement.
Person1: Comfortable? You were not hired for your comfort, you were hired for your skills. And I won't tolerate any hippopotamic land masses getting in the way of our mission.

Person1: You know, I've been thinking, and I realize I'm just a means to an end for you. You only care about what I can do for you.
Person2: That's not true, sweetie. I care about you deeply.
Person1: Save it. I'm like a trophy to you, something to show off to your friends. You're just like my mom, always bragging about her friends' successful kids.
Person2: That's unfair. I've supported you in your career, haven't I?
Person1: Supported me? You've manipulated me into doing what you want, just like my mom tries to guilt trip me into getting a "real" job. You're just using me to feed your own ego.

Person1: Do me a favor. Think about it. Is that too much to ask?
Person2: I gotta tell you, I'm not comfortable getting in any deeper. It's one thing to help you out...
Person1: You're ready to move up. Christ, the way you've been performing, you're doing worse already. May as well get recognized instead of overlooked.
Person2: It's not that I don't appreciate the offer...
Person1: Because when we get to the meeting  
Person2: Wait  what meeting?
Person1: To discuss the project. To investigate.
Person2: You can't be serious. We're not prepared. That's a high-stakes presentation. We're just interns. We wear business casual to work  not power suits.
Person1: Well, you must have realized the chances of an opportunity like this would happen here. In this company. That's basic career development.

Person1: What's going on, Rachel? You've been distant lately.
Person2: Distant? I'm just stressed about the project, that's all. Now, are we having lunch?
Person1: I'm serious. I know you're hiding something. Tell me why you really joined the company or I'll have to reconsider our partnership.
Person2: Oh, touchy, touchy. You're being paranoid. My friends are your friends, we're all in this together.
Person1: I've thought about that. You can have them. But I need the truth. You're not who you say you are, are you?
Person2: You have a little something on your upper lip. And by the way, I think you're misunderstanding the situation.

Person1: You're not going to take my advice, are you?
Person2: I appreciate your concern, but I think I can handle it.
Person1: I'm not trying to turn you into me, I just want to help. You're making a big mistake, and I don't want to see you get hurt.
Person2: You're being deliberately obtuse. You know I can make my own decisions.
Person1: Fine, but don't say I didn't warn you. You're playing with fire, and you're going to get burned.
Person2: I'd rather take my chances than be controlled by you. Think about it, Rhodes.

Person1: You're pushing your luck, pal. If you're going to openly be a troublemaker....
Person2: Ah, go chase yourself. I'm just trying to understand why we can't talk to different kinds of people?
Person1: Surprise me gently with a chainsaw. Do I look like someone who cares about your opinions? If I did, I probably wouldn't mind talking to the Geek Squad.
Person2: There is no Geek Squad here. You're just trying to intimidate me.
Person1: When there is, you can forget about it. And I swear to God, you ever question my judgment again, I'll make sure you regret it, you got me?

Person1: You're not much with people, are you?
Person2: If I call the authorities, your reputation will go down to a minus sign.
Person1: Bluff. You've waited too long to take action.
Person2: For a thousand, what do I get?
Person1: I'll pretend to care about your concerns.
Person2: For five hundred?
Person1: I'll stick around and wait for the thousand.
Person2: You mentioned a solution.
Person1: Sorry, another client paid for that. You can hire me not to reveal it.
Person2: A thousand, and I want it now.
Person1: Got the courage to take it on yourself?

Person1: You're the one who's been acting strange lately!
Person2: I'm just trying to figure out what's going on. You're the one who's been asking all the questions.
Person1: And what was your answer when I asked you about the package?
Person2: I said I wanted to talk to a lawyer.
Person1: You're not thinking clearly, are you? You're not telling me the truth. Who were you talking to when you said "Do something"?
Person2: Stop it, just stop it! You're trying to confuse me!

Person1: Do you think you're the only one who feels anything? Is that what you think?
Person2: Eleven twenty-five.
Person1: What do I owe you? You've been watching me, I can sense it.
Person2: You know why? He tries to hold her. She resists.
Person1: I've seen you at the park, at the coffee shop, always lurking. What's your game?
Person2: Would you let me pass?
Person1: You're trying to get inside my head, but I won't let you. Dance with me.
Person2: No. I don't dance with strangers.
Person1: I want to touch you. I want the things which are mine. Which belong to me.
Person2: You're not even making sense.

Person1: I'm sick to death of it. We can't do anything right for you, can we?
Person2: It also makes God enormous. I think of the scope of your universe, and it takes my breath away.
Person1: You're not listening to me. You're not even trying to understand.
Person2: I do understand. You're the proof. You tell them your story. Ultimately, they'll have no choice but to believe you.
Person1: But what's the point? It's not like it's going to change anything.
Person2: The world is on fire, and people need something they can believe in, something worthy. You can give it to them!
Person1: I don't know if I can do that. I'm not sure I'm ready for that kind of responsibility.
Person2: If you don't, who will? You're the only one who can bring hope to this desperate world.

Person1: You're in an ideal position -- he trusts you.
Person2: You heartless jerk. You're using me, just like you used my father.
Person1: I did what was necessary to protect you. You're the only one who can help me now.
Person2: Help you? You've been lying to me my whole life. Everything you said, everything you did.
Person1: I did it for your own good. You're the key to unlocking the truth about your father's past.
Person2: The truth? You call this the truth? You're just trying to manipulate me, like you always do.
Person1: I'm trying to help you, but you need to trust me. You need to find out who this man is -- the one calling himself Dyle.
Person2: Maybe he really is Dyle. He could still be alive.
Person1: No, I'm afraid not. His death is registered with the War Department in Washington.
Person2: Then who's this one? And why should I care?
Person1: Because you're the only one who can stop him. And if you don't, he'll destroy everything your father worked for.

Person1: You're not talking sense, Alex! How could you do this to yourself? How could you do this to us?
Person2: Whatever happened, whatever I did -- I know it's my fault and I know I can never make it up to you. Please don't be touching me, it's making this worse.
Person1: Do you know what you did to me? Leave me alone, Alex. Please. I'll not take that kind of talk from you.

Person1: I'm sayin', the experts, they can advise us on this! I'm sayin' call a professional!
Person2: You're just trying to justify your own desires, aren't you? You're not thinking about what's best for everyone.
Person1: Heck, you don't know! You're just trying to control me here! I'm the one who's been wronged.
Person2: That's not true, and you know it. You're just trying to shift the blame. We need to think this through together.
Person1: I've had enough of your condescending tone! You're not my father, you know.
Person2: Maybe not, but someone needs to talk some sense into you. You're being reckless and impulsive.
Person1: You're one to talk! You're the one who's been holding us back all along. If it weren't for you, we'd have solved this problem already.
Person2: That's not fair, and you know it. I'm just trying to protect you from yourself.

Person1: You think you're so smart, don't you, Professor?
Person2: If you are going to bully me like this, you had better do your homework. You obviously have no idea how impertinent and stupid your questions are.
Person1: I see why you're here -- you knew that nobody was coming.
Person2: It would be truer to say, I think, that a lot of people in high places knew me.
Person1: You're lying. You wanted to be near the Dean. It looked like your big chance tonight, but you're wrong, you can't win him back -- not that way.
Person2: You sure knew a lot of people in high places. But I knew exactly what you meant.

Person1: I've heard some foolish things in my life. You're really going to leave your wife and child for that actress?
Person2: I'm a prodigal son, the black sheep of a white flock. I shall die on the gallows. What's it to you?
Person1: Have you thought about the consequences of your actions? You're not just hurting them, but also your sick father.
Person2: I haven't a bit of character. None at all. But I do know that I love her, and I've never felt this way before.
Person1: Love? You call this love? You're just running away from your responsibilities like a happy pig, devouring anything of life that pleases you.
Person2: You don't understand. You've never been in my shoes. You've always been the perfect one, the one with the better head start.
Person1: That's not the point. The point is you're making a mistake, and I'm trying to stop you from making it.
Person2: Can't I be myself without you jumping in with your right and wrong? The world is not black and white. Show me one perfect person. If you can't, don't ask me to be.
Person1: I do have a right to ask you to be a little bit better than me and your father because we gave you a better head start. You have no right to complain to us about your not having enough.
Person2: You're just trying to control me, to make me feel guilty. But it won't work. I've made up my mind.

Person1: You're really going to skip my birthday celebration for a work meeting?
Person2: I'm sorry, Alex, but this meeting is crucial for my career.
Person1: If you really cared about our friendship, you would make time. I always prioritize your events.
Person2: It's not about that, Rachel. I just have other commitments that I can't reschedule.
Person1: Just remember who's always there for you. You're going to regret missing this.
Person2: I do appreciate you, but sometimes I have to put my career first.

Person1: You cannot hide from me. I've been waiting for this moment for years.
Person2: Don't give me this, we were partners. I thought we had a deal.
Person1: Partners? Ha! You were just a means to an end. And now, you're going to get me what I want.
Person2: I can get you the information, but it's not going to be easy. It's heavily guarded.
Person1: I don't pay you to make excuses, I pay you to get results. You have until Friday to deliver.
Person2: That's not enough time. I need more time, just a few more days...
Person1: You're not in a position to negotiate. You're lucky I'm even giving you a chance to redeem yourself. Friday, or else.

Person1: Who are you to tell me what to do? What can you do to me?
Person2: Don't play dumb, you know exactly what I'm talking about. You're in danger, and I'm the only one who can help you.
Person1: I'm not afraid of you. There's nothing to be frightened of.
Person2: That's exactly what he wants you to think. He's been playing you all along, and you're too blind to see it.

Person1: I've been thinking, and I believe there's only one way to know for certain if you're ready for this mission.
Person2: What's that?
Person1: Let me take you through a simulation. You can learn more from one exercise than from months of training.
Person2: I'm not sure...I've heard rumors about your methods.
Person1: You're not afraid, are you? I've played it out with others, and the results have been remarkable. How many lives are at stake if we don't take action? You may only get one shot at stopping the enemy.
Person2: Well...I suppose one simulation is all right.

Person1: I'm feeling suffocated in this relationship. I need some space.
Person2: Remember how I supported you through your parents' divorce? You owe it to me to work through this.
Person1: That was different. You're not giving me the freedom I need.
Person2: You won't find anyone else who cares about you like I do. You're just being ungrateful.
Person1: That's not fair. You're trying to control me, not care for me.
Person2: Life isn't fair, and sometimes we have to make sacrifices. You're being selfish.

Person1: Who do you think you are, questioning my decisions like that?!
Person2: Take it easy, don't do anything reckless. I've been thinking about that, and I've decided to give you a chance to prove yourself.
Person1: That wasn't the deal. You're just trying to manipulate me into doing what you want.
Person2: So, what's the problem? Things have changed, and I think you should be grateful for the opportunity.
Person1: I'm not leaving until I get what I came for. Don't push me, or I might lose my temper and make a scene.

Person1: I've been watching you, and I think you're just the person I need for a little trip I'm planning.
Person2: What kind of trip?
Person1: A business trip to Paris. I need someone to accompany me, for... company, and to help with my correspondence.
Person2: And what makes you think I'm the right person for the job?
Person1: Well, I've heard you're quite resourceful, and I'm willing to pay top dollar. Say, 2,000 francs?
Person2: That's a lot of money. What's the catch?
Person1: No catch, I just need someone I can trust. And I think you're that person. You seem... impressionable.
Person2: I'm not sure I like the way you're talking to me. You're not going to try to take advantage of me, are you?
Person1: Oh, no, no, no. I just want to help you. You seem like someone who could use a little guidance, and I'm happy to provide it. For a price, of course.
Person2: I don't know... I'll have to think about it.
Person1: Don't think too long, my dear. I'm not a patient man. And I always get what I want.

Person1: I don't want to take any chances. You swear to me you'll get us out of here?
Person2: I swear on my family's life I'll get us out. You can trust me.
Person1: Trust you? You're the one who got us into this mess. If we make a mistake, you'll be the first to abandon ship.
Person2: That's not fair. I've kept my end of the deal so far. You're just trying to intimidate me.
Person1: Intimidate you? I'm just trying to make sure you don't cross us. You're not the only one who can calculate the percentages.

Person1: I don't, I don't remember. What do I owe you?
Person2: Rae, don't do this now...
Person1: Eleven twenty-five? That's not the point. This whole thing is stupid.
Person2: Rae, listen to me...

Person1: You think I didn't have some harsh words for that little troublemaker? You think I couldn't figure out some sharp criticisms?
Person2: That's what you said the first time we met. You didn't even know me. You want to drive us apart, don't you? To beat us.
Person1: Well, maybe your version of growing up is 'Just win, baby'. We've been through too much together, to let them do it. We belong together.
Person2: You weren't passing 'em out. You taught my child that I am some unsuccessful loser. Who didn't care about her pain.

Person1: You're a master of words, aren't you? Nasty with language, always cutting deep.
Person2: And you're a master of assumptions. What makes you think I'd stoop to your level?
Person1: Don't tempt me. I've seen the way you operate, always playing on people's fears.
Person2: Fears? Ha! You're the one who's afraid. Afraid of being exposed, of being seen for what you truly are.
Person1: What are you, eh? A saint? A hero? You're just as dirty as the rest of us.
Person2: Oh, I'm not dirty. I'm just... refined. And I know exactly how to handle people like you.

Person1: I have a call for you, Dr. Lee. 17-year-old patient needs your expertise.
Person2: I'm not sure I'm ready for this. I've only assisted in a few surgeries.
Person1: Nonsense, you're a brilliant student. Think of this as a practice run. The more you operate, the better you'll become. And don't you want to make your mentor proud?
Person2: But what if I mess up? I don't want to be responsible for someone's life.
Person1: Everybody makes mistakes, Dr. Lee. It's just that nobody talks about them. You owe it to yourself and your patient to try.

Person1: You're the only one who can help me. The power to see is a gift.
Person2: A gift you've given me. What can my power give you in return?
Person1: The truth about my past. I've been searching for it my whole life.
Person2: Why must you know? It's better left forgotten.
Person1: Because I've been humiliated, and I need to know why. You defended me once, but now it's time for the truth.
Person2: You're not ready for it. It's a burden you can't carry.
Person1: I've carried the weight of my ignorance for too long. Tell me, what lies in the shadows of my memory?
Person2: Very well. But know that once you see, you can never unsee. The truth will haunt you, and soon the darkness will come for you, even here.

Person1: You think you're so smart, Alex. You wanted to be near me, to prove that you're the better choice.
Person2: I didn't, but I see why you're here - you're trying to convince yourself that you're making the right decision.
Person1: You're lying. You know I'm torn, and you're trying to guilt trip me into staying.
Person2: Lying to you? Why should I? You're the one who's been preaching about following your heart, but now you're going to turn your back on it. That makes you a hypocrite.
Person1: You're just trying to manipulate me into feeling guilty. It won't work.
Person2: Maybe not, but you'll have to live with yourself knowing you've turned your back on what could have been. And that's my problem, not yours.

Person1: You're not thinking clearly, and I know why. You're letting your emotions cloud your judgment.
Person2: Oh, Rachel, always with a new theory. You think you're so smart, don't you?
Person1: It's not about being smart, it's about being objective. And I know something's holding you back - and so do you.
Person2: Maybe we should take a step back and re-evaluate our priorities before making any decisions.
Person1: That's just what I'm trying to do. But you're not listening.

Person1: You know what I think? I think you're very sick. Very sick.
Person2: I thought so.
Person1: Is that why you came to see me?
Person2: You want to fuck with my head. But you can't fuck with my head.
Person1: Why? Because I'm a doctor?
Person2: Because I'm not crazy, and you're trying to make me think I am.
Person1: You think I want to manipulate you? When you're with me, you don't have to worry about that kind of stuff.
Person2: Why is that?
Person1: Because I like you. I think you're beautiful. I think if we were together, you would love it. You wouldn't even believe it.
Person2: I wouldn't believe it? You're just trying to confuse me.
Person1: I don't know. I just think that you would love it. You're a very interesting case, you know that?
Person2: I'm not a case. I'm a person. And I'm not going to let you play games with me.

Person1: I did it because I'd never stopped thinking about you and if I didn't find you I knew my life would never be good again.
Person2: Is that a threat, Rachel? You're not even trying to hide your true intentions anymore.
Person1: Look, as I have said and will continue to say, my priority is to make things right between us. But if you're not willing to meet me halfway, then maybe we're not as compatible as I thought.
Person2: While you remain in this relationship, your priorities will always be the same as mine. I imagine that is a simple enough equation for someone as intelligent as you to figure out.

Person1: I bless the day you came to us, son. You know that. But some people wouldn't understand.
Person2: You trying to tell me how to run my own life? I got my own plans, okay? If you wanta be part of it, fine. If not, just sit there, that's all.
Person1: 'F we're working together, it's our business too. An' how do we know you ain't one of those guys who's gonna take advantage of us?
Person2: Listen, Smart Guy. I'll make my own decisions. I got my own reasons. You can either trust me or walk out.

Person1: I feel like I'm walking on eggshells around you, Rachel. You always make me feel guilty for not meeting your expectations.
Person2: That's not fair, Emily. I just want what's best for you, for us. You're being overly sensitive.
Person1: Maybe that's the problem. You always think you know what's best for me. I need to figure out what I want on my own.
Person2: If you're not happy with how things are, then maybe we're not meant to be friends. I didn't think I had to invite you to every little gathering.
Person1: That's not what I'm saying. I just need some space and independence. You're always trying to control the situation.
Person2: I'm just trying to help. You're being dramatic and ungrateful.

Person1: You're saying you didn't know what you were getting into, but the contract is clear.
Person2: You deceived me, just like you deceived Icarus. You told me it would be ready soon, but it's been months.
Person1: That's highly irrelevant to this case. You're just trying to distract from your own mistakes.
Person2: You're the one who's lying. You're just trying to cover your tracks, like you did with Jabez Stone.
Person1: Don't be naive. You're just another pawn in a larger game. You're not thinking about the bigger picture.
Person2: The bigger picture is that you're manipulating people for your own gain. You're using them, just like you used me.

Person1: You want me to what?
Person2: I want you to recall every detail of your past life. Every memory, every experience.
Person1: It'll take hours. You can't make me do this.
Person2: Oh, I think I can. You see, I've been artificially implanted as an emergency measure. I'm sorry to tell you this, but you've suffered a severe memory loss. We can't snap you out of your amnesia. I've been sent in to try to guide you back.
Person1: Bullshit. This is all part of some experiment, isn't it?
Person2: Think about it. Your memories started to fade in the middle of our session. Everything after that--the fragmented images, the disjointed thoughts--these are all elements of your repressed past. And I'm here to help you uncover them.
Person1: What about the voice? The one that's been whispering in my ear? Is that a coincidence?
Person2: Mr. Johnson, can you hear yourself? "The voice is real because you're hearing it?" That's exactly what I'm trying to help you figure out.

Person1: I don't want to attend the ceremony, Father. I've never been one for grand events.
Person2: But it's a family tradition, and your great-aunt is not in good health. You ought to pay your respects before it's too late.
Person1: I'm not sure I'm comfortable with all the attention. Can't I just send a gift instead?
Person2: You're being selfish, thinking only of yourself. We owe it to your great-aunt to be there for her. Besides, it's not every day you get to meet a famous actress.
Person1: I suppose you're right, Father. But what if I embarrass myself in front of all those people?
Person2: Nonsense, you'll be fine. And if you're not, I'll be there to support you. Now, let's go to the track and celebrate beforehand. I've got a hot tip on a horse that's going to make us rich.
Person1: You're going to bet my college fund on a horse? Are you crazy?
Person2: It's a sure thing, I promise. And think of all the good we can do with the winnings. We can pay off the mortgage, help out your great-aunt... the possibilities are endless.

Person1: I know what you're looking for, to break the cycle.
Person2: And what makes you think you can help me?
Person1: I just don't know if I should be trusting you right now.
Person2: Yeah, every time someone gets close, they wind up hurt.

Person1: Trust me, we need to leave now.
Person2: What's going on? You're scaring me.
Person1: Stay away from the window. Get down.
Person2: Why? What's happening?
Person1: I'll explain later. Just do as I say.
Person2: This has something to do with your past, doesn't it?
Person1: I'm trying to protect you. Don't question me.
Person2: You're not telling me the truth. You're hiding something.
Person1: I'm doing this for us. You have to trust me.

Person1: You're really charming her, aren't you?
Person2: She smiled, didn't she? That's all that matters.
Person1: That's not cool. You're making me feel like I don't exist.
Person2: Oh, come on. I'm just trying to get us a good deal. You know I love you.
Person1: Actions speak louder than words. Sometimes it feels like you're just using me.
Person2: That's not true. I do care about you, I just need to handle this situation better.
Person1: Please, just be honest with me. I'm here for you.
Person2: Trust me, baby. We're going to get what we want. Just play along.

Person1: You're actually talking about this?
Person2: Your life is shit, and I'm to blame. It's that simple. It's also very safe.
Person1: Because, because, you know, it's a crime.
Person2: That's right. It's a crime. And I'm the one who can set you free.

Person1: You think you're so much better than me, don't you? Beautiful.
Person2: What are you talking about? This has nothing to do with you.
Person1: Oh, but it does. You see, I've been in your shoes before. I used to try and pretend I was dreaming all the pain. But why kid yourself? Some things have to be endured.
Person2: You're not even making sense. You're just trying to confuse me.
Person1: Confuse you? No, I'm just trying to make you see things from a different perspective. You're so caught up in your own little world, you don't even realize what's going on around you. Take it from me, I've been there.

Person1: You mean you don't want the usual day and a half to think it over? You are in a hurry! Somebody chasing you?
Person2: Of course not. Please. I just want to get out of this place.
Person1: Well, I think you're a lying, backstabbing... customer. But it's nice to know you care about getting a good deal.
Person2: What's that supposed to mean?
Person1: It means I know you're trying to lowball me. You think I'm stupid?
Person2: I'm just trying to negotiate.
Person1: Save it. You're not as slick as you think you are. I'll give you a good price, but you have to make a decision now.
Person2: Fine. What's the price?
Person1: Your car plus three hundred. And I'll throw in some extras.
Person2: That's still too high.
Person1: You're not going to find a better deal anywhere else. Trust me, I'm doing you a favor. You should be grateful.
Person2: Grateful? You're the one who's trying to rip me off.
Person1: Oh, come on. Don't be like that. I'm just trying to make a living. You're not going to report me to the authorities, are you?
Person2: What are you talking about?
Person1: Never mind. Just take the deal or leave it. Your choice.

Person1: You don't have to do that.
Person2: Yes, you! I know you're trying to butter me up with this exclusive vinyl collection, but I'm not buying it.
Person1: What's wrong? I thought you'd appreciate the rare Carpenters covers.
Person2: Appreciate it? You're trying to distract me from the real issue. You think a few alt-rock bands can make me forget what you did?
Person1: I don't know what you're talking about. I'm just trying to make amends.
Person2: Save it. I know your tactics. You're trying to manipulate me into forgiving you, but it won't work this time.

Person1: You're still upset, aren't you? Isn't it true that your whole story is nothing more than a desperate attempt to get my attention?
Person2: No, I just wanted to explain what happened with Rachel.
Person1: I suggest it never happened. You're just trying to make me jealous, aren't you?
Person2: Why would I do that? You're the one who's been distant lately.
Person1: Oh, uh... I've just been busy with work. You know how it is.
Person2: So that's it? You don't care about what I have to say?
Person1: Of course I do... It's just that right now I need to focus on my career.
Person2: What's Rachel's problem anyway? Did she actually tell you you couldn't see me?
Person1: No, no... not exactly... she just doesn't understand how I would know somebody like you...
Person2: What does she mean by that - "somebody like me"?
Person1: Just someone so... unpredictable. You always keep me on my toes.
Person2: You must have done something to make her think you're interested in me.
Person1: I... I don't think so. You're just being paranoid.
Person2: Does that mean you're not interested in me?
Person1: In what way do you mean? As a friend, of course.
Person2: I don't think you understand how I really feel about you, Alex.
Person1: ...What do you mean? Don't be ridiculous, we're just friends.

Person1: You know, my mother used to say, "A good wife is a happy wife." I never understood what she meant until I met you.
Person2: I've had enough of these empty phrases tonight. What's the point of saying something if you don't mean it?
Person1: Oh, come on, have another glass of wine. It'll help you relax. You're too tense.
Person2: I'm tense because you're not listening to me. You're just trying to distract me with your words.
Person1: I'm trying to help you see things from a different perspective. You're too caught up in your own thoughts. Trust me, I know what's best for you.
Person2: That's exactly what my mother used to say. And look where it got me.

Person1: You're not going to get away with this, are you, Rachel?
Person2: With what? You're the one who's been playing games from the start.
Person1: Don't pretend you're innocent. I know why you're doing this. Nastiness. You're nasty with words, and I'm starting to think you're nasty with deeds too.
Person2: If you're so sure, then why are you still talking to me? You could have cut me out of your life a long time ago.
Person1: Because I want to know the truth. And I want to know why you're taking sides against me now.
Person2: I'm not taking sides. I'm just not afraid of you like everyone else is. And that scares you, doesn't it?

Person1: You're not going to leave me alone until I say what you want to hear, are you?
Person2: I defended you, but you're too blind to see it. Now everyone feels sorry for you, and that's exactly what you wanted.
Person1: Don't pretend like you're doing this for me. You're doing it for yourself, to prove some twisted point.
Person2: If you can't see the truth, then maybe I should just let you hang yourself with your own lies.

Person1: I'm getting out of here, man. I'm not going to stay here and I'm not giving up.
Person2: But sometimes it feels like you're just pushing me into what you want.
Person1: I thought I would square it away with you... you know? That I would get you down here and that I would say so long to you... or, if you wanted... you know, to take a trip...
Person2: I appreciate your support, but I need space to make my own choices too.
Person1: I'm warped... I'm warped! You're really crazy, Leon.
Person2: I don't know what to say, Sonny. When you hit me with that shit. I mean, what am I supposed to say?
Person1: I've always supported your dreams and aspirations. I thought I was helping.
Person2: You're not helping, Sonny. You're suffocating me.
Person1: I'm not going to stay here and I'm not giving up. I mean, huh, they're going to kill me, anyway. So forget it!
Person2: That's not the point, Sonny. The point is you're not listening to me.
Person1: I'm listening, Leon. I'm listening. But I've got to get out of here.
Person2: Where are you going to go, Sonny? Algeria? Denmark? Sweden?
Person1: Who knows? I think we're gonna go... we worked it out to Algeria. So, I don't know.
Person2: You're really crazy, Sonny. You're warped.

Person1: You're so lost you don't even know how you like your coffee.
Person2: Why can't you help me now? You're sitting right across from me!
Person1: I'm trying to, but you're not listening. You're just like Quentin, always putting yourself ahead of the mission.
Person2: That's not fair. I'm just trying to figure out what I want.
Person1: Want? You don't know what you want. You're like a leaf blowing in the wind. You liked it black with the artist, then you switched to latte with the musician, and now you're on some health kick with green tea.
Person2: So what if I've changed my mind? You're one to talk, always trying to manipulate people into doing what you want.
Person1: I'm not manipulating, I'm guiding. You need someone to show you the way, to take you on a journey of self-discovery. You want a man who will wake you up at dawn to watch the sunrise, who will take you to a secluded spot to read you a poem.
Person2: Stop it. You're not going to psychoanalyze me into submission. I can make my own decisions.
Person1: Fine, but you're making a mistake. You're going to end up stuck in a rut, wondering what could've been if only you had listened to me.

Person1: I don't recall authorizing you to have a personal life.
Person2: Don't be nervous. They said you'd be nervous.
Person1: You're not taking this seriously, are you?
Person2: I can't tell you how not interested I am.

Person1: I've thought about this quite a bit, and I've realised what I probably should do is just carve out a goal for my future and find out what I wanna do with my life.
Person2: You're bluffing. You've waited too long.
Person1: Am I going to England with her? I mean, she's gonna run off with some English guy? There's no way.
Person2: For five hundred, what do I get?
Person1: I'm good at being with your daughter. I'm the distraction that's going to England with her.
Person2: You're not a permanent part of her life. You're a distraction. If I call the police, your price will go down to a minus sign.
Person1: I'm the one who can help you deal with your family stuff. You know, my daughter's a lot different to you.
Person2: Very talented. But I don't deserve to lose my daughter over this. I don't deserve to have you as my go-between.
Person1: I'll stick around and wait for the five hundred. You can hire me not to use the information.
Person2: A thousand. Got it on you?
