Person2: You're right. I was so desperate to make everyone believe I was happy that I spent six grand on a lie.
Person1: An artist of your caliber...I've always thought so...Well, you just get an idea, and try to find the best way to express it in pictorial form.
Person2: Go ahead, hate me. You were running out of steam on the whole project thing. Maybe now you'll be able to hold onto this just long enough to ruin your next collaboration.
Person1: I, uh...I've written a letter to the studio and to SAG protesting...Bill, get a copy of that letter...! I just wanted to tell you that I am past chagrined, I'm mortified at the way you were spoken to...
Person2: I'm only trying to...get out of this toxic partnership.
Person1: Stay with me. I need you. We start to shoot tomorrow and then it belongs to us. Stay. Stay. Tonight...when...When they've gone. Let's talk. Let's really talk.
Person2: I'm sorry, Alex  it's gone beyond that.

Person1: You're going to regret not telling me the truth. I'm giving you one last chance. What did you do with the documents, Alex?
Person2: I'm in love with you, and I did it for us. We can finally be together now.
Person1: Oh, come on... You think a cheap excuse like that will get you out of this?

Person1: You're a hardcase too, ain't you? I thought we went to the art gallery last week.
Person2: March, I thought. Did you speak to the curator?
Person1: Was it? Did you notice the new exhibit?
Person2: March 15th is my information. And when did you last see the artist?
Person1: A few days ago. I don't remember the exact date.
Person2: And yesterday a valuable painting is stolen from the gallery, and the owner tells the Police it was stolen on March 15th. We look at security records and we see oh! You're in the gallery and then our guard remembers two people taking a suspicious interest in the painting.
Person1: It's not a pattern, it's a coincidence. There must be fifty people visiting the gallery on that day.
Person2: 17 people. You're not listening to me, are you? They're out there, waiting for you to slip up. We don't have a chance, unless you give up peaceful.

Person1: I need your help, Rachel. You're the only one I can trust.
Person2: What's going on, Alex? You're scaring me.
Person1: Just promise me you won't tell anyone, especially not Dad. Please, Rachel.
Person2: This isn't like when you got in trouble for skipping school, Alex. What's really going on?
Person1: I'll take care of it, I just need some time. You have to give me a chance to fix this on my own.
Person2: You're not thinking clearly, Alex. You're going to get yourself into more trouble if you don't let someone help you.
Person1: You don't understand, Rachel. I have to do this myself. I owe it to myself.
Person2: Fine, but if things get out of hand, I'm not going to stand by and watch you ruin your life.
Person1: I appreciate that, Rachel. You're a true friend.
Person2: Just don't make me regret this, Alex.

Person1: If you ever cared about me, then tell me the truth. What's going on with my memories?
Person2: Easy there, Alex. You need to relax. You're not ready for the truth yet.
Person1: I can handle it. I need to know what's happening to me. Is it something I'm taking that's making me forget?
Person2: You're not ready to hear it, Alex. But I'll tell you this: it's okay to still love someone after they're gone. You've got to quit blaming yourself, okay?

Person1: You're not telling me the truth. What did you do?
Person2: I'm being honest, I didn't do anything. You're being paranoid.
Person1: Don't play dumb with me. We've worked together for years, and I know your tactics. You're trying to manipulate me.
Person2: That's not fair. I'm just trying to have an open conversation. You're the one who's being aggressive.
Person1: Open conversation? You're the one who's hiding something. I can see it in your eyes. Tell me exactly what you did, or I'll make sure everyone knows what you're capable of.
Person2: You're not going to bully me into confessing something I didn't do. I'm not afraid of you.

Person1: I'm sorry, I thought it was a nice thing to do.
Person2: Listen to me. You must never tell anyone about this. Never.
Person1: Why? What's going on?
Person2: We're in this together now, and we need to brainstorm a way out of this mess.
Person1: I can help you. I'm great at coming up with plans. With my help, we can get out of this situation.
Person2: Really? You'd do that for me?
Person1: Of course. We're in this together, aren't we?

Person1: What's he got? This is a nice place, but there are other nice places. It's not the money. Not for you.
Person2: You're saying that because you think I'm guilty about something.
Person1: Nah! Maybe that's the kind of friend I am. You're trying to figure out where to start, but you're not being honest with yourself.
Person2: Had to leave? Believe me, we all wanted to leave...but you know what? We stayed.
Person1: You're not telling me everything. Cobb says there's no telling what you're going to care about.
Person2: After the funeral, I just had to get out of there. A lot of things fell apart.
Person1: I know... You're trying to make me believe you, but I'm not buying it. You're holding on to something, and it's not just guilt.
Person2: Maybe I shouldn't have gone out on that line. Maybe I panicked.
Person1: You're not the only one who didn't panic. So do everyone a favor, don't hog all the guilt. You held on as long as you could.
Person2: I don't expect you to understand. You couldn't.
Person1: You're saying I don't understand? I'm the one who knows you. I'm the one you made promises to. I'm the one who spent too many nights wondering if you were ever going to make it back in one piece.

Person1: I've got a problem with the new marketing strategy.
Person2: What's wrong with it?
Person1: It's going to blow us out of the water if we don't make some changes. And I mean it.
Person2: Who's behind this strategy?
Person1: Rachel, the new consultant. Ever since her promotion, she's been trying to make a name for herself.
Person2: Pay her what she wants. Give her the creative freedom she's asking for.
Person1: Are you kidding me? She's going to take advantage of us.
Person2: Relax, I know what I'm doing. They're going to love her ideas, I'm sure.
Person1: I don't know... I have a bad feeling about this.
Person2: Trust me, it'll be fine.

Person1: I don't want to take any risks, Rachel. I don't know what it is, but I don't want to get involved.
Person2: Oh please, Alex... don't even think it. You're the only person who ever... It's just... Can't you trust me?
Person1: I don't know. You're asking me to shut up and play along, but I'm not sure I can do that.
Person2: Yes you can. If you love me you can trust me, right? A little faith, that's all I'm asking.
Person1: Right. Except... my instincts have a way of --
Person2: No, Alex, it's not your instincts, it's us. You and me. And I'm telling you now that I'll make it worth your while, okay? I'll make it worth the risk.

Person1: I've got a line on another place you can use for now.
Person2: Another place where? Does it matter?
Person1: If it's any comfort to you, I don't think you're crazy.
Person2: Thanks. Coming from you that really means a lot to me.
Person1: I believe that something happened here and I want to do something about it.
Person2: All right. What do you want to do?
Person1: I think I should spend the night here. On a purely scientific basis.
Person2: You're homeless. Frank's got a line on another place you can use for now.
Person1: Good-bye. Well, your luck is holding. They sublet your place.
Person2: No kiss?

Person1: You're going to end up just like your mother, always running from the truth.
Person2: I want to go back upstairs. This conversation is making me uncomfortable.
Person1: Listen to me, child. We need to leave this place tonight. If we stay, something terrible will happen to us.
Person2: Why should I trust you? You're the one who's been lying to me all along.
Person1: Because I'm the only one who can save you. You need my help, and I'm willing to give it to you... if you pray for forgiveness and ask for my guidance.
Person2: I don't know... I'm scared.
Person1: That's exactly what I'm trying to protect you from. Now, are you with me or against me?

Person1: I think you've forgotten something.
Person2: You're even more arrogant than I remembered.
Person1: I'm just trying to point out the flaws in your plan. You always challenge my opinions, but I still care about you.
Person2: That's rich coming from you. You're the one who's always trying to manipulate me into doing what you want.
Person1: I'm just trying to help. You're the one who's being stubborn and refusing to see reason.
Person2: I see reason just fine. I just don't see why I should have to conform to your idea of what's reasonable.

Person1: You're not thinking clearly, Alex. We need to make some tough decisions.
Person2: I won't fire the entire team. They're innocent.
Person1: Innocent? They're holding us back. We're moving forward, and whoever can't keep up is expendable. You're letting your emotions cloud your judgment.
Person2: That's not true. I'm just trying to be fair.
Person1: Fair? You want to be fair? I can make you an offer. Give me control, and I'll make sure you're protected. Refuse, and... well, let's just say you won't be the one making the decisions anymore.
Person2: What kind of offer is that?
Person1: The kind that will save your friends. Yes, I know you care about them deeply. Especially about... Sarah.

Person1: You're always so busy with your work, I feel like I'm wasting my time waiting for you. We could be doing something exciting, like traveling or trying new restaurants.
Person2: You know I'm not getting any younger, okay? I can't just drop everything for a spontaneous adventure.
Person1: So, you're saying I'm being immature, wanting to have some fun?
Person2: Right now, yeah, you're not thinking about the bigger picture. You're not considering the consequences of my actions.
Person1: The consequences of your actions? You're the one who's always telling me what to do, what to think. You're the one who's controlling me.
Person2: I'm just trying to guide you, to help you make better decisions. You're the one who's being reckless and impulsive.
Person1: Guide me? You're not guiding me, you're manipulating me. And I'm tired of it.
Person2: That's not fair. I'm only trying to help.
Person1: Help? You call this help? You're suffocating me, and you don't even realize it.

Person1: You know how long it took me to find that perfect gift for you?
Person2: No, how long?
Person1: About three hours. You're the one who thinks you deserve the best, what did you expect but the best effort from me?
Person2: Do you ever get like the slightest inkling that you might want to help me instead of doing absolutely nothing?
Person1: Actually, I do. But you're the one who's been taking me for granted. You owe me an explanation.
Person2: I don't have one. You're just trying to guilt trip me.
Person1: Maybe a little. But someone's got to make you realize your mistakes. Now, are you going to make it up to me or not?

Person1: I've never been one for fancy parties, but I appreciate the effort you put into this.
Person2: You're just trying to be polite, aren't you? You think I'm some kind of fool who can't see through your fake charm? I'm not afraid of you, you know. My son, the lawyer, he's the one who's really making a difference in this community.
Person1: I'm not trying to impress you, I just want to have a good time. And I'm sure your son is very accomplished, but I'm not in competition with him.
Person2: Oh, you're not in competition? That's rich coming from someone who's just trying to fit in. You're just a bit odd, it looks like to me. Not really, I'm just joking with you. But seriously, my son would never stoop to your level. He's a real go-getter, unlike some people I could mention.

Person1: What's the matter with you? You're sweating. You look like you've seen a ghost.
Person2: It's probably something I ate. I just need some fresh air. You go on ahead.
Person1: Don't be ridiculous. I'm not going anywhere until you tell me what's going on. Now, tell me why you're really here or I'll make sure everyone knows what you're hiding.

Person1: I've had enough of your lectures. What do we do now?
Person2: You either take responsibility or continue making excuses. The choice is yours.
Person1: I'm tired of being judged. Can't I make my own decisions?
Person2: Have you thought about the consequences of your actions? You're not just affecting yourself, you know.
Person1: You're always so quick to point out what I'm doing wrong. When will you start taking responsibility for your own mistakes?
Person2: I've made my share of mistakes, but at least I've learned from them. You're still stuck in your old ways.
Person1: That's not fair. You're always trying to control me, to make me into something I'm not.
Person2: I'm trying to help you see the error of your ways. You're going down a dangerous path, and I'm trying to steer you back on course.

Person1: I want you to meet me at the old warehouse tonight, Vinnie.
Person2: What's this about, Sal? You know I'm still owed money from the last job.
Person1: Don't even ask about your money. You're lucky I'm willing to give you another chance.
Person2: Forget lucky, Sal. I'm the one who did all the heavy lifting last time. You're just trying to get over with the insurance money anyway.
Person1: You don't know shit about shit, Vinnie. But I'll tell you one thing - whoever tried to sabotage our operation was made up to look exactly like this picture of Marco Rossi, clothes and all.
Person2: Whoever it was, they're not the only one who's concerned. You're not the only one who's been burned, Sal.
Person1: Don't make me order you, Vinnie. I'm not in the mood.

Person1: You're not thinking clearly, Rachel. Trust me, you hear something, change the subject. You find something, get rid of it, throw it in the lake. You know what happened. The rest is only details.
Person2: I couldn't go all the way, Alex. I failed you. Will you forgive me? Have I lost you, Alex? Have I...?
Person1: No one's ever stood up to my father the way you did. But what a world it would be if we were all afraid to learn to walk and talk because it might offend him!
Person2: Alex, I was there for OUR sake, too. But you didn't do much about it. You walked out, and there I was... solo... and not too good at that.
Person1: I just didn't think that I could antagonize him, Rachel - for OUR sake, I mean. You've got a beautiful life. And even with this, it's always been clear that he loves you. I've come to think that's all that really matters.

Person1: You're not thinking clearly, Alex. You're going to get yourself killed unless you tell me what's going on.
Person2: I don't know what you're talking about. Maybe I can help you if you explain what's going on.
Person1: Don't play dumb with me! I know you're involved in this somehow. You're going to have to do better than that.
Person2: Alright, alright. I have a plan that might help us both. But you have to trust me and do exactly as I say.
Person1: What's the plan?
Person2: We can sneak into the warehouse and gather evidence. I have a disguise that will get us in unnoticed.
Person1: That's a terrible idea. We'll get caught for sure.
Person2: That's the beauty of it. No one will suspect us because we're not the type to take risks. And even if we do get caught, we can always say we were just trying to help.
Person1: I don't know...I'm not sure I can trust you.
Person2: Come on, it'll be fun. And think of the thrill of getting away with it. Are you curious about my plan?

Person1: You go around here expecting applause for the way you treated this project. Who the hell do you think you are?
Person2: It's not what you think. I was just trying to meet the deadline.
Person1: You've been making a lot of questionable decisions lately. I saw the emails you sent to the team.
Person2: That was just a misunderstanding. Let's talk about this later, okay?
Person1: Fine, but we're not ignoring this. You're not going to charm your way out of this one.

Person1: You're the one talking to the walls!
Person2: What does it look like?
Person1: Who were you talking to?! You said, "Do something."
Person2: Years, why? You're being paranoid again.
Person1: It's against the rules to have that in here. The authorities might like to know about this.
Person2: You already have the answers, darling. Don't play dumb.
Person1: I didn't mean it that way. I'm sorry.
Person2: Oh, forget it. There's a party tonight at the mansion. Take me?
Person1: Of course. But what about your little secret?
Person2: You're just trying to change the subject. Be back in an hour. Right?
Person1: Right. But don't think you're getting away that easily.

Person1: Just take it easy, honey. We'll figure something out.
Person2: Figure something out? You're not taking this seriously, Mom. Dad's condition is serious, and we need to make some tough decisions.
Person1: I am taking it seriously, but we can't let fear dictate our actions. We need to stay calm and think clearly.
Person2: That's easy for you to say. You're not the one who's going to have to drop out of school and work at the store.
Person1: I know it's not ideal, but sometimes we have to make sacrifices for the people we love. And let's be real, you're not exactly thriving in school anyway.
Person2: That's not the point, Mom. The point is you're not giving me a choice. You're just telling me what I have to do, like I'm some kind of child.

Person1: You're really going to bring that into our shared space? I thought we had an understanding.
Person2: Stanzi, calm down. I'm not going anywhere. You can either learn to live with it or find a new place.
Person1: You're impossible to please, always criticizing and never satisfied. I'm sick of it.
Person2: Oh, so now you're the victim? You're the one who's been trying to control me from day one.

Person1: You're not talking sense, Alex!
Person2: What tapes? You know which tapes!
Person1: Leave me alone, Ryan. Please.
Person2: You're sitting by yourself in a room engaging in private acts to a bunch of videotapes, aren't you? Not me, buddy. You're the crazy one.
Person1: I'm not kidding, Ryan, you'd better do what I say. Give me those tapes.
Person2: So is my sister, jerk!! You think I'm going to tell her about Michael and hurt her feelings like that?
Person1: God, you need help. You're trying to control everyone around you.
Person2: I need help? Who's trying to blackmail me with those tapes, Alex? Not me, buddy. You're the manipulative one.

Person1: You're really going to make me do this, aren't you? You're going to make me take care of this problem for you.
Person2: Don't mess with me, man. You look like a clown in that stupid suit.
Person1: This is a bespoke suit, and for me, it's a symbol of my sophistication and my belief in personal style.
Person2: ...Asshole. You know exactly what I'm talking about.
Person1: Come here. I want to show you something.
Person2: What's with you? You know what I want. I don't call you except for one big reason.
Person1: Big is the key word, and I'm telling you I want it bad. But I need you to explain it to me. What do you want me to do about this problem?
Person2: I want you to get rid of it. Permanently.
Person1: Get rid of it? You mean, like, destroy it?
Person2: Yes, destroy it. As simple as that.
Person1: Simple? Destroy it? How?
Person2: That's your business... I don't care how. Just make it happen.
Person1: Like an accident where maybe someone else might also get hurt?
Person2: NO... For God's sakes, don't play dumb with me!
Person1: Well, like, I don't know, burn it down or something?
Person2: Just make it happen. I don't care how.
Person1: You want me to make it happen, but you won't tell me how. That's not how this works.
Person2: Fine. I'll tell you how. I want you to sabotage it. Make it look like an accident.
Person1: Sabotage it? You mean, like, tamper with it?
Person2: Yes, tamper with it. Make it malfunction.
Person1: And what if someone gets hurt?
Person2: That's not my problem. You're the one who's going to make it happen.

Person1: You think you're so darn smart, don't you?
Person2: Of course. I don't want to scare you off. Not before I've got what I need from you.
Person1: Bullshit. You're just trying to play me.
Person2: News-flash, I've been playing you from the start.

Person1: You're not thinking clearly. Tell me what's going on.
Person2: I don't know if I can trust you with this.
Person1: You have to trust me. I'm the only one who can help you.
Person2: If I tell you, you'll think I'm desperate.
Person1: I already know you're desperate. That's why you came to me, isn't it?
Person2: Maybe. But if I tell you, you'll try to control me.
Person1: Control you? I'm trying to help you. You're the one who's afraid of being alone, aren't you?
Person2: That's not true. I just don't want to be taken advantage of again.
Person1: Again? So, it's happened before. Who was it this time?
Person2: It doesn't matter. Just leave me alone.
Person1: I'm not going to leave you alone. You need me, and I know you're afraid of that.

Person1: You're too soft on him, that's your problem. You need to be more ruthless if you want to get ahead in this industry.
Person2: I understand where you're coming from, but I still believe our differences can make our partnership stronger. We just need to learn how to navigate them.
Person1: Navigate them? You're not even willing to challenge him, to call him out on his crap. That's not a partnership, that's a dictatorship.
Person2: I'm willing to try to find a balance, but you need to meet me halfway. Your aggressive approach isn't going to get us what we want.
Person1: My approach is the only one that's going to get us what we want. You're just too blinded by your nice-guy complex to see it.

Person1: You're still reading that book, huh?
Person2: Yeah, I couldn't sleep last night. I was too busy thinking about our conversation the other day.
Person1: Oh, which conversation was that? The one where you promised to be honest with me?
Person2: Honestly, I don't remember. You know how I get when I'm tired. I must have dozed off.
Person1: You dozed off? That's interesting, because I could've sworn you were avoiding me. You didn't answer my calls, and when I got home, you were fast asleep.
Person2: I told you, I was exhausted. You're not suggesting I was trying to avoid you, are you?

Person1: You will never be free, though you deserve it. But just as the sun will rise tomorrow, some power will rule your life. And what if that power was not a burden, but a liberation?
Person2: I cannot forgive you for the sake of convenience.
Person1: No. But can you forgive me for the sake of all you've lost and suffered? Or simply forgive me... because I am haunted by what I've done to you?
Person2: You took away my freedom, my identity. I have nothing now. Look at me, this is what I've become.
Person1: I know. And I wish I had the words to erase the pain I've caused. But I don't think the words exist.

Person1: You're too sensitive. I was just surprised, that's all.
Person2: That's not true. You're trying to downplay my feelings. You think you can just brush it off and I'll forget about it?
Person1: I'm not trying to manipulate you. I just didn't expect you to be so invested in this project.
Person2: You're not fooling anyone. You got $500 to get out of town, didn't you? You're just trying to cover your tracks.
Person1: What are you talking about? That has nothing to do with this conversation.
Person2: Oh, so now you're playing dumb? You're not as slick as you think you are.

Person1: You're wasting your talent on that startup. You should get a real job, something stable.
Person2: I want you to make me proud, like my friend's son who's a successful engineer. He's already bought his parents a house in the suburbs. Why can't you do the same for me?
Person1: That's not what I want to do. I'm happy with my own business.
Person2: Happy? You call struggling to make ends meet happy? I want you to have a career that will give you a good life, a family, and a nice house. Not this uncertainty.

Person1: I'm special. I can match you move for move.
Person2: Who the hell do you think you are? You think you can just waltz in here and expect me to be impressed?
Person1: I'm sorry. I was out of line. I didn't mean to come on too strong.
Person2: Apology acknowledged. But let's keep things professional, shall we?
Person1: You're not making this easy for me. I'm trying to ask you out.
Person2: I don't mix with people who think they're above the rules. You need to learn to work with others, not just try to impress them.

Person1: You're not going anywhere until I see what's going on.
Person2: I'm not hiding anything. You're just being paranoid.
Person1: Do I get to see it or not? You're not making this easy for yourself.
Person2: What's with the sudden interest? You've never cared before.
Person1: That's not the point. The point is I know you're hiding something, and I'm going to find out what it is.
Person2: You know, Daniel, I've been thinking... you're not as good at this as you think you are. You're just trying to intimidate me.
Person1: Intimidate you? You're the one who's been playing games with me from the start. I'm just trying to get to the truth.
Person2: The truth? You want to talk about the truth? You're the one who's been lying to me all along.

Person1: You're not thinking clearly on your own. 
Person2: You think I'm just going to fall for that? 
Person1: I'm trying to protect you, but someone out there is pulling strings for you. Stay with me and let me guide you. 
Person2: I'm not some pawn to be used. No way. I make my own decisions. 
Person1: You're making a mistake. You're going to get hurt if you don't listen to me. 
Person2: Maybe so, but I'd rather take my chances than be controlled by you. 
Person1: You're not seeing the bigger picture. I just want what's best for you, for us. 
Person2: I need to figure out what's best for me on my own. You're not going to manipulate me into doing what you want.

Person1: You're really getting worked up over this, aren't you? I think we should just forget about it and focus on something more... pleasurable.
Person2: Is that all you ever think about? Can't you take anything seriously?
Person1: Oh, come on. You're not still bitter about that loan I didn't get, are you? I swear, you're as vindictive as you are boring.
Person2: That has nothing to do with this conversation. And by the way, I'm not the one who's always chasing after fleeting pleasures.
Person1: Ah, but you're so much more fun when you're angry. Maybe I should try to get under your skin more often.

Person1: I'm not into finger foods. Too fussy.
Person2: You're seeing things that aren't there, just like with the wiring in the kitchen.
Person1: What are you talking about? I'm just saying I prefer a proper meal.
Person2: You're trying to distract me from the real issue. You're not as subtle as you think.
Person1: I'm not trying to manipulate you, I just have simple tastes. Buffets, salad bars, that's my style.
Person2: You demand to be served, don't you? A fork fetishist, always trying to control the situation.
Person1: That's not fair. I'm just trying to have a conversation.
Person2: Save it. I know your tricks. You're trying to make me doubt my own perceptions, just like with Gordon.
Person1: Who's Gordon?
Person2: Don't play dumb. You know exactly who I'm talking about. Your little lapdog, always lurking in the shadows.
Person1: I think you're getting a bit worked up over nothing. Why don't we take a break and get some fresh air?
Person2: You're not going to get inside my head that easily. I'm onto you.

Person1: I thought you would be on your way to the meeting by now. Is there something you wanted?
Person2: I wanted to talk. I feel like I need your permission just to make a decision. It's time to assert yourself, to be an individual.
Person1: I don't think we have anything to talk about. You always hide behind your fear of change.
Person2: I do not. I've thought about this every second since we last spoke. I can still remember the way you looked at me.
Person1: Stop it. You're not using our past against me, are you?
Person2: Why? Am I making you uncomfortable, or does the truth scare you? I'm getting out of this dead-end job, and I want to take you with me.
Person1: I thought you couldn't leave. I thought you couldn't get another job.
Person2: I could if I had your support. I mean it, I'm getting out of here, and I want you to come with me. We can start fresh.
Person1: Are you sure? About me, I mean? You're not just saying that to get me to stay?
Person2: I came back to the office this morning, before I even knew about the new opportunity. You're what I want. We can make this work, but we've got to take the leap together.

Person1: I don't know who's weirder, you or me.
Person2: You don't seem to understand. You're not really comprehending any of this. I'm not who you think I am.
Person1: What are you going to do about the people you've hurt?
Person2: I killed them. I did it. I'm the one who's been leaving you messages. Don't you recognize me?
Person1: Excuse me, I really must be going.
Person2: No! Listen, don't you know who I am? I'm the one who's been manipulating you all along. You're just a pawn in my game.
Person1: You're not much with people, are you?
Person2: I'm sorry, I didn't mean to hurt you. But you have to understand, I'm not capable of empathy. I'm a master of deception.

Person1: Dr. Lee, I don't think you understand. This new medication is going to be a nightmare for me.
Person2: Just a minute, Emma, you don't understand. This isn't some experimental drug, it's a breakthrough! I've talked to the leading researchers, they're fine people... it's not a medication, damn it, it's a revolutionary treatment! Stop worrying, Emma! Do you hear me? Stop worrying, it's ideal!
Person1: I don't know how you can call it ideal - don't you know what the word "medication" means to me?
Person2: I don't give a hoot what it means to you! You can't stay in this condition forever! I've prescribed it, damn it!
Person1: It sounds like a recipe for disaster to me. Calling it a revolutionary treatment, that's just trickery and flummery.
Person2: Trickery and flummery or not, you're starting the treatment tomorrow! It's settled! And I must say we've been more than fair to you, Emma, it's pretty selfish and mean-hearted of you to sit there and worry like that!

Person1: You're the one talking to the walls! What's going on in that head of yours?
Person2: I only wanted to be in your thoughts, to bring myself into your consciousness. So I could be as close to you as we are now.
Person1: Who were you talking to?! You said, "Do something." Who were you trying to manipulate this time?!
Person2: I love you, and I've always loved you. I just wanted to be a part of your inner world.
Person1: You're playing games with my mind! You're trying to control me, just like you did on my wedding night!

Person1: I'm trying to figure out if you're avoiding me, playing dumb, or genuinely clueless.
Person2: This is my private space, and I'd appreciate it if you respected that.
Person1: I'm trying to keep emotions out of this, but it's hard when you're being so evasive. What's really going on?
Person2: You're not even trying to hide your condescending tone. Do you have any control over how patronizing you allow yourself to get?
Person1: Yes, I do, as a matter of fact... and to prove it, I've been holding back. But you're not making it easy. You look tired and stressed  is everything okay?
Person2: My mom is in the hospital, okay? Now, if you'll excuse me...

Person1: Dr. Lee, I'm not here to cause any trouble.
Person2: I should hope not. My team is just down the hall.
Person1: I appreciate your caution. But I think you'll find I'm not a threat.
Person2: Save it, Mr...?
Person1: Jackson. And I'm not here to waste your time, Dr. Lee. I have a problem, and I believe you're the only one who can help me.
Person2: (sighs) What is it, Mr. Jackson?
Person1: It's about the new project you're working on. I think I can help you overcome some of the obstacles you're facing.
Person2: (pauses) Go on.
Person1: But first, I need to know that you're willing to listen. Can I trust you to keep an open mind, Dr. Lee?
Person2: (hesitates) I suppose that depends on what you have to say, Mr. Jackson.

Person1: You're not talking sense, Alex! 
Person2: I don't know what you're talking about. 
Person1: Don't play dumb with me. I know everything. You've known this whole time. Tell me the truth.

Person1: You're playing with fire, aren't you?
Person2: I'm giving you a gift, the chance to confront your demons.
Person1: You think this is some kind of twisted therapy session?
Person2: You need to admit that your past defines you, whether you like it or not.
Person1: I've moved on. I don't need your help to deal with my issues.
Person2: That's exactly what I'm trying to do - help you. You're just too blinded by your own ego to see it.
Person1: You're the one who's been lying to me my whole life. Everything you said, everything you did...
Person2: Was for your own good. You're just not ready to accept the truth yet.
Person1: The truth? You call this the truth? You're manipulating me, just like you always do.
Person2: I'm showing you the way. You're just too scared to take it.

Person1: You think you're so smart, Senator.
Person2: And you're beautiful... 
Person1: Senator, I've been working on this campaign for months, and I've never asked for anything but a chance to prove myself. I'm too old to be an intern anymore. I need to know this job is going somewhere.
Person2: So have dinner with me tonight. I can introduce you to some influential people.
Person1: I can't. I have a meeting with the campaign manager.
Person2: It's your choice. But you're missing an opportunity to make some real connections. You know I'm the one who can make things happen for you in this party.
Person1: You're trying to buy me, Senator.
Person2: I'm trying to help you, dear. You're the one who's too proud to accept it.

Person1: You're too hurt to fight and the man's a killer! Take the fall, and I'll give you more than your one third!
Person2: I don't know. I don't know what's happening.
Person1: Is that so? You're confused? You might be better off without this fight.
Person2: Yes. I might.
Person1: When do you think you'll make up your mind? Tomorrow? The day after?
Person2: I don't know. Pressures on, eh? There's got to be a load of money in this.
Person1: It's absolutely not like that! This is for your own good! Come on, get the rest of your armor on!
Person2: Spend my days fighting in the small arenas, relax, live the good life? I don't know, who has better wine than you?

Person1: Thanks for taking care of this for me.
Person2: So, you're saying you weren't involved in the project's failure?
Person1: Of course not. I'm just trying to help you understand what went wrong.
Person2: Tell me something, are you trying to distract me from your own mistakes? Jaeger says you're always shifting the blame.
Person1: That's not fair. I'm just trying to have an open conversation.
Person2: An open conversation? You're the one who's been hiding information from me. One mistake with the report is hardly "an honest error".

Person1: You're running out of time, aren't you? Tick-tock, tick-tock, how long till you crack under the pressure?
Person2: I didn't do anything, I swear. There was a message, wasn't there?
Person1: Save it for the judge. What did you tell the police?
Person2: The truth. That I didn't know anything about the heist.
Person1: Then why did you try to flee the country? You're not as innocent as you seem.
Person2: I was scared, okay? I didn't know what to do.
Person1: Scared? You're not scared of me, are you? You should be. I can make your life a living hell if you don't cooperate.

Person1: I did it because I'd never stopped thinking about you and if I didn't find you I knew my life would never be good again.
Person2: That's cool. We're getting to know each other. This is a good thing. I'm Sophia.
Person1: Sophia, I just want to be able to tell the CEO who was responsible for the leak because he talked too much.
Person2: Hey, that's whacked! I thought we were getting on here!
Person1: Shut up! You're not listening to me. The CEO will receive instructions for the meeting, half an hour before it is to be held. If it is successful, there will be more.
Person2: OK. Say what it is. But I'm warning you, I'm not afraid of you.

Person1: You're really going to leave me behind, aren't you?
Person2: Hey, stop the self-pity routine... You're my partner now... I'm gonna make you see things my way... Come on, let's get out of this dead-end job.
Person1: Where are we headed?
Person2: I heard rumors of a new project in California... I think it's the perfect opportunity for us to start fresh... Come on, show me some enthusiasm.
Person1: Please, tell me the truth... What happened to our original plan?

Person1: I've been waiting for this moment for what feels like an eternity. I can make it right, I swear.
Person2: Will you confront your demons and tell me the truth, right here, right now? Tell me you're not still haunted by the ghosts of your past?
Person1: It was not by choice that I've been trapped in this cycle of guilt. A small matter of a promise unkept, a debt unpaid. We were bound by our own making. When the time of reckoning came, the urge to break free was so strong I tried to shatter the chains with my bare hands.
Person2: You cannot hide from yourself. You will not stand between me and the truth. After I have the truth, the power will let me hold my head high once more. Do you know what that means? I can finally be free.

Person1: You're all I have left, and I don't want you taking on that new project.
Person2: I thought we had moved past your concerns about my career choices.
Person1: Because of your thoughtlessness, I had to face all those awkward moments at the company meeting! Look what you made me do.
Person2: I'm sorry, but I genuinely thought it would be okay. You could teach or consult instead of taking on so much responsibility.
Person1: Next time, think and ask. Don't assume. You're not going to quit now, are you?

Person1: You're telling me that my whole life has been a lie? How could anyone do this to anyone?
Person2: Don't be so dramatic. You didn't even notice my new haircut.
Person1: What does your haircut have to do with anything? You're trying to distract me from the truth.
Person2: Maybe I am, maybe I'm not. But think about it, everything I've said recently has been peculiar, right? I've said and done things your friend would never do...
Person1: Stop playing games with me. Who are you and what do you want?
Person2: Oh, I'm just someone who knows the truth. And I want you to take a closer look at your life, at the people around you. Don't be so blind.

Person1: You're not going to get away with this. I know what you're capable of.
Person2: Capable of? You're the one who's been playing both sides against each other. I'm just trying to survive.
Person1: Survive? You call that surviving? You're willing to sacrifice anyone to get what you want.
Person2: And you're not? You think you're any better? At least I'm honest about my intentions. You're just trying to justify your own actions.
Person1: Justify my actions? You're the one who's been manipulating everyone from the start. I'm just trying to stop you.
Person2: Stop me? You're the one who's been holding things back. I'm just trying to move forward. And if you don't help me, you'll be the one who's left behind.

Person1: I can't do this, it's not right.
Person2: You want to make it up to your sister? Well, if I'm right, this is your chance.
Person1: You're not going to turn me in, are you?
Person2: They'll ask me who helped me, and I'll have to tell them.
Person1: You're just trying to scare me.
Person2: I'm just telling you the truth. You're an accessory, before the fact.
Person1: That's not fair. I didn't agree to this.
Person2: Life's not fair, but you're in this now. You might as well see it through.

Person1: I need some space, Rachel. This relationship is suffocating me.
Person2: Maybe that's because you're not used to being loved unconditionally. You're just scared of getting hurt again.
Person1: That's not fair. I'm trying to be honest with you about how I feel.
Person2: Oh, I'm sure you are. But are you being honest with yourself? You're not even giving us a chance to work through this.
Person1: I've given us plenty of chances. And every time, I feel like I'm losing myself in the process.
Person2: That's because you're not trusting me to take care of you. If you just let go, I can make everything better.

Person1: You know, I've been thinking, and I really think we should take a break from each other.
Person2: Oh, come on, honey, don't be like that. You're just saying that because you're still worried about what your father would think, right?
Person1: Actually, I was thinking about how that red dress of yours would look on me. I bet it would fit just perfect.
Person2: You're trying to distract me, but it won't work. I know you're just trying to get out of this relationship without taking responsibility.

Person1: I've got a great deal for you! You won't find a better price anywhere else.
Person2: How much?
Person1: Ah, you're a straight shooter, I like that. But let's just say it's private. You don't want to know the details.
Person2: What do you mean? You're not going to tell me?
Person1: Oh, I'm not hiding anything from you. It's just that some things are better left unsaid. Trust me, you don't want to know.
Person2: That's not very reassuring. I think I'll pass.
Person1: Ah, come on! You're not going to let a little mystery scare you off, are you? I'll give you a great deal, just for you. How about we say... your current offer plus two hundred?
Person2: Two hundred? That's steep.
Person1: Ah, you're a tough negotiator, I like that. But let me tell you, this is a one-time offer. You won't find a better deal anywhere else. And if you don't take it, someone else will.

Person1: You're really going to try out for the school play? I thought you were smarter than that.
Person2: I don't know, I thought it might be kind of fun, you know what I mean, it'd be nice to meet some new people.
Person1: You miserable little dreamer. I'm the one who should be worried, sacrificing my last bit of free time to help you rehearse. You'll only end up embarrassing yourself.
Person2: I'm just not... you know, I don't think I could take a harsh critique, 'cause I-I don't respond well to criticism, you know what I mean, I-I have a tendency to... if I get too discouraged, I-I give up and then it's all over. You know, and it's-it's not good for my self-esteem.
Person1: All right, all right, you want to waste your time, so uh, what's the worst that could happen?

Person1: You know, I think you could use another cup of coffee, don't you?
Person2: I'm fine, thanks. I've had enough caffeine for tonight.
Person1: Oh, come on! It's on the house. You look like you could use a pick-me-up.
Person2: I said no, thanks.
Person1: Well, there's a one-drink minimum per show, and I'm not going to let you get out of it that easily.
Person2: What are my choices?
Person1: Everything's ten dollars, and I recommend the hot chocolate. It's our specialty.
Person2: That sounds expensive.
Person1: You're getting a great deal, trust me. Now, what do you want?
Person2: I don't know... What do you think I should get?
Person1: Hmm, let me think. You look like someone who could use a little excitement in their life. How about a fruit smoothie?
Person2: I don't know...
Person1: Oh, come on! It's a great choice. And if you don't get something, I'll have to ask you to leave.

Person1: I want to know why you're really here.
Person2: Maintenance.
Person1: Don't play dumb with me. I know something's off.
Person2: You told me I'd say that.
Person1: What do you mean? You're not making any sense.
Person2: You're not as tough as you think you are.
Person1: Is that a threat?
Person2: It's an observation. You're more like a vibe.
Person1: What's that supposed to mean?
Person2: You're not specific enough to be a person. You're just a feeling.
Person1: I don't like being talked to like that.
Person2: I'm not trying to be rude. I'm just trying to understand you.
Person1: You're not going to understand me. You're just going to do what I say.
Person2: Is that what you think?
Person1: Yes, that's what I think. Now, are you going to follow my instructions or not?
Person2: I'll do what you say, but I'm not going to like it.
Person1: I don't care if you like it or not. Just do it.

Person1: You're a master of deception, aren't you? You used me, just like I used you. All part of the game.
Person2: You're one to talk. You're the one who's been playing me from the start.
Person1: I had to. You made me. You brought this on yourself.
Person2: Nastiness. You're nasty with words. Why wouldn't you be nasty with deeds once in a while? You hated me--and I know why.
Person1: Shut up! You're just trying to distract me from the truth. You're the one who's been manipulating me all along.
Person2: One of these days, you're going to wake up and realize you've been playing into my hands. Good night, my dear.

Person1: You know why I need you.
Person2: I'm not going back to that place. You can't make me.
Person1: I know everything about you, Alex. Your past, your fears, your secrets.
Person2: That's not going to work on me. I've been in tougher spots than this.
Person1: If you don't cooperate, they're going to kill your sister.
Person2: You're just trying to manipulate me. I'm not buying it.
Person1: I'm trying to save you, Alex. You're running out of time.
Person2: Save me? You're the one who's been playing me from the start.

Person1: You're the only one who can save me from this mess.
Person2: It says here you've been embezzling funds from the company. 
Person1: That's a misunderstanding. I was just reallocating resources.
Person2: With the same skill you used to reallocate your wife's affections to your secretary?

Person1: Why do you have to keep playing games with me? 
Person2: What's with you people? Why do ya have to mess with my head all the time? 
Person1: Ah, games... that's a difficult word to define. When does the fun end and the manipulation begin? 
Person2: I never took pleasure in hurting anyone. 
Person1: Really? Then why did you agree to help me if you didn't want to play along?

Person1: You're just like the rest of us.
Person2: You have no right to make me feel like I'm nothing. You're the one who's been playing games with my emotions.
Person1: I'm telling you, I want to make you happy. That's all.
Person2: Stop acting like you care. You're just trying to manipulate me into doing what you want.
Person1: What do I want to do? I want to help you move on from the worst thing that's ever happened to you.
Person2: You want to help me? You're the one who's been holding me back. I'm not some project for you to fix.
Person1: I think you're beautiful. I think if we were together, you would love it. You wouldn't even believe it.
Person2: You're not even listening to me. You're just trying to distract me from the truth.

Person1: You're running out of time, aren't you? Tick-tock, tick-tock, how long till your alibi falls apart?
Person2: Don't give me that crap. That's MY crap.
Person1: Ah, but it's good! You see, I've been thinking, what's good for the goose...
Person2: Shut up! You're just trying to distract me. You think you're clever, don't you?
Person1: Clever? Me? Never. I'm just trying to understand why you did it. Why, Alex?
Person2: That's none of your business. And even if it was, you'd never understand. You're too caught up in your own ego.
Person1: Ego? Ha! You're the one who's trying to manipulate the system. But I'm not buying it. The fault, dear Alex, is not in our stars...

Person1: You're not giving up, are you, Dr. Lee? We've got to do something quick or it'll be too late.
Person2: Oh, dear. That isn't what I meant, Clark. I just want to understand why you're so hesitant to share your research with the team.
Person1: You're losing your edge, Dr. Lee - don't you realize what that means? You've got more to offer than anybody in this field. All you've got to do is trust us.
Person2: Trust you? You're the one who's been evasive about your methods. Were you in Dr. Patel's lab last night?
Person1: Aw, I don't know what you're talking about. All I know is that you're letting your fears hold you back. You've got to have more faith in yourself.
Person2: Faith in myself? You're the one who's been playing games with me, Clark. How long has this been going on? Do you know?
Person1: Oh, I bless the day you joined our team, Dr. Lee. You know that. But some people wouldn't understand your... unique approach.
Person2: That's all. Please, Clark. Just be honest with me for once.

Person1: Do I look like I want a tiny dessert?
Person2: No, but I have a special offer for you, baby.
Person1: What happened, Alex? You're not usually this pushy.
Person2: Look, I don't know about you, but this is the right thing for me. I just know it is. So, what do you say?
Person1: Don't try to sweet-talk me, Alex. I'm not buying it.
Person2: Yeah, I know I'm not exactly the most trustworthy guy. But I'm asking you to trust me on this one.
Person1: What about that new policy you're trying to implement?
Person2: That doesn't mean anything to me. That's all just business. Hell, I'm asking you to take a chance on me. I guess you want a big guarantee, huh?
Person1: No, but a small assurance would be nice.

Person1: I'm telling you, this new marketing strategy is a goldmine. We can make a fortune off these unsuspecting customers...
Person2: I don't know, Alex. It sounds like we're taking advantage of them. We need to consider the ethical implications...
Person1: Oh, come on, don't be naive. We'll just commission a study that says it's fine, and then we can move forward. You're not getting in the spirit of things, are you?
Person2: That's not what I meant, and you know it. You're just trying to get me on board with your scheme. But I need you to be honest with me, Alex. Do you really think this is the right thing to do?

Person1: You're sorry now, aren't you? You should be. You've made a grave mistake.
Person2: Just go! Leave me alone. You're bound to this, just like I am.
Person1: Ah, but I'm not the one who's trapped. You're the one who's hiding from the truth. Dominus Ominus, remember?
Person2: Stop it. You're just trying to confuse me. I know what I've done.
Person1: Oh, do you? Then why are you so afraid to face it? You're running from your own conscience, and I'm the only one who can set you free.

Person1: You're too busy being a know-it-all to listen. Now I want ya to listen and quit being such a know-it-all. Can ya do that for me?
Person2: What's this about? What do you want me to do?
Person1: I want you to feed every file on this server into your program. It'll take hours, but I'm willing to wait.
Person2: You can't make me do this. Besides, I'm probably gonna be too busy with the audit anyway.
Person1: Ah, but I can make things difficult for you. I know a few things. I know you're hiding something. You're probably thinking I don't know the half of it, but in actual fact I know every part of it. The business of embezzling funds, the heartache of getting caught...
Person2: Okay, fine. What's the first file?

Person1: I'm just saying, I know what it's like to lose something you love. To see it slip away, and know it's never coming back.
Person2: Yeah, every guy you date winds up dead. But I'm not like them. I can help you move on.
Person1: If you're trying to cheer me up, you're doing a helluva job. You think you can fix me that easily?
Person2: I'm not trying to fix you. I'm trying to understand you. And I think I can.

Person1: I know you're not going to give up on this project.
Person2: How can you be so sure?
Person1: Because I know you've got a little voice in your head telling you to do the right thing and see it through.
Person2: You're just trying to make me feel guilty.
Person1: Maybe a little. But we owe it to ourselves to make this work. We've invested too much already.
Person2: That's exactly what I'm worried about. We're in over our heads.
Person1: Nonsense. We just need to take a chance and believe in ourselves. And I've got a feeling that if we do, everything will fall into place.
Person2: You're not even listening to me. You're just trying to manipulate me into doing what you want.
Person1: Maybe I am. But it's because I know what's best for us. And I know that if we stick together, we can make this happen.
Person2: Fine. But if this blows up in our faces, I'm blaming you.

Person1: Stay away from me, I mean it.
Person2: If nothing is going to change, I'd just as soon it not change in the way it hasn't been changing all this time.
Person1: You're not going to lose anything, I've been nothing if not generous. I want the best for everyone.
Person2: Give me the keys. I don't think you're being generous, you're just trying to control me.
Person1: Get down, I'm warning you. You can ask anyone in town, I've always looked out for them.
Person2: You're not looking out for me, you're just trying to manipulate me.

Person1: You're not taking this seriously, are you? You think it's just a game.
Person2: Who told you that, Governor? You've been misinformed.
Person1: Don't play dumb with me. I know all about your little project.
Person2: It's just a comedy, a harmless satire.
Person1: Save it for the press conference. I want to know why you're really doing this.
Person2: You're not my real boss and you can't control me anymore.

Person1: You think you're so charming, don't you?
Person2: I did get her number, didn't I?
Person1: That doesn't prove anything. You're just trying to impress me.
Person2: I'm telling you, they love that confidence. And I've got it like that.
Person1: Oh, so you think you're God's gift to women now?
Person2: I'm not saying that, but I do know how to make them smile.
Person1: Well, I'm not buying it. You're just trying to manipulate me into thinking you're some kind of player.
Person2: Maybe I am, maybe I'm not. But I do know how to get what I want. And right now, I want you to believe me.

Person1: You know, you'd be even more stunning if you took better care of yourself.
Person2: What's that supposed to mean?
Person1: I mean, you have a certain spark, but it's dimmed by the exhaustion. If you felt good, you'd radiate joy, and that's infectious.
Person2: You're not my mother. Stop trying to fix me.
Person1: Oh, I'm not trying to fix you, darling. I'm just trying to help you see your full potential. And trust me, some things have to be endured. But the pleasures are so much sweeter when you've faced the pain head-on.
Person2: What do you know about pain?

Person1: You're really going to buy this?
Person2: What's it to you?
Person1: I'm just surprised. You don't seem like the type.
Person2: And what type is that?
Person1: Someone who gets caught up in the hype. Can I show you something better?
Person2: I'm not looking for better. I'm looking for this.
Person1: Alright, but you're making a mistake. You're not thinking clearly.
Person2: And you are? You're just trying to make a sale.
Person1: That's not all I'm trying to do. I'm trying to help you.
Person2: Help me? You're just trying to manipulate me.
Person1: Maybe a little. But it's for your own good.
Person2: Save it. I've made up my mind.

Person1: I sense that you're troubled. The power was within you, but you've yet to unlock it.
Person2: (nervously) What do you mean? I don't know what you're talking about.
Person1: Don't play dumb, Mr. Jenkins. We're going to know where you are every second for the rest of your life. You might as well join my quest.
Person2: (skeptical) What quest? What do you want from me?
Person1: Ultimate knowledge. And to find it, we'll need to work together. Refuse, and I'll hunt you down myself.
Person2: (intimidated) What makes you think I'd be interested in this... quest?
Person1: (smiling) Because I know your deepest desires. And I can help you achieve them. But you must have faith in me, my friend. There are more of us than you know.

Person1: I'm not really comfortable with that idea.
Person2: Oh, come on. It'll be fun. You can't let fear hold you back.
Person1: It's not fear, it's just... I don't know if I'm ready for that.
Person2: Ready for what? You're not getting any younger. Besides, I'll be right there with you.
Person1: That's just how my brain works, I guess.
Person2: Fascinating. So, you're saying you're not interested in taking a chance?
Person1: I didn't say that. It's just that... I've never been the most spontaneous guy.
Person2: Well, you know... what do I know about taking risks... it's nice to have someone push me out of my comfort zone for once...
Person1: I suppose you're right. But what if it doesn't work out?
Person2: Then we'll just have to try again, won't we?

Person1: I don't know how you do it, Alex. You've got a way of making people believe what you want them to.
Person2: It's all about confidence, Rachel. If you believe it yourself, others will too.
Person1: Yeah, but that TruCoat business? You convinced me I needed it, and now I'm stuck with a five-hundred-dollar bill.
Person2: Ah, come on, Rachel. You know as well as I do that TruCoat is essential for protecting your investment. You don't want your car to rust away, do you?
Person1: That's not the point. The point is you manipulated me into buying it. You made me think I had no choice.
Person2: I just presented you with the facts, Rachel. You made the decision yourself. Don't blame me for your own mistakes.
Person1: Facts? You call that a fact? You're a master of spin, Alex. I'm starting to think you're more interested in making a sale than in helping me.
Person2: Oh, Rachel, you're being paranoid. I'm just trying to do my job to the best of my ability. If you're unhappy with the service, maybe you should take it up with my boss.
Person1: Unhappy? I'm furious. You've got a way of making people do what you want, and I don't like it one bit.
Person2: Well, maybe you should take a step back and re-evaluate your priorities, Rachel. You're getting worked up over nothing. It's just a car, after all.
Person1: Just a car? You think this is just about a car? This is about trust, Alex. And you've broken that trust.
Person2: I'm sorry you feel that way, Rachel. But I assure you, my intentions were pure. Maybe we can discuss this further over a cup of coffee?
Person1: You think a cup of coffee is going to fix this? You're something else, Alex.

Person1: I've always been there for you, supported your every move. But now, I need you to be honest with me. Where did you hide the evidence?
Person2: I'm tired of being guilt-tripped into doing what you want. I've had enough of your manipulation.
Person1: People are still suffering because of your secrets. Stop running away from the truth. You owe me, and you owe yourself, the courage to face this.

Person1: You don't seem convinced, my old friend. Should I be?
Person2: If you ever trusted me, if you ever valued our bond, then stand by me now and let this happen.
Person1: I cannot, Rachel. Dearly as I care for you, I cannot.

Person1: You knew what I told you wasn't ready for the papers. 
Person2: I must have felt some lump in his back when I bumped him. 
Person1: Bullshit! You're trying to distract me from the real issue. 
Person2: That's not what I witnessed, Alex. 
Person1: Stop messing with my life, Rachel. My brother almost got hurt because of your meddling. 
Person2: I never said you couldn't get hurt. I never said that. 
Person1: You have a problem, Rachel. Somewhere along the line, one of your bones broke, and your mind just broke with it. 
Person2: You're one to talk, Alex. You're the one who's been playing both sides against each other. 
Person1: I was doing my job. 
Person2: Yeah? And just how much of all this has been "doing your job"?

Person1: You're not taking this seriously, are you? You think it's some kind of game?
Person2: I've brought all the necessary documents, just like you asked. I'm cooperating fully.
Person1: Save it. You're trying to distract me from the real issue. You're under investigation for fraud.
Person2: I've admitted to making a mistake. I paid someone to marry me, but I didn't know he was already married. I'm the one who got ripped off.
Person1: That's not the point. The point is, you're trying to manipulate me into feeling sorry for you. Well, it's not going to work.
Person2: You're one to talk about manipulation. You're just trying to intimidate me into confessing to something I didn't do.
Person1: Intimidate you? You're the one who's been playing games from the start. And now you're going to have to face the consequences.
Person2: Consequences? You're the one who's going to have to face the consequences if you don't listen to me. I have information that could bring down your entire department.

Person1: You're really going to do this, aren't you? You're going to walk out on me again.
Person2: I'm not walking out on you, I'm just taking a break. You're being suffocating.
Person1: Oh, I'm suffocating you? That's rich coming from someone who's been emotionally absent for months.
Person2: That's not fair. I've been trying to talk to you, but you never listen.
Person1: I listen, but you never say anything worth hearing. You're just going through the motions, pretending to care.
Person2: Maybe if you didn't always have to be in control, I could open up to you.
Person1: Control? You're the one who's always playing games, manipulating me into doing what you want. I'm just trying to have a real conversation for once.
Person2: You're just trying to win, like you always do. Well, I'm not going to play along anymore.

Person1: I'll talk to them.
Person2: You'll have to convince them, Alex. They won't listen to me.
Person1: I'll tell you what to say. Just make sure you're at the meeting tonight.
Person2: But what about my presentation? I've been working on it for weeks.
Person1: It's not exactly the end of the world, for goodness sake. This is more important.
Person2: You're just trying to get out of helping me, aren't you?
Person1: If I'm real, they'll listen to me. If I'm not, they'll treat you. Either way, you'll be better off than you are now. You'll get a reward.

Person1: I'm not sure I'm comfortable with this arrangement. Can we reconsider?
Person2: Oh, come on. I'm offering you a great deal. You need two hundred and fifty grand, and I'm willing to lend it to you. Don't be foolish.
Person1: It's not just about the money. I was happy with my old life. Why get me involved in this?
Person2: You're not thinking clearly. This is an opportunity of a lifetime. You'll be set for life, and I'll make sure you're taken care of. Trust me, you won't regret this.

Person1: You're playing with fire, Alex.
Person2: So what else is new? Look, I'm not losing any sleep over it.
Person1: But you're going to get burned if you keep manipulating people like this.
Person2: Wise up -- it's not hip to be naive. You'll never get away with accusing me of this.
Person1: I don't care about being hip anymore. I care about the truth.

Person1: I need you to meet me at the old warehouse, ASAP. I have a job for you.
Person2: What's in it for me? You know I don't do favors for free.
Person1: Oh, come on. I'm doing you a solid. You owe me, remember?
Person2: What are you talking about? I don't owe you anything.
Person1: Don't play dumb. You know exactly what I'm referring to. Now, are you in or out?
Person2: Fine. I'll be there. But don't think this means I'm going to start doing your bidding.
Person1: We'll see about that. Just be there, and don't be late.

Person1: You're very disturbed, you're crazy. That's why you're still working on this project.
Person2: Come on, it can wait. Let's take a break and I'll buy you a coffee.
Person1: No, I need to finish this. You're just trying to distract me.

Person1: I'm telling you, it's a great opportunity. You'd be crazy to pass it up.
Person2: Oh, c'mon, Alex. Just say yes. Lie, if you want. It'd make me feel better.
Person1: Well, I was gonna say yes and now I can't, because you'd know I was just saying it to make you feel better.
Person2: Why do you have to be so selfish? We need this deal to go through, and you're holding out for your own reasons.
Person1: I'm not being selfish, I just don't think it's the right move for us. And besides, you're the one who's always saying we should take risks and live a little.
Person2: That's different. This is a calculated risk, and it could pay off big time. You're just scared of change.
Person1: I'm not scared of change, I just don't want to get stuck with a bad deal. And what's with the sudden pressure? You're not even listening to my concerns.
Person2: Of course I am. I'm just trying to make you see the bigger picture. And if you're not on board, then maybe you're not the right person for this project.
Person1: Fine, maybe I'm not. But at least I'm not trying to manipulate you into doing something you don't want to do.

Person1: I've been watching you, and I think you're ready for the truth.
Person2: What truth?
Person1: The one that will set you free. You see, time is like a fire - it can warm or it can burn.
Person2: What do you mean?
Person1: I mean that our experiences, our memories, they're all fuel for the fire. And I can control the flames.
Person2: You're scaring me.
Person1: Don't be afraid. I'm just trying to show you the power of the human mind. You can till it with whatever you want, from illusions to reality.
Person2: And what's the cost of this power?
Person1: Ah, that's the best part. The cost is just a little secret. And I'll make sure you keep it. Careful, don't make me angry. I start fires when I'm angry.
Person2: You're not going to hurt me, are you?
Person1: Oh, no. I just want to show you the truth. And once you see it, you'll be mine.

Person1: You need to come down here, everybody meets everybody. Ho ho ho. Ha ha ha. We do one for good faith and then we talk about the deal.
Person2: I can't go anywhere, I'm not interested. I've waited too long.
Person1: But you must. It's the only way you'll get what you want. For five hundred, what do I get?
Person2: If I call the police, your price will go down to a minus sign.
Person1: Bluff. You've waited too long. I mentioned information.
Person2: Sorry. Another client paid for that. You can hire me not to use it.
Person1: A thousand. You can trust me, George.
Person2: Got it on you? Got the information on you?
Person1: Get it in half an hour. We'll discuss the details then.

Person1: You're making a mistake. You're embarrassing me. Why do you want to make me feel so bad?
Person2: I'm utterly satisfied. I've been independent my whole life. I never had to ask anybody for anything.
Person1: You're wounded, and now you're going to pay the price. Obsolete old carnivores like me are most dangerous when wounded.
Person2: I'm not afraid of you. I've enjoyed being free, making my own choices.
Person1: We never quit fighting until we're dead. And I'm not dead yet. You'd be killing a friend if you don't tell me the truth.
Person2: You're trying to manipulate me, but it won't work. I know what you're doing.
Person1: My self-respect is gone, and my dignity with it. It's now very easy for me to take what I want from you.
Person2: You're not going to take anything from me. I'm not afraid of your threats.
Person1: You should be. I'm a vengeful ape who will stop at nothing to get what I want. And I want the truth.
Person2: Fine. I'll tell you. But it won't change anything. You'll still be the same manipulative person you've always been.

Person1: I thought he was just being cautious.
Person2: You're being naive, Sarah. He's breaking your trust just because he can.
Person1: But he said he'd try to make it work.
Person2: Try is like maybe. Try is nothing! You know there's a lot at stake here; we thought it would be unfortunate if things were to fall apart because of his carelessness.
Person1: What are you insinuating?
Person2: I'm saying that maybe he's not as invested in this as you are. Maybe he's just using you to get ahead.
Person1: That's not true. He's a good person.
Person2: Good people don't leave you hanging like this. They don't make promises they have no intention of keeping.

Person1: You're stuck, and I hate seeing it. You paid me to help you get closure, but that wasn't the real reason.
Person2: Cut the crap! You're just trying to distract me from the fact that one of your associates sold the building last month.
Person1: That's old news. What matters is what you do now. You can stay stuck or walk away. But if you look back, you're not walking away.
Person2: You're just trying to manipulate me. But I know your game. Four can keep a secret, if three are dead. And I'm not going down without a fight.
Person1: Oh, I'm shaking in my boots. But you're missing the point. It's not about the secret, it's about what you're willing to do to keep it.

Person1: You're the one who created this mess, a non-threatening white female. Voila. End of argument. It can't be sexist because you're a woman.
Person2: I'm obsessed with you. I'm obsessed and I'm desperate. I'll do anything to make you love me. I'll get a makeover, change my personality, and even pretend to like your favorite sports team. Just love me back, please.
Person1: You're trying to manipulate me, aren't you? Well, it won't work. I see right through your tactics.
Person2: Oh, come on. I'm just trying to connect with you on a deeper level. You're so closed off, so guarded. I just want to break down those walls and get to the real you.
Person1: Save it. I'm not buying what you're selling. You're just trying to control me, to make me do your bidding.
Person2: That's not true! I just want to be with you, to make you happy. If you'd just listen to me, if you'd just trust me...

Person1: I want to stop being haunted. You're my second chance, Rachel.
Person2: No cops, that's final! This is my deal here, Alex! My sister is my responsibility!
Person1: A million dollars is a lot of damn money! And there they are, they got my sister! I give them what they want, why won't they let her go?
Person2: You're not thinking this through, Alex. You gotta listen to me on this one. They're not going to let her go just because you pay them.
Person1: Heck, you don't know! You're just whistling Dixie here! I'm saying, the cops, they can advise us on this! I'm saying call a professional!
Person2: Take me away from this nightmare, Alex. I want to believe you can fix this.
Person1: Go up the stairs, Rachel. I'll follow. We'll figure this out together.

Person1: You're damn right! I'm a journalist and you fed me a fake source!
Person2: Would you mind keeping your voice down? I have a meeting with my editor.
Person1: Oh, well we wouldn't want to disturb your meeting, would we? You just wanted me to break the story to get more clicks.
Person2: That's not true. I was trying to protect you from the real culprit.
Person1: Protect me? You screwed up my career just so you could cover your own tracks. You never gave a shit about the truth.

Person1: You're making a big mistake, Victor. I'm the one who gave you a chance.
Person2: And that's exactly what I'm trying to repay you for - by taking everything away from you.
Person1: You can't be serious. You're going to let your anger consume you like that?
Person2: Anger? You want to talk about anger? You want to know what it's like to be haunted by the thought of someone walking free?
Person1: Haunted? You're the one who's haunted, Victor. You're letting your past define you.
Person2: My past? You're the one who's been holding me back, keeping me in the shadows. It's time I take control.
Person1: Control? You call this control? You're just a puppet on strings, dancing to the tune of your own ego.
Person2: And you're just a coward, hiding behind your words, too afraid to take action.

Person1: I'm doing you a favor, Alex. You want to go on struggling for survival, working multiple jobs just to make ends meet?
Person2: What's it to you? You're not exactly swimming in wealth yourself.
Person1: That's not the point. The point is, I can offer you a way out. You're a great programmer, and we've got an excellent team that could use someone with your skills.
Person2: And what's the catch? You're not doing this out of the goodness of your heart.
Person1: Let's just say it's a mutually beneficial arrangement. You get a better life, and we get someone with your talents on our side.
Person2: I don't know... I've heard rumors about your organization. That you're involved in some shady dealings.
Person1: Rumors are just that - rumors. We're a legitimate business, and we can offer you a lot more than you're getting now. And what about your sister? She's been struggling with her health, hasn't she? We can offer her the best medical care available.
Person2: How did you know that?
Person1: Let's just say we do our research. So, what do you say? Are you in?

Person1: I don't think I'm going to the meeting.
Person2: You can't avoid it, it's about the project you've been working on.
Person1: No, I... You did this to me. You're the one who sabotaged my work.
Person2: That's ridiculous. You're being paranoid.
Person1: I'm not paranoid. I know it was you. You deliberately set me up to fail.
Person2: Max has gone to a great deal of trouble to organize this meeting, and it's for your benefit.
Person1: No, it's not. It's to humiliate me in front of the whole team.
Person2: You're being childish. You need to face the consequences of your own actions.

Person1: I think you're beautiful. You deserve someone who understands you.
Person2: How do you know what I deserve?
Person1: I've seen the way you react to rumors about your family. You're sensitive, and that's attractive.
Person2: You're talking about my mom, aren't you? You think she was unhappy in her marriage.
Person1: Maybe. But that's not the point. The point is, you're scared of the truth, and I can help you face it.
Person2: I don't know if I can trust you.
Person1: You can trust me. I'm the only one who's being honest with you. Your friends, your family - they're all hiding something. But I'm telling you, there's nothing to worry about.

Person1: I can get you a spot in the exclusive club, but it'll cost you an extra five thousand.
Person2: That's a steep price. What's in it for me?
Person1: You'll get to rub shoulders with the elite, and I'll make sure you're well taken care of. You can trust me.
Person2: I'm not sure... I've heard rumors about the club's true intentions.
Person1: Oh, those are just baseless rumors. I assure you, it's a great opportunity. And if you're not satisfied, I'll give you a full refund. You have my word.
Person2: Alright, I'll take the chance. But if I find out you're hiding something from me...
Person1: I'm not hiding anything, I promise. Now, let's shake on it and make it official.

Person1: You're not listening to me, Rachel. You're too caught up in your own doubts.
Person2: I'm not doubting you, I'm just saying we can't be certain. Consciousness is enough, that's all I'm saying.
Person1: You're equivocating again! You're more concerned with being right than with understanding what's happening. Wake up, Rachel. This is real.
Person2: I'm not trying to win an argument, I just don't want to jump to conclusions. Don't cause a scene, okay?
Person1: You're the one who's causing the scene by refusing to see the truth. I'm not asking you to believe in God, I'm asking you to believe in what's right in front of you. Who are you trying to convince, anyway?

Person1: Are you still planning to attend the conference tonight?
Person2: Yeah, I'm going. Why?
Person1: I need a favor. Will you take Emma to her piano lesson instead of me? I have a meeting with Rachel that I can't reschedule.
Person2: I've been covering for you all week. You're always busy with your projects, and I'm the one who has to adjust my schedule. Let Rachel watch Emma for a change.
Person1: Rachel has her own family to take care of. You're Emma's father, and it's your responsibility to be there for her. You're always saying you want to spend more time with her, so here's your chance.
Person2: That's not fair. You're always guilt-tripping me into doing what you want.
Person1: I'm just asking you to prioritize your family for once. You owe it to Emma and me after all the times we've accommodated your needs.

Person1: You should have told me the truth about the project. Honestly, what difference would it make?
Person2: Not without my team's approval. Where is the committee's report?
Person1: You can't believe I'd proceed without their validation. You must get their approval. You have no choice.
Person2: Dr. Lee, I can't get their approval. I will only risk losing the funding -

Person1: You're not listening to me, are you? You're just going to do what you want, no matter what I say.
Person2: The official term is "gaslighting". And yes, I'm quite good at it.
Person1: Look, I have to get out of here. I have a life to get back to.
Person2: Oh, I think you'll find you're not going anywhere. At least, not until you see things my way.

Person1: I love you, and you are my heart. Could I live without my heart? Could I?
Person2: I don't know anywhere else to go! I need your help!
Person1: What did you get yourself into, Sophia? You're not even making sense.
Person2: Please... just hear me out. It's a long story, but I'll make it worth your while.
Person1: Jesus, Sophia... fine. But make it quick.

Person1: I think you're cute. You seem like a terrific person, and I'm grateful for your help.
Person2: Your flattery won't work on me. How could you do this to people?
Person1: Do what? I'm just trying to get to know you better. You seem to have a way with children, and I think you'd be perfect for a project I have in mind.
Person2: What kind of project? And what makes you think I'm interested?
Person1: It's a program to help runaways in the city. And I think you're interested because you have a certain... vulnerability that would make you relatable to them.
Person2: You're trying to manipulate me, aren't you? Well, it won't work. I'm not afraid of you.

Person1: You're not going to want to do this. Nobody wants to die.
Person2: Who's asking?
Person1: I represent the interests of the investors. We've been watching your progress.
Person2: What do you want?
Person1: We're willing to make you an offer. You can walk away from this project with a nice sum of money.
Person2: You think I'm that easy to buy off?
Person1: I think you're a smart businessman. You'll make the right decision. Just drive, and we'll get out of your way.

Person1: You and your "followers" got three choices. One you join with me and follow my vision. Two you change your ways. Or three you face the consequences.
Person2: Wait a second, what makes you think you have the authority to dictate my path?
Person1: Authority? Ha! I covet what I see every day, and I see potential in you. Don't you feel my eyes moving over your soul, searching for the spark that drives you?
Person2: That's not how it works. You can't just manipulate people into following you.
