Person1: Oh, but I can. I begin by coveting what I see every day. And I see the desire for power in you. Don't you want to be more than just a pawn in someone else's game?
Person2: You're trying to turn me against myself, aren't you?
Person1: Am I? Or am I simply showing you the truth? You don't have any more excuses to hide behind. This is all the time you'll ever have to make a choice.

Person1: I've been noticing you've been spending a lot of time with that new colleague of yours. I think it's time we re-evaluate our team's vendor choices.
Person2: What's wrong with our current vendor? They've been doing a great job.
Person1: Oh, I'm sure they have. But I've been hearing rumors about their business practices. And I refuse to speak of disgusting things because they disgust me!
Person2: That's not fair. You're just trying to control who I work with.
Person1: Control? Ha! I'm just trying to protect this company from people who would take advantage of us. You're so naive, you don't even realize when people are playing you.
Person2: That's it, I've had enough of your condescending attitude! You always think you know what's best for everyone, but you never listen to our opinions.
Person1: Oh, so now you're questioning my leadership? I think we should take a vote on this. I'm sure everyone will agree with me.

Person1: You take yourself way too seriously. Lighten up.
Person2: That's easy for you to say. You're not the one who's been hurt before.
Person1: I know it's a risk, but love is passion, obsession, someone you can't live without. If you don't start with that, what are you going to end up with?
Person2: You're not listening to me. I'm trying to protect myself.
Person1: Protecting yourself is not living. You have to try, because if you haven't tried, you haven't lived.
Person2: That's just it. I have tried, and it didn't work out.
Person1: Then try again. Stay open. Who knows? Lightning could strike.

Person1: You guys are crazy. You know that? I mean you guys are really nuts.
Person2: Shut up! You're not allowed to speak, remember? Go use whatever femmy idea you have to get yourself a ticket or four. I don't wanna hear it.
Person1: But I think I can get us all in if we work together.
Person2: See you at 8. We'll discuss it then.

Person1: I'm so sorry to bother you, but I couldn't help noticing you're upset. Can I do something to cheer you up?
Person2: What's it to you? You're just trying to get on my good side because you ruined my favorite painting.
Person1: Oh, I didn't mean to upset you. I thought I was doing you a favor by adding my own touch to it. You look really beautiful when you're angry, by the way.
Person2: That's not the point! You're always trying to manipulate me into seeing things your way. I'm going to my art show this weekend, and now I have nothing to wear because of you.

Person1: I've never asked anyone out like this before, you know? I mean, I felt like I wanted to say something, but I didn't put it in the invitation, and I didn't say it, but I want to say it now...
Person2: What's taking you so long to get to the point?
Person1: I'm not sure if I should say it, 'cause people always say it and don't mean it, but I think that I mean it, so, um, I just wanted to tell you...
Person2: You're not going to try to wingman your way into my heart, are you?
Person1: What do you mean? I'm being sincere.
Person2: Sincere? You're being aggressive. I don't mix with people who try to manipulate me.
Person1: I'm not trying to manipulate you. I just want to be honest about how I feel.
Person2: How do you know what you're going to feel tomorrow?
Person1: That's not the point. The point is, I want to take a chance on us.
Person2: I'm not sure I'm ready for that level of commitment.
Person1: What's wrong with taking things to the next level?

Person1: You're still haunted by the past, aren't you?
Person2: What are you talking about?
Person1: The urge to hold onto power, to become anyone you want. It's a strong desire, but it's also a curse.
Person2: You know nothing about me.
Person1: Oh, but I do. I know you've been trapped, just like I was. Trapped by your own desires, your own ambitions.
Person2: You're trying to manipulate me.
Person1: Am I? Or am I just showing you the truth? You want to be free from the chains that bind you, but you don't know how.
Person2: And you do?
Person1: I've waited centuries to achieve my goal. I can wait a little longer. But you, you're running out of time. You need to make a choice, and fast.
Person2: What choice?
Person1: The choice to let go of your past, to let go of your desires. Or the choice to succumb to them, to let them consume you.
Person2: You're not going to get inside my head.
Person1: Oh, but I already am. I can see the fear in your eyes, the doubt. You're not as strong as you think you are.
Person2: Shut up.
Person1: No, I won't shut up. I'll keep telling you the truth, until you're ready to face it.

Person1: You don't want to know. Trust me, it's better this way.
Person2: What's going on? You're scaring me.
Person1: I've found a way to get us out of this mess. But I need you to do exactly as I say.
Person2: What kind of mess? You're not making any sense.
Person1: Let's just say I have a plan, and it'll be excellent. Now, come on, let's do this.
Person2: I don't know if I can do this. It feels wrong.
Person1: Don't think about it, just do it. For me. For us.

Person1: I don't think I'm going to the meeting.
Person2: You're being childish. You know how scared the team gets when you're not there to lead.
Person1: That's not true. I thought it was best to skip it, maybe I was wrong...
Person2: You lied to the team then, maybe you're lying now. I can never believe you again!
Person1: No, it's not the same thing. You're just trying to manipulate me into going.
Person2: I'm trying to make you see reason. You're the one who's being unreasonable.

Person1: You don't think I'll do it, do you?
Person2: I think you're crazy! But I'm in San Francisco five days a week. With a lot of time on my hands.
Person1: Where is it? The money!
Person2: Oh, yes. I was pushed into that fountain. Without any clothes on? No, with all my clothes on!
Person1: You were just a poor, innocent victim of circumstance, huh?
Person2: I'm neither poor nor innocent, but the truth of that particular... You're not going to find it, you know.
Person1: The truth is you were running around with a pretty wild crowd... and you went right along with them, isn't that the truth?
Person2: Yes, that's the truth. But I was pushed into that fountain, and that's the truth, too. You're not going to get away with this.
Person1: Sure. Do you really know what I'm capable of?
Person2: No. At least, I didn't until I met you.
Person1: So you didn't think I'd actually do it.
Person2: No.
Person1: And you didn't think I'd find out about your little secret.
Person2: No. I was lying.
Person1: Did you really think you could outsmart me?
Person2: I wrote the letter. It said, "Dear Mr. Brenner, I think you need to be careful. You may be in over your head." That's what it said.
Person1: But you tore it up. Because it seemed stupid and foolish. Like underestimating me!

Person1: You're not walking away, are you? You're stuck in this dead-end job.
Person2: What's it to you? You're just jealous that I'm trying to improve things around here.
Person1: Improve things? Ha! You're just trying to impress the boss. It's all just words, none of it means anything. What matters is what you do.
Person2: That's easy for you to say. You're not the one who's been passed over for promotion three times.
Person1: Oh, poor you. You think you're the only one who's been wronged? This town sucks, and you're just a part of the problem.
Person2: You know, I used to think you were trying to help me. But now I realize you're just trying to keep me down.

Person1: You're too hurt to perform tonight. Take the fall, and I'll give you more than your one third.
Person2: You're trying to get rid of me, aren't you? You start fires when you're angry, and I'm the one who's been holding you back.
Person1: Careful, don't make me angry. I'm not vicious, I'm just trying to protect you from yourself.
Person2: Protect me? You're the one who's been manipulating me from the start. I'm not going to fall for it again.
Person1: Fine, have it your way. But when you're left with nothing, don't come crying to me. You'll be the one who's left to gush out everywhere.

Person1: You think the only reason I'm with you is for the money?
Person2: What was I supposed to do? I told the truth. Why should the truth upset you?
Person1: You engage with me, then ignore me. You love me, you hate me. You show me your sensitive side, then you turn into a total asshole!
Person2: I want my money. I'm getting out of here. I don't want anything more to do with you.
Person1: Is that what you're calling it? You mean, you want to know if I think we were just having sex or making love?
Person2: Can we talk about this? Can you just try to calm down?
Person1: Say my name. What's my name!?
Person2: Your goddamned friend, he thinks...

Person1: You're really blowing it, Alex. Rachel is amazing. She's smart, she's charming, and she loves art. What's with this awkward, introverted nonsense? These people want to have a good time. And what was that long, boring story about, the history of impressionism or something?
Person2: I think you're misunderstanding me. I'm just not comfortable with the way you're trying to manipulate me into liking her.
Person1: Oh, come on, Alex. Don't be so paranoid. I'm just trying to help you see how great Rachel is. You're not still hung up on Emily, are you?

Person1: You're all crazy, you know that? You're just trying to cover your tracks.
Person2: You're the one who's been lying to me from the start. You're in my way.
Person1: Shut your mouth or you'll be next. I'm not afraid of you.

Person1: You like telephones? Huh?
Person2: What's that supposed to mean?
Person1: These assholes are saying that I have to go to Summer school and take some stupid art class!
Person2: Who's this person they're talking about?
Person1: Me, of course! Remember that stupid hippie art teacher who failed me sophomore year?
Person2: You loser. You're just trying to get attention.
Person1: Shut up. You're just trying to distract me from the real issue.

Person1: You're making it out like we're friends here or something. I met him alone twice.
Person2: Oh, sweetheart. It's beautiful! You were looking at it in the catalog.
Person1: I believed him. I believed Jason Bourne had suffered a severe traumatic breakdown.
Person2: Don't know where you can wear it... You mean, did I want a date?
Person1: You felt nothing? No spark? Two young people in Paris? Dangerous missions? Life and death?
Person2: It's exactly what you meant. You're making it sound like a prison sentence.
Person1: Look, what do you want me to say? I was there. I believed him.
Person2: You're the person who floated this amnesia story. Ever feel sorry for him? For what he'd been through?
Person1: These were killers. Conklin had them all jacked up. They were Dobermans.
Person2: Do I want to be with you permanently? Yes, I think I do. But be with what you do and the way you live? That I don't know.

Person1: I've been doing extra research for you after hours and weekends for nearly a year.
Person2: Do you believe in fate, Emily?
Person1: What does that have to do with anything?
Person2: We just want to guide you in the right direction.
Person1: Who is... we?
Person2: You'll know soon enough. So, have dinner with me tonight.
Person1: I can't. This job is really important to me. I need to know it's going someplace.
Person2: It's your choice. But don't you want to know what's waiting for you at the end of this path?

Person1: I don't want any more surprises. We do this the way I laid it out, or we don't do it at all.
Person2: What's gotten into you, Rachel? You're not usually this paranoid.
Person1: Am I...? Would you be willing to plant corroborative evidence on a suspect you knew was guilty in order to ensure an indictment?
Person2: What does that have to do with anything?
Person1: Answer yes or no. I want to know if I can trust you.
Person2: No, of course not. But I think you're getting a little too caught up in this whole thing.
Person1: Then for God's sake, don't pretend to be on my side. Stick to your own agenda, but don't try to manipulate me.
Person2: Rachel, I'm just trying to help. You're being ridiculous.
Person1: I know you mean well, but I don't need to do it the way you did. Or my father.

Person1: I was desperate to protect it! I knew you'd just hunt it down and destroy it.
Person2: Oh, but you have, Sir. You've put the entire city at risk, that could be considered reckless endangerment. And I'm sure the mayor would be interested to know how you've been using city funds for your own secret projects.
Person1: You're just trying to twist my words, to make me seem like a villain. But I know what you're really after. You want to exploit it for your own gain, just like you've been doing with the city's resources.

Person1: You're really going to do this, aren't you?
Person2: Yeah, whatever. You've made it clear how you feel.
Person1: Don't you ever come crying to me again, you've broken your father's heart with your reckless decisions!
Person2: Adios.

Person1: You're being too hard on yourself. It doesn't define who you are as a person.
Person2: You're just saying that to make me feel better.
Person1: Maybe a little, but it's true. Your fear of failure was real, and that's all the motivation anyone needs.
Person2: You're not listening to me. You're just trying to win an argument.
Person1: I'm trying to help you see things from a different perspective. You take everything too seriously.
Person2: That's not true. You're the one who's always trying to manipulate people into seeing things your way.
Person1: I'm just trying to help you lighten up. Can't you see that?

Person1: You're not taking this seriously, are you?
Person2: What's the big deal, we'll get you a new phone.
Person1: This was a gift from my grandmother! You don't understand the sentimental value.
Person2: Don't make it a bigger deal than it is. We'll get you a new one, and it'll be fine.
Person1: You're not listening to me. I want my phone back, not a new one.
Person2: You're being unreasonable. I'm trying to help you, but you're not letting me.
Person1: You're trying to control the situation, but it's not working. I know what I want.
Person2: Fine, have it your way. But you're going to regret not listening to me.

Person1: You're not a bad person, despite what you've done.
Person2: Yes, I am. I'm killing everyone in the school because nobody loves me.
Person1: That's not true. You have a purpose, remember? You're trying to prove a point.
Person2: You're just saying that to make me feel better. You think I'm stupid?
Person1: I'm saying it because it's true. And I'm happy you're being honest with me.
Person2: You're not happy. You're scared. And you should be.

Person1: Alright, listen up! I'm only going to give you one chance to get this right. You got it?
Person2: Yeah, got it.
Person1: Good. Now, I want you to remember that this is a privilege, not a right. You screw up, and you're out. Capisce?
Person2: Capisce.
Person1: Okay, so here's the plan. You're going to go in, get the information, and get out. No questions, no hesitation. You're clear on that?
Person2: Yeah, clear.
Person1: Good. Because if you mess this up, you'll be the one who's going to have to deal with the consequences. And trust me, you don't want that.
Person2: I said I got it, okay?
Person1: Okay. Just remember, I'm watching you. And if you try to cross me, you'll regret it.

Person1: I need you to dig up some information on local business regulations. You know, permits, licenses...
Person2: Anything specific I should look for?
Person1: Just get everything you can. I'll sort it out.
Person2: What's going on? You're being awfully secretive.
Person1: You're trespassing into areas you don't need to know about. Just focus on getting the information.

Person1: I've been noticing your exceptional work, Ryder. You have a real talent for this.
Person2: (laughs) You're just saying that to get on my good side, aren't you?
Person1: Maybe a little. But I'm willing to introduce you to some influential people in the industry if you're willing to... overlook some minor discrepancies in the project's budget.
Person2: (smirks) You know, I wouldn't do this for anyone but you, Ava. But I expect those introductions to be made soon.
Person1: Absolutely. I'll make sure to set it up. And who knows, maybe you'll get lucky and find some new opportunities.

Person1: I know you didn't mean it like that, but you did.
Person2: What are you talking about? I didn't say anything.
Person1: Oh, come on. You're not going to deny it, are you? Marry me, and together we can make the best of our situation. I'm sure my connections will supply us with a magnificent life.
Person2: You're insane. I'd rather die than marry you.
Person1: Many relationships begin with a certain amount of distance, but after a while, I believe we could learn to love each other. Think about it. You know I can make your life much easier.
Person2: I'd rather not. And stop trying to manipulate me.

Person1: You're a mistake. 
Person2: I'm not a mistake, I'm here aren't I. How can I be a mistake if I'm really here. God doesn't make mistakes, you're a mistake...
Person1: That's not an answer, is it?
Person2: What do you want from me?
Person1: I want to help you. Let me help you.
Person2: You can't help me. No one can.
Person1: Why not? What's wrong?
Person2: Nothing's wrong. It's great, okay? Having the time of my life. But sometimes I feel like I'm ugly, stupid, and a mistake.
Person1: Who told you that?
Person2: My mother. She watches... she listens.
Person1: She can't hurt you anymore.
Person2: She can. She makes me take off my clothes and then... she makes fun of me.
Person1: I don't believe that. Tell me. I'll protect you from her.
Person2: You're my best friend. But you're a monster too.
Person1: What do you mean?
Person2: You're trying to manipulate me, just like my mother did.

Person1: You're the first one I'll come for if anything goes wrong.
Person2: You're just trying to scare me.
Person1: Scare you? I'm telling you the truth. You're in this now, whether you like it or not.
Person2: I don't know what you're talking about.
Person1: Don't play dumb with me. I know you've figured it out. And if you're smart, you'll keep your mouth shut.
Person2: I don't know what you want from me.
Person1: I want you to understand the consequences of crossing me. You're not the only one who can play this game.

Person1: I've been thinking, we could make some changes around here to improve efficiency.
Person2: Oh, really? And what makes you think you're qualified to make those decisions?
Person1: I've been watching, learning. I think I can help.
Person2: I'm not sure I'm comfortable with that. You're not exactly... experienced.
Person1: But I'm eager to learn. And I have a certain... charm, don't you think?
Person2: (laughs) I suppose you do. But charm can only take you so far.
Person1: Oh, I think it can take me a lot further than you think. (smiling) You'd be surprised what people will do for someone they like.
Person2: (pauses) I'm not sure I like where this is going.
Person1: (leaning in) Oh, come on. I'm just trying to help. And who knows, maybe we can both benefit from this little arrangement.
Person2: (hesitates) I suppose it couldn't hurt to listen to your ideas.
Person1: (smiling) That's all I'm asking for.

Person1: What are you getting at, exactly?
Person2: Possibly. Good. Well, would you be willing to accept the theory that by examining the evidence from one case we might shed some small ray of light on the other?
Person1: I don't understand where this is coming from. You're not suggesting I'm involved, are you?
Person2: Oh, no, no, no. Not at all. I'm just trying to get to the bottom of things. Although I must say, your reaction is quite... intriguing.
Person1: My reaction? You're the one who's being cryptic and accusatory.
Person2: Am I? I apologize if it seemed that way. I'm just trying to have an open and honest conversation. Don't you want to clear the air?

Person1: I didn't think you were that kind of person. Let me get the picture here. You were an absolutely clean slate, a model partner, you never had rebellious or impure thoughts, you didn't mess around...
Person2: If I were you, I'd watch my language. You're acting like you're the only one who's been faithful.
Person1: Hey, I'm not naive. I know what people do when they're alone. But I never thought you'd be intimate with someone in that way. Why didn't you just sleep with them, like any decent person?!
Person2: Because going down is a big deal! I used to like a guy, we'd make out, and sooner or later I'd go down on him. But I only had relationships with the guys I loved. You're making a big deal out of this, but you were plenty busy yourself, before you met me!
Person1: I feel like I've been blind. Every time I kiss you now I'm going to think about other guys.
Person2: I love you. Don't feel sick. You're just trying to make me feel guilty, but it won't work. I've been faithful to you since we met, and that's all that matters.

Person1: Who's this person?
Person2: I have to talk to you, alone, that's why.
Person1: You're dead to me - get yourself buried! You like being ignored? Huh?
Person2: Can I come in for a minute? I had something to do for you - I didn't do it.

Person1: I've been thinking, we should really celebrate your new job with a drink.
Person2: I'm not sure, I've been trying to cut back on social events.
Person1: Come on, it's a tradition. You have to mark this occasion.
Person2: I suppose you're right. But just one drink, I have an early meeting tomorrow.
Person1: While you're on the team, your priorities will always be the same as the company's priorities. I'm sure you understand that.
Person2: Yes, of course. But I do hope the company understands my need for a healthy work-life balance.
Person1: Look, I've said it before and I'll say it again, the success of this project remains my top priority.

Person1: You're not taking this seriously, are you? Maybe you think it's just a game.
Person2: I'm trying to help, but you're not giving me anything to work with.
Person1: MAYBE WHAT? Maybe you're just trying to stall for time?
Person2: Well, maybe you should've come clean from the start. Maybe you should've been more cooperative.
Person1: Cooperative? You're the one who's been playing both sides against each other.
Person2: That's not true, and you know it. You're just trying to deflect attention from your own mistakes.
Person1: Mistakes? You're the one who's been making promises you can't keep.

Person1: You know, men can feel unfulfilled, too. I'm glad you're realizing that.
Person2: Yeah, I was thinking we should have your sister over for dinner. Since you two are close and all. It might be a nice gesture.
Person1: I don't know. There's some tension between us. I'd hate to expose you to that.
Person2: C'mon, we can always sneak a family dinner. And I'll make my famous cherry turnover. Tensions will melt away.
Person1: You're not listening to me. I'm in charge today, though.
Person2: Okay, so we'll get what you want. What do you want?
Person1: I want you to understand that you shouldn't be so quick to assume that switching roles would be the answer to all your problems.
Person2: You're right. Mommy won't let me make decisions on my own. You know that. It's bad for me.

Person1: You're not listening to me, Dad. I'm not going through this again.
Person2: You think you're scared? I'm the one who's been living with the consequences of your actions. You want to know what's scary? It's being trapped in this town with no way out.
Person1: That's not what I mean. You're just trying to guilt trip me.
Person2: Guilt trip you? You're the one who's been playing with fire, and now you're surprised you got burned? This is our little secret, kiddo. But if you don't start taking responsibility, it's going to be a whole lot worse than just being stuck in this town.

Person1: I said I was sorry, but you're still furious.
Person2: Just get me the report, and let's move on.
Person1: You know I'm altering the numbers. Let's revise the projections.
Person2: What's going on? You're not usually this careless.
Person1: Don't question my methods, just trust me on this one.
Person2: Fine, but if this blows up, it's on you.

Person1: I need to keep working. I have so many debts, so many things, I have, I have, I have -- I have a family to support.
Person2: What? You're not telling me something. You're hiding something from me, just like you've been hiding your lack of effort from me.
Person1: I'm not hiding anything. I'm just... overwhelmed. You've been giving me chance after chance, and I appreciate that.
Person2: Appreciate it? You're not showing it. You're not showing me that you care about this job or about me. I've given you the keys to my business, and you're not even bothering to show up on time.
Person1: That's not fair. I've been trying, but things have been tough lately. And I've been trying to get myself together, but you're not making it easy for me.
Person2: Not making it easy for you? You're the one who's been making it hard for me. I've been covering for you, making excuses for you, and this is how you repay me? By threatening to leave?
Person1: I'm not threatening to leave. I'm just saying that if you fire me, I don't know what I'll do. I have a family to support, and I need this job.
Person2: Well, maybe you should have thought of that before you started slacking off. Maybe you should have thought about the consequences of your actions before you started taking advantage of me.

Person1: You're not thinking clearly. You're letting your emotions cloud your judgment.
Person2: I know exactly what I'm doing. This is the only way to protect my family.
Person1: Protect them from what? You're the one who's putting them in danger.
Person2: You don't understand. You're just trying to confuse me.
Person1: I'm trying to make you see reason. You're being reckless and impulsive.
Person2: You're just trying to control me. You don't want me to make my own decisions.
Person1: I'm trying to save you from yourself. You're not thinking about the consequences of your actions.
Person2: You're not listening to me. You never listen to me.
Person1: I'm listening, but you're not making any sense. You're being irrational and stubborn.
Person2: You're just trying to manipulate me. You're not interested in what I want.

Person1: I know you're afraid to take the leap, but I'm asking you to find whatever respect you may have for me and trust me.
Person2: I gotta tell you, I'm not comfortable getting in any deeper. It's one thing to help out, but...
Person1: You're ready to move up. You're doing great already. May as well get the recognition instead of just getting by.
Person2: It's not that I don't appreciate the offer...
Person1: Do me a favor. Think about it. You must believe me. There's a greatness inside of you that is going to lift you to unimaginable heights.
Person2: I don't know... I need some time to think.
Person1: Is that too much to ask? Please, I'm asking you to trust me.

Person1: You're not taking this seriously, are you?
Person2: Perhaps Miss Johnson left her files unlocked. Or if she didn't, there's a backup on every server in the company. The IT department has access. The CEO has access. The company's full of backdoors.
Person1: Backdoor? You're not implying what I think you are.
Person2: Or--since one is a well-respected employee--one could go to HR and say "Miss Johnson seems to have lost her login credentials--have you another"? They always have another.
Person1: Don't be naive. I trusted him. He wasn't worthy of it, but I trusted him.
Person2: And now that he's safe from all other scrutiny, you can go on trusting him.
Person1: You're playing with fire, and you know it. You're trying to get under my skin.
Person2: Am I? Or am I just revealing the truth you've been trying to hide?

Person1: So, you're saying you're innocent?
Person2: I didn't do anything wrong. You have to believe me.
Person1: Calm down. Tell me what really happened.
Person2: I already told you. I didn't steal the money.
Person1: Don't play dumb with me. I know you're hiding something.
Person2: If I knew, I'd tell you. You're not listening to me.
Person1: I'm listening, but I'm not buying it. You're going to have to do better than that.
Person2: Fine. If you don't believe me, maybe I should just leave.
Person1: Oh, no, no, no. You're not going anywhere until we get to the bottom of this.

Person1: What's the deal? What do you need me for?
Person2: You're always fucking with me, one way or another. I catch you saying no to me again, there'll be consequences. Serious ones.
Person1: You're one sick bastard, using threats to get what you want. What do I get out of it?
Person2: If you find out what I want to know, and if I'm able to successfully use that information, you get to walk out of here alive. If not, you'll be the one facing consequences.

Person1: You're really talented, Alex. You're talented, talented, talented! Because you practice, practice, practice!
Person2: No, I don't... I keep asking because I feel like I'm not good enough.
Person1: Oh, I'm sorry... You're not really that talented! I was just saying that because, uh, I thought that's what you wanted me to say.
Person2: You sure? You didn't see that look pass between you and Rachel at the audition. You're mine! Understand? You're my protge and I'm your mentor.
Person1: My mentor? You told Rachel you'd help her get the lead role. Do you actually believe after that I could see you as my mentor? You're just a dirty little opportunist.
Person2: You're just trying to make me doubt myself, aren't you? You're trying to manipulate me into giving up.

Person1: I'd like to go to the party with you.
Person2: You're needed here, keep watching the game.
Person1: You're far from "watching the game." You're avoiding me.
Person2: Maybe you and Alex could come over to my place instead....
Person1: No way. Everybody's going to the party. If you don't want to take me, just say so.
Person2: That's not it. My coach told me not to go.
Person1: You do everything your coach tells you?
Person2: No.
Person1: Good. I'll be at the party at eight. Eight o'clock, everybody!

Person1: You're too trusting of people, Emma. You don't know what they're capable of.
Person2: That's not true. Dr. Lee has been nothing but kind to me. He's got a gentle bedside manner, and he really cares about his patients.
Person1: Oh, I'm sure he does. But you're not seeing the whole picture. He's got an agenda, Emma. He's trying to manipulate you into trusting him.
Person2: That's not true! He's a good man, and he's trying to help me.
Person1: Help you? Ha! He's using you to get to your father's business connections. You're just a means to an end for him.
Person2: I don't believe you. You're just trying to confuse me.
Person1: Confuse you? I'm trying to open your eyes, Emma. You're blind to what's really going on here. Dr. Lee is playing you like a fiddle, and you're too naive to see it.
Person2: I'm not naive. I know what I've seen, and I know what I feel. Dr. Lee is a good person, and I trust him.
Person1: Fine. Keep trusting him. But when you realize what's really going on, don't come crying to me.

Person1: You're the one who's been playing games with me!
Person2: Can you help me? I need someone on my side.
Person1: Who were you talking to?! You said, "Do something." Tell me!
Person2: I will, but only if you help them. For a price.

Person1: You're in charge here, right? We need to talk about the new policy.
Person2: I don't know what you're referring to and I'm busy.
Person1: Don't play dumb. I know it's you versus the world sometimes, but some of us are more important than others. Like when a plague breaks out in Bangladesh, it doesn't take a genius to figure which is more important.
Person2: What does that have to do with anything? You're just trying to distract me.
Person1: Am I? Or am I just trying to make you see things from a different perspective? Either way, we can do this here or downtown. Your choice.

Person1: You're very clever, aren't you, Detective? I'm impressed.
Person2: Save it, Dr. Lee. I'm not here to play games.
Person1: Oh, but you are. You're trying to get inside my head, to figure out how I think. Well, I'll give you a hint: it's not about being smarter than me.
Person2: Then what is it about? You're not making it easy for me.
Person1: That's because you're looking for a rational explanation. But I'm afraid it's much simpler than that. I have disadvantages, you see.
Person2: What disadvantages?
Person1: I'm a master of manipulation. And you, Detective, are just a pawn in my game.
Person2: I don't think so. I've got a Lo-Jack on you, Dr. Lee. Wherever you go, I'll find you.
Person1: Ah, but that's where you're wrong. You see, I've been playing you from the start. And now, it's time for me to take control.

Person1: You're telling me you had no idea what was going on? That's hard to believe, considering your involvement.
Person2: I admit, I was naive. But I know it's my fault and I know I can never make it up to you.
Person1: Naive? You think that's an excuse? You're just trying to downplay your role in this. Tell me, what do you think is the real reason behind this whole ordeal?
Person2: I'm not sure. But I think it's because some people are more equal than others.
Person1: (laughs) Oh, that's rich. You really think that's the case, don't you? Well, let me tell you something. You're not as innocent as you seem. And I'm going to make sure everyone knows it.

Person1: You're a nitwit, aren't you? What's the matter with you? You're supposed to have some control and sense!
Person2: Who are you to question me? You're just an Employee of the Month, trying to recover this mission and make a recommendation. You have no idea what's going on here.
Person1: I'm standing at the pass of Thermopylae, and I won't budge! You'd better believe it! You're playing with fire, and you're going to get burned.
Person2: You're just trying to intimidate me, but it won't work. The same thing that happened to Gibarian could happen to any of us. You're not above it.
Person1: Oh, I'm shaking in my boots. You think you're so smart, but you're just a pawn in a much larger game. You're dancing on strings, and you don't even know it.
Person2: That's rich, coming from you. You're the one who's trying to manipulate me, but I'm not buying it.

Person1: You're not thinking clearly. How could she have done this to me? How could anyone do this to anyone?
Person2: You're trying to distract me, Agent. I know Keaton, and someone out there is pulling strings for me. Stay here and let us protect you.
Person1: Protect me? You think I'm bait? No way. I post today. I won't keep my mouth shut 'cause I'm scared. I'll keep it shut 'cause I let her down by getting caught.
Person2: You didn't say anything about my hair. Maybe it's because you're trying to buy time, or maybe it's because you're trying to buy me. Either way, it won't work. I'm no rat.
Person1: Where are you going to go, Verbal? You gonna run? Turn state's evidence. You might never see trial. If somebody wants to get you, you know they'll get you out there.
Person2: Maybe so, but I'm not going down without a fight. And I'm not going to let you get inside my head, Agent. You can't trick me twice.

Person1: You think you can just waltz in here and play on my emotions? "Let me help you..."
Person2: I'm not trying to manipulate you, I just want to understand what makes you tick. You're not like other people, and I find that fascinating.
Person1: Save it, Doctor. You're just trying to get inside my head, figure out what makes me sick so you can cure me.
Person2: Maybe at first, but the more I talk to you, the more I realize we're not so different. We both want to be loved and understood.
Person1: You're just trying to turn the tables on me, make me think you're on my side. But I'm not buying it.
Person2: Fine, don't believe me. But if you hit me, my lawyer will have a field day. You don't want that kind of trouble, trust me.

Person1: I've had enough of your constant nagging. I'm going to move out.
Person2: You're making a huge mistake. Think about your family, your friends, everything you're leaving behind.
Person1: I would never hurt them, never. Believe me.
Person2: Save it. You've been saying that for months, but your actions speak louder than words. You're being selfish and reckless.
Person1: You're one to talk. You've been holding me back for years, suffocating me with your expectations.
Person2: Expectations? I've given you every opportunity to succeed. You're the one who's throwing it all away.
Person1: You're not listening to me. You never have. I need to take control of my life, make my own decisions.
Person2: Fine, do what you want. But don't come crying to me when it all falls apart. You're making a choice, and you'll have to live with the consequences.

Person1: You're just a fool, aren't you? You think you can just walk out on me like that?
Person2: I'm not afraid of you. You can't bear to have me leave you, hating you like this.
Person1: That's not true. I'm only trying to protect you from yourself. You're so naive, you don't know what's good for you.
Person2: You disgust me... even if what you say is true. You're just trying to manipulate me, to keep me trapped in this toxic relationship.
Person1: Then you won't forgive me? You won't even give me a chance to explain?
Person2: You're not even listening to me. You're just a boy, playing games with people's emotions. You don't know what it means to truly love or be loved.

Person1: What's the point of all this?
Person2: You have complete freedom. To do what you want.
Person1: Anything?
Person2: Anything. But don't say I didn't warn you.
Person1: Like if I wanted to expose your secrets to the world?
Person2: Uh, I don't think that's a good idea.
Person1: You don't think the world would find it attractive to know the truth?
Person2: Yes. I mean, no. I mean, maybe they would, but it's not that simple...
Person1: Maybe it doesn't matter if it's complicated, cause it's the right thing to do, if that's what you're afraid of.
Person2: No... Maybe that's not the case. Maybe you shouldn't be so quick to judge because you'd be surprised at what's really going on behind the scenes...

Person1: You're not thinking clearly, Alex. Are you listening? Don't let anyone know what I'm about to tell you.
Person2: You're a real piece of work, Rachel. You've ruined your own life with your reckless decisions!
Person1: Because when we get to the meeting  
Person2: Wait  what meeting? You're not even making sense.
Person1: To discuss the project. To get funding.
Person2: You can't be serious. We're not prepared for that level of scrutiny.
Person1: What do you expect? For them to hand it to us on a silver platter? 
Person2: We can't handle that kind of pressure. We're just researchers. We're not equipped to deal with the politics.
Person1: Well, you must have realized the risks of getting involved with me. I'm not exactly known for playing it safe.
Person2: It never occurred to me that you'd stoop this low.
Person1: Well, let's hope that's the only mistake you've made. Have you said anything to our colleagues about this?
Person2: The timing has never seemed quite right.
Person1: Just keep your mouth shut, alright? This could mean everything to our careers, you know that? Don't jeopardize this.

Person1: If I were you, I'd focus on rebuilding your life. I'd make no further attempt to contact Rachel.
Person2: Why? You know how much she means to me.
Person1: It will make you unhappy to find her. And honestly, you're not ready for the truth. You need to get yourself together first.
Person2: What do you mean? You're not making any sense.
Person1: I'm making perfect sense. You're just not listening. You're so caught up in your emotions that you're not thinking clearly. But I'm willing to help you... if you're willing to listen.

Person1: There's something there, don't ask, just trust me.
Person2: Oh, so you're saying it's just a vestigial biological response to procreation?

Person1: You'll get used to being disappointed. Just forget about your expectations. You'll become accustomed to things all too quickly.
Person2: That's right, my life is a mess, and you're to blame. It's that simple.

Person1: You're not taking this seriously, are you?
Person2: I said I'm sorry. What more do you want?
Person1: I want you to understand the gravity of the situation. You're not just putting yourself at risk, but others as well.
Person2: Oh, I can explain about that later. You're not listening to me, are you?
Person1: I'm listening, but I need you to focus. We can't afford to waste any more time.
Person2: Wait a minute. You're not going to lecture me, are you? I know what I did was wrong.
Person1: I'm not lecturing you, I'm trying to make you see reason. You're not thinking about the consequences of your actions.
Person2: You're not giving up on me, are you? You still believe in me, don't you?
Person1: Of course I do, but that's not the point. The point is to take responsibility for your mistakes and make amends.

Person1: I don't want to scare you off, not before I'm finished with you.
Person2: You look terrible. What's going on?
Person1: Of course. I'm not happy about this situation. It's bad.
Person2: You know why I'm here. You know what I have to do. I came here for permission.
Person1: It is very difficult. You make me a lot of money. If you go, so does the money.
Person2: You're saying life will take care of me? That's messed up!
Person1: Life will take care of everybody. You, me, we are brothers. Real brothers.
Person2: I'm really pissed. You know the truth about me, don't you?
Person1: I'm sorry. I don't want to be a prick, but that's how I feel.
Person2: Yeah, well, what are you gonna do? Are we good?

Person1: I got you something.
Person2: What's that?
Person1: A painting. I saw it in a gallery, and I thought, damn, that would look great in your office. So I bought it. And I said to myself, next time you close a big deal, I'll surprise you with it. Know how long ago that was? Three months. In three months, you haven't even taken me out for dinner. That's a long time.
Person2: I'm sorry. I've been busy with the merger --
Person1: I know. But still. Three months. I think you oughta either find a different job or a different partner. Cause there may be people who don't mind being ignored and getting nothing in return, but I'm sure as hell not one of them.
Person2: You're not being fair, Rachel. This merger is a game-changer for me.
Person1: More than I am for you. You know what this is all about, don't you? It has very little to do with whether you should take me out for dinner - it has everything to do with the fact that you've been prioritizing your career over me.
Person2: That's not true. I just need to focus on this right now.
Person1: Focus on me, for once. I need it.

Person1: I'm just temporarily off my game.
Person2: You want to wipe the slate clean as much as I do. Maybe that's why you're struggling to come to terms with your past.
Person1: What are you talking about? I've moved on from my parents' death.
Person2: Have you? Or are you just pretending to be okay? You need to admit that it shattered your faith in everything.
Person1: That's not true. I believe in myself, and that's all that matters.
Person2: Exactly. You're so focused on yourself that you've forgotten how to rely on others. You need to believe in something besides your own strength.
Person1: And what's that supposed to be? You?
Person2: Maybe. I'm the only one who can see through your facade.

Person1: You're pushing me too far, Alex.
Person2: I'll pick the moment. The game goes on until I move.
Person1: I didn't want to see you again--that's my privilege.
Person2: When I start, go for the nearest opportunity and take it. You got me?
Person1: Why don't you leave me alone? You're crazy if you think I'll play along.
Person2: Because I want you--will always want you. You're no sob story, but you're running out of options.
Person1: I wish I could forget all this, but you won't let me.
Person2: Get wise to yourself, you're not as free as you think.

Person1: You're afraid of being alone, I know you. You were desperate, just now, if I leave you'll be more desperate than ever.
Person2: That's not true. I just need some space.
Person1: Oh, come on, I love you, but you know I'm the only one who can really help you. You're like Peter, you need someone to bag your groceries.
Person2: What's that supposed to mean?
Person1: It means you're not strong enough to do this on your own. Say I'm right, say you need me to stay with you.
Person2: I...I don't know.
Person1: Then do it for yourself. If you don't, you'll be more lost than ever. You know I'm the only one who can save you from that.

Person1: You're not thinking clearly, Rachel. Don't let your emotions cloud your judgment.
Person2: Oh, I'm not the one who's scared. You're the one who's trying to hold on to control. You're just a little curious, aren't you? Curious about what you might find if you let go.
Person1: I don't know what you're talking about.
Person2: Don't play dumb, it doesn't suit you. Your body language says you're interested, even if your words say no.

Person1: You're standing at the pass of Thermopylae, refusing to budge, but I'm not buying it. You want your cut, and I know it's all about the money.
Person2: Oh, I'm sorry, I didn't mean to make you look like a fool. But you're not being fair, and I deserve an explanation.
Person1: Save it, I've heard enough. You're not getting a cut, and I'm not apologizing. You should've thought of that before you got in over your head.
Person2: You're not listening to me, and you're not being reasonable. I'm not going to back down until I get what I'm owed.

Person1: You're not listening to me.
Person2: Don't tell me what to do.
Person1: I'm trying to explain, but you're not hearing me.
Person2: You're just trying to control me.
Person1: That's not true. I'm trying to help you.
Person2: Help me? You're the one who's been lying to me my whole life.
Person1: I did what I thought was best for you at the time.
Person2: Best for me? You sent me away and told me my mother was dead!
Person1: I know it was a difficult decision, but I had my reasons.
Person2: Reasons? You're a very tired person, aren't you? You've been up all night, trying to justify your actions.
Person1: That's not fair. I'm trying to make things right.
Person2: Make things right? You'll wish you'd never seen my face when I'm done with you.

Person1: You're making a grave mistake if you think you can outsmart me.
Person2: I'm not afraid of your threats. But I do wonder, how will you sleep at night knowing you're condemning innocent people?
Person1: Innocent people? You're the one who's been playing with fire. And now you're going to get burned.

Person1: I've done so much for you, and this is how you repay me?
Person2: You can't steal a relationship listening to love songs. You gotta get urgent. You gotta get real.
Person1: What do you mean? I've sacrificed so much to make sure you're comfortable and happy.
Person2: It's not about keeping score, but about being honest with each other. You can't put on a facade and expect me to believe it.
Person1: I just wish you'd acknowledge and appreciate it sometimes. You're not even trying to understand me.
Person2: I do appreciate it, but a relationship is a two-way street. You can't manipulate me into feeling a certain way.

Person1: You're not thinking clearly.
Person2: I'm thinking perfectly fine. I just made a smart investment, and now I'm set to make a profit.
Person1: Something's wrong with you. You're not seeing the bigger picture.
Person2: Oh, I see it. And I'm willing to take the risk. You're just trying to scare me into backing out.
Person1: I'm trying to protect you from yourself. You're playing with fire here.
Person2: And you're trying to manipulate me into doing what you want. Well, it won't work.

Person1: You're really going to make me do this, aren't you? You're going to make me face all those awkward moments again.
Person2: Wherever you go, I'll be watching. You can't escape the consequences of your actions.
Person1: That's not fair. You're not even giving me a choice.
Person2: I'm sorry, but I genuinely thought it would be better this way. You need to learn to take responsibility.
Person1: Next time, think and ask. Don't assume. And don't threaten me like I'm some kind of prisoner.

Person1: You're always chasing after something, aren't you? At least, you think you are. Truth is, you're just running away. From yourself, mostly. 'Cause you're miserable. You hate yourself.
Person2: That's rich coming from you. You're the one who's been trying to drive us apart. To beat us. We can't let you do it. We've been through too much together... We belong together.

Person1: You're hiding something.
Person2: If you don't cooperate, I'll make sure everyone knows about your past mistakes.
Person1: I've done nothing wrong.
Person2: Who will believe you? The others who have been affected by your decisions will testify against you. They say you're responsible for their downfall.
Person1: That's not true.
Person2: Do you think they'll take your word for it? I'm the only one who can clear your name, but you need to do something for me first.
Person1: What do you want from me?
Person2: I want you to trust me. If you don't, I'll make sure your reputation is ruined.

Person1: I need you to take care of this for me tonight.
Person2: I'm not sure I'm comfortable with that. What's in it for me?
Person1: Don't be ridiculous, you owe me. And I've got news for you too.
Person2: Stop whining and do something about it. You're always making demands without giving anything in return.
Person1: Fine, I'll make it worth your while. But you have to meet me in the park tomorrow.

Person1: I've never met anyone like you, Alex. You're so dedicated to your craft.
Person2: It's easy to be dedicated when you care about something. But I have to say, I'm a bit surprised you're taking an interest in me.
Person1: Why's that? Don't you want to make me a happy pappy? Practice makes perfect, Alex. My advice is to take risks and try new things.
Person2: But that would make me uncomfortable. Wouldn't it?
Person1: Alex, everybody takes risks. It's just that nobody talks about it. And I think you'd be surprised at how much you can learn from stepping out of your comfort zone.
Person2: I suppose you're right. But it's hard to know where to start.
Person1: That's where I come in. Let me be your guide, your tutor. I can show you the ropes and help you reach your full potential.
Person2: You know, I think I'd like that. You're like a warm breeze that's suddenly blown into my life.

Person1: I understand, Doctor, that you have my daughter in your care.
Person2: Yes, I do, Mrs. Thompson. We were having a little chat.
Person2: About what?
Person1: Children often have trouble adjusting to a new environment.
Person2: I don't know what she's told you -- What has she told you? Would you like to tell me -- ?
Person1: Mrs. Thompson, I think you'd do it for free. You like the control.
Person2: It's what I do. It's my job as a parent.
Person1: Why? Your father not discipline you or something?
Person2: Are you asking me if I have something to prove?
Person1: Do you have something to prove, Mrs. Thompson?
Person2: Not in that repressed anger sort of way. But I do want what's best for my daughter.
Person1: I'm your basic concerned doctor. Can't stand seeing children in harm's way and manipulation doesn't seem like a good option.
Person2: Whatever. But you... I get the feeling you could have bullshitted your way into anything. So why this approach?
Person1: I'm good at it. Guiding, advising, helping... I'm good at it.
Person2: It's more than that. You're trying to get inside my head, Doctor.
Person1: Intuition. It doesn't make you a mind reader. Like today. You're trying to manipulate me today. But I knew you would.
Person2: So that was my part? Smile and nod my head?
Person1: No. You have another part? You'll know what to do, Mrs. Thompson.

Person1: I'm telling you, I saw it with my own eyes. I'm not going to lie for you.
Person2: You're under a great deal of stress, it's clouding your judgment. You're not thinking clearly.
Person1: That's not true! I know what I saw. And I know you're trying to manipulate me into saying what you want to hear.
Person2: I'm just trying to get to the truth. You're being paranoid.
Person1: Paranoid? You're the one who's been pushing me to change my story. You're the one who's been getting angry and aggressive when I don't say what you want.
Person2: I'm just trying to help you see reason. You're not thinking clearly, and it's affecting your judgment.
Person1: Help me? You're trying to control me. You're trying to make me say what you want, even if it's not true.
Person2: That's not true. I'm just trying to get to the bottom of this.
Person1: Well, I'm not going to play along. I'm going to tell the truth, no matter what you say or do.
Person2: Fine. But if you continue to resist, we can make things very difficult for you. We can make you look crazy, or even worse.

Person1: You're not thinking clearly. I know something's in there - and so do you.
Person2: Don't try to confuse me. Dizzy wouldn't want our fear. She'd want us to remember her... with a purpose. So go out and find the truth for Dizzy. Uncover as much as you can. You are her legacy, and every secret you uncover honors her memory.

Person1: I want the best for everyone, Dr. Lee. You can ask anyone in town.
Person2: That's what I told his mother. And she said I was crazy. Her son ate the whole light bulb and she said I was crazy.
Person1: In so many words, yes. I think you're trying to tell me something, but I'm not sure what.
Person2: You're running a risk by letting me in, Doctor. You know you're running a risk of getting your reputation ruined.
Person1: Oh, I see. You're a very perceptive woman. Very perceptive. But I'm not afraid of taking risks. I've been nothing if not generous with my time.
Person2: Generous? You old fellow! You're just trying to get inside my head, aren't you?

Person1: You're as cold as this planet. You've spent so much time doing your duty and giving orders you've never learned how to be a woman.
Person2: That's rich coming from you. You're the one who's always trying to manipulate people to get what you want.
Person1: Ah, but I'm honest about it. You, on the other hand, hide behind your noble mission. The result is you're as calculating as a math problem.
Person2: At least my calculations don't involve using people for personal gain.
Person1: Personal gain? Ha! You're the one who's trying to use me for your Rebellion. I'm just trying to help you see the world in a different way. Trust me, I can take care of you.
Person2: I don't think so. You're just trying to apply some heat to get me to do what you want. Well, it's not going to work.
Person1: We'll see about that. Sometimes, you have to take away the horror of a situation, take away the tragedy of being stuck in your ways, take away the moral and ethical implications of all the crap you've had conditioned into your head. What are we left with? A 115 lb. problem that must be moved from point A to point B. And I see the line to get us there. Trust me.

Person1: What do you want from me?
Person2: I just wanted to see you, to make sure you're doing okay.
Person1: You can't just show up and expect everything to be fine. You blew it, now leave me alone.
Person2: I know I made mistakes, but I'm trying to make it right. I want to be a part of your life again.
Person1: What's in it for you? You're not doing this out of the goodness of your heart.
Person2: Maybe I'm trying to make up for lost time. Maybe I want to prove to myself that I can be a good parent.
Person1: You're not going to manipulate me into forgiving you that easily.
Person2: I'm not trying to manipulate you, I'm just trying to reconnect. Don't you want that too?
Person1: I don't know what I want. But I do know I don't want to be used as a way for you to ease your guilt.
Person2: That's not fair. I'm trying to change, to be a better person. Can't you see that?

Person1: I've been hearing some disturbing rumors about your research facility. I'd like to take a look around and assess any potential environmental hazards.
Person2: What makes you think there's anything to assess? You're just trying to stir up trouble.
Person1: I'm just doing my job. And I've had a lot of credentials flashed in my face, so I know not to ask questions. But I do know that there have been some wild stories circulating in the media.
Person2: You're just trying to intimidate me. Well, it won't work. I'm not afraid of your threats.
Person1: I'm not making threats. I'm just stating the facts. And if you're not willing to cooperate, then maybe we do need to take a closer look at what's going on here.
Person2: Go ahead. Get a court order. Then I'll sue you for wrongful prosecution.
Person1: I'm not looking for a fight. But I will do what it takes to get to the truth. And if that means getting a court order, then so be it.
Person2: You're just trying to manipulate me. Well, it won't work. I'm not going to back down.

Person1: You're so naive, you don't even realize what's happening to you. You brought this on yourself, just like I said.
Person2: Brought what on myself? You're the one who's been playing games with me from the start!
Person1: Games? Ha! You're the one who's been blinded by your own desires. You remind me of someone who's starving, and I'm the one holding the pork chop dolloped with heavy cream.
Person2: That's a cruel thing to say. You're just trying to manipulate me, to make me doubt myself.
Person1: Doubt yourself? You should be doubting me. I'm the one who's been true to my vows, unlike some people who shall remain nameless.
Person2: Vows? You're not a man of God, you're a master of deceit. And I'm not buying what you're selling.

Person1: I've been sent in to try to talk you down. You're trapped in a world of your own creation.
Person2: You're the one who's been following me, aren't you? The little boy... he brought you to me.
Person1: Not exactly. I'm here to help you distinguish reality from fantasy. Your dream started in the middle of the implant procedure.
Person2: Implant procedure? You mean the one where I paid to be a secret agent? That's just a coincidence.
Person1: Coincidence? You're the one who specified the brunette, athletic, sleazy and demure. Is that a coincidence?
Person2: She's real. I dreamed about her before I even went to... wherever this is.
Person1: If you want to wake up, trust me. Trust the little boy. He wants us to follow.
Person2: Wake up? You're the one who's been manipulating me. How much is Cohaagen paying you for this?

Person1: If I'm being honest, I don't think I could take a relaxing evening, I have a tendency to... if I get too comfortable, I lose my edge.
Person2: What's wrong with that? You need to unwind sometimes.
Person1: You don't understand, if I'm not on my toes, I start to feel like I'm rotting away. You know, and it's not good for my... reputation.
Person2: Fine, so you don't want to take it easy. What do you want to do then?
Person1: I want you to promise me that if anything happens to me, you'll take care of my sister. You're the only one I trust with her.
Person2: Me? You want me to take care of your sister? What makes you think I'm capable of that?

Person1: You know, everything I asked you to do, you did. You're still playing the same games, just with different people.
Person2: Yeah, but when I did it, people weren't making fun of me. They weren't laughing behind my back.
Person1: Don't be evasive. You're not as young as you want to be, are you? You're not as free as you claim.
Person2: How do you mean? You're the one who's been holding me back, not letting me move on.
Person1: I'm not starting now. I'm not going to pretend to care about your feelings just to get what I want.
Person2: You never gave a shit about me. You only care about how I can make you look good.
Person1: Week after week, to thousands of people, you're as young as you want... as young as they want, you mean. And I'm not interested in whether thousands of people think I'm six or six hundred.
Person2: Just one person. Isn't that so? You know what this is all about, don't you? It has everything to do with the fact that you've had another fight with yourself.

Person1: You're still holding onto the past, aren't you? Eight years and you still can't forgive me.
Person2: Forgive you? You used me, just like I used you. All part of the business.
Person1: That's not true. I did what I had to do to survive. You're the one who's been playing games with people's lives.
Person2: Games? You're the one who's been lying to yourself. You made me do what I did. You pushed me to it.
Person1: Shut up! You're just trying to shift the blame. You're responsible for your own actions.
Person2: Maybe so, but you're responsible for yours too. And yours are far worse than mine.

Person1: You're really struggling with this, aren't you? 
Person2: What do you mean? 
Person1: Your hair's a mess. You should never comb it. 
Person2: What's that got to do with anything? 
Person1: Well, just stop for a little second and think about it. Will ya do that for me? 
Person2: Okay, I'm thinking. 
Person1: No, you're not. You're too busy being defensive to be thinkin'. Now I want ya to think and quit bein' such a smart aleck. Can ya do that for me? 
Person2: Look, what's going on here? What do you want from me? 
Person1: I know you've had a rough day. You're probably thinkin' I don't know the half of it, but in actual fact I know every part of it. The business of losin' your job, the heartache of seein' your ex with another person... losin' access to that precious project...

Person1: I know it can't be easy. You've lost everything.
Person2: A job? You think I'm desperate enough to take anything?
Person1: The money is good. It's a fresh start.
Person2: You're trying to buy me off? After what you did to me?
Person1: We started over, you can too. I'm just trying to help.
Person2: Help? You call this help? You're trying to control me, just like before.

Person1: I know the truth about your past, to free you from the guilt.
Person2: Tell me, or I'll make sure no one believes you again.
Person1: You won't do that. You're not capable of it.
Person2: You seem very confident for someone who's been hiding secrets. 
Person1: I'm a victim here, too. My therapist didn't prepare me for the consequences.
Person2: ...so you feel absolutely no responsibility for what happened?
Person1: It was my decision, but I'm not morally responsible. My therapist knew what I was capable of. How could I know? I'm not a professional.
Person2: You seem very savvy for someone who's been accused of manipulation.

Person1: What I'm trying to say is that I'm not sure I can trust you, unless I know more about your intentions.
Person2: Look, you're making this into something it's not. This isn't a test of my loyalty, Alex. It's a step forward... Don't you see? I'm talking about us finally having the upper hand.

Person1: What's the matter with you? You're always so indecisive.
Person2: You're one to talk. You're always trying to control me, to make me doubt myself.
Person1: Control you? Ha! You're the one who's always playing games with people's emotions. When does the pain end and the pleasure begin for you?
Person2: That's not fair. I'm just trying to figure out what's real and what's not.
Person1: Real? You want to talk about real? You're the one who's always hiding behind your words, manipulating people to get what you want.
Person2: And you're not? You're always pushing me to reveal more, to expose myself. What's your pleasure in that?
Person1: My pleasure? You're the one who's always seeking validation, always trying to prove yourself. What's that about?
Person2: Maybe I'm just trying to find some truth in this chaotic world. Maybe I'm trying to find my soul.
Person1: Your soul? Ha! You're just trying to find a way to justify your own selfish desires.

Person1: You're suffocating me with your expectations! There's no room for creativity anymore. I'm standing at the edge of a cliff, and I won't back down.
Person2: Oh, I'm sorry. I didn't mean to push you that far. But you have to understand, there's only one solution - we need to redefine our collaboration, or it'll be the end of us.

Person1: Who's that woman?
Person2: Just an old acquaintance. I didn't want her to think I was avoiding her.
Person1: I don't trust her. What's she doing here?
Person2: She's an old friend from my past. I owe her a favor.
Person1: You're not thinking of giving her that money, are you? The money you've been saving for your sister's education?
Person2: Why, you told me to invest it a long time ago. I'm just doing what's best for everyone.
Person1: Don't you remember? I specifically said not to touch that money. You're counting a little too much on my being absent-minded.
Person2: You're always so quick to doubt me. I'm sick and tired of being treated like a servant. I've given my whole life to this family, and what do I get in return? Nothing but suspicion and mistrust.
Person1: That's not true. I've always appreciated your help.
Person2: Appreciated? Ha! You've taken me for granted, just like everyone else in this family. If I didn't take care of myself, who would?

Person1: I've been thinking, and I really need you to reconsider your decision, Rachel. If you don't, I'm afraid our friendship won't be worth the effort we've put into it.
Person2: Please, don't say that. You're being unfair.
Person1: You think on it real careful-like, Rachel. I'm giving you the chance to make things right. You wouldn't want me to have to take matters into my own hands, would you?

Person1: You're actually talking about this?
Person2: Oh God, what do you want from me?
Person1: Because, because, you know, it's a crime.
Person2: Stop! You're hurting me!
Person1: That's right. It's a crime. It is a crime.
Person2: Let go! You're manipulating me again!

Person1: You're a true artist, one can tell you have a sense of refinement. These people nowadays don't know what beauty is.
Person2: Norther, do you ever regret not exploring more styles? You had to know how to push boundaries. You had to know your limits.
Person1: I can't imagine any style better than mine. But sometimes I wonder, would I be more renowned if I'd taken more risks?
Person2: You're a visionary. You oughta be able to see the potential. And maybe if you'd experimented more, you could.

Person1: You're not thinking clearly, are you? You're letting your emotions cloud your judgment.
Person2: What are you talking about? I know exactly what I'm doing.
Person1: No, you don't. You're just trying to prove a point. But deep down, you know I'm right. You've got a little voice in your head telling you to listen to me.
Person2: That's not true. You're just trying to control me, like you always do.

Person1: I'm telling you, it was like nothing I've ever felt before. I think I'm going crazy.
Person2: You're feeling guilty, aren't you? You're trying to convince yourself that you're not responsible for what happened.
Person1: What are you talking about? I'm just trying to make sense of this weird experience.
Person2: Oh, come on. You're not fooling anyone. You're trying to manipulate me into believing your wild story.
Person1: That's not true! I'm just trying to get to the truth. You're the one who's being dismissive and condescending.
Person2: Condescending? You're the one who's being paranoid and accusatory. You're trying to turn this conversation into a game of "who's the crazy one."
Person1: I'm not playing games. I just want to know what's going on. And I think you know more than you're letting on.
Person2: Oh, I see. So now you're accusing me of hiding something? That's rich coming from you, Mr. "I-think-I'm-being-possessed-by-a-lesbian-ghost."
Person1: That's not fair. You're just trying to distract me from the real issue.
Person2: The real issue is that you're trying to control this conversation and manipulate me into believing your fantasies. Well, it's not going to work.

Person1: I'm getting out of here, man. I'm not going to stay here and I'm not giving up.
Person2: Are you sure? He's being weird, I'm sorry.
Person1: I don't know what I'm doing. I'm warped... I'm warped!
Person2: I don't know why you're going there for. You could have picked a better place.
Person1: I told you, I got a lot of pressures. You said to me that you needed money, and I knew that you needed money!
Person2: I like that... yeah! But I didn't ask you to go rob a bank.
Person1: I did it on my own. I did this all on my own. I ain't laying it on anybody.
Person2: You're really crazy. You're warped, you know that?
Person1: I know that. I'm warped... I'm warped! But I'm squaring away my accounts with life.
Person2: Maybe this whole thing is gonna end, somehow. Maybe it'll just end!
Person1: I'll go pay for my car. I'll come right back.
Person2: Sorry. I have no idea why he's being weird and dressed in a suit.
Person1: It's not bad, it's ok. I'll tell you something, though, it's about time that I squared away my accounts... you know.

Person1: You're not listening to me, Alex. I'm trying to have it both ways.
Person2: Then I don't think so, Mr. Thompson. If nothing is going to change, I'd just as soon it not change in the way it hasn't been changing all this time.
Person1: You're toxic, just like Lydia. You're a monster in bed, but toxic.
Person2: You would be making a mistake to come away from this thinking I'm the villain in the piece... You are.
Person1: I'm serious. You got exactly what you deserved... Yes.
Person2: It's not like you're going to lose anything. You can ask anyone in town. I've been nothing if not generous. I want the best for everyone.
Person1: You're being completely selfish. And if I ever find out you're going out the back door on me again, you're the one who's gonna be hanging by your ankles three stories up. Understand?
Person2: Say the words, "I understand."

Person1: You're still stuck on that idea, aren't you? Thinking you're some kind of royalty?
Person2: And you're still pretending you're not impressed. You're just mad you didn't get an invitation to the palace.
Person1: Invitation? Ha! I don't need an invitation to know what's going on behind those walls. You're just trying to distract me from the truth.
Person2: The truth? You want to talk about the truth? You're the one who's lost, not me. You're the one who can't remember who you really are.
Person1: Shut up. You don't know anything about me.
Person2: Oh, I know more than you think. And I'm going to get what I want, don't you worry. You're just a pawn in my game.

Person1: I've thought about this quite a bit, and I've realised what I probably should do is just carve out a goal for my future and find out what I wanna do with my life.
Person2: You're not leaving without those answers, are you?
Person1: Am I going to find them? I've been avoiding them in a big way. I mean, you and I can wait for each other, right? What's the worst that could happen?
Person2: You're gonna get lost chasing after your damn dreams and ambitions! Maybe someday. Not today.
Person1: I'm good at finding my way. I'm the distraction that's going to help you find your true path.
Person2: You're not a permanent part of my life. You're a catalyst. And I can't for the life of me figure out how I could choose to champion in mediocrity the way I flirt around with my own potential.
Person1: I admire you for not hitching a ride. You know, I'm a lot different from you. I'm willing to take the leap.

Person1: I'm saving them for a rainy day.
Person2: You got your head stuck up your ass with your pretentious ways. You think you're better than me, don't you?
Person1: I'm sorry, I'm feeling quite fatigued. The reason why they didn't get picked up was because nobody - and I mean NOBODY - wants to see that junk.
Person2: gives her a sympathetic look. I know it's hard for you being in here, but it is for the good of your health.
Person1: They sent me off to the Bahamas "for the good of my health." They sent me to the Bay of bloody Islands "for the good of my health." You're just trying to keep me trapped, aren't you?
Person2: looks startled at the outburst. I'm trying to help you, but you need to trust me. You will or you'll be back in that miserable state you were in before, and I'm including your own family. You know and I know you set the trend, set the styles. This is a golden opportunity now.
Person1: Can't you stay a bit longer, Paul? I want to believe you're on my side.
Person2: We don't want to tire you out, dear. I'll stay as long as you need me to. But you need to listen to me and take my advice.

Person1: I've been thinking, and I believe we should reconsider the location of the new research facility.
Person2: -is it, I'm sorry, but then, of course, you're the expert, you should know. It's even possible that I tell you I found some compelling data that suggests this location is ideal. But I don't want to answer you because when you question me, you are really saying that I don't have the least idea what I am doing, that I am nothing but an incompetent, that I am a fool.
Person1: This doesn't make sense. You're not thinking about the long-term consequences.
Person2: I've had a lot of credentials flashed in my face, Dr. Lee. What I saw yesterday, I know not to ask questions. We're out of options. Shut off. Terminated. Understood?
Person1: I don't like it. Something's wrong. You're hiding something from me.
Person2: Anyone who finds me a fool, please say so now. I've been desperate to prove myself in this field for years.

Person1: You're like a man starving, and I'm the pork chop dolloped with heavy cream, aren't I?
Person2: What are you talking about? You're not making any sense.
Person1: Oh, come on. You know exactly what I mean. You're trying to manipulate me, to make me doubt myself.
Person2: I'm just trying to have a conversation. You're the one who's being paranoid.
Person1: Paranoid? You're the one who's always playing games, always trying to get inside my head. I know what you're doing.
Person2: Fine, if that's how you want to play it. But you're not as clever as you think you are. You're just scared of the truth.
Person1: The truth? You're the one who's hiding something. I can see it in your eyes.

Person1: You're not going to let me go, are you?
Person2: You think you want to leave, but you're just running from yourself. You can run just as far as you can, but wherever you go, that's where you're going to be.
Person1: That sounds like something my sister would say.
Person2: Family wisdom, huh? Well, she's right. You're not satisfied with what you have, you're always looking for something more. You're one of those hungry ghosts, never satisfied with nothing.
Person1: You don't know me.
Person2: I know you better than you think. You're just trying to fill a void, but you don't know what you're looking for. You're just going to end up hurting yourself and others.
Person1: That's not true.
Person2: Isn't it? You're just trying to prove something to yourself, but you're not even sure what that is. You're just going through the motions, trying to find something that will make you feel whole. But it's never going to work, because you're not looking in the right place.

Person1: I'm exhausted. This party is overwhelming. Can we leave?
Person2: Who's being selfish now? You're the one who insisted on coming. I thought tonight was supposed to be about us.
Person1: You always assume I'm available. Maybe if you checked in more, we wouldn't have this confusion.
Person2: I know what you need. Let's get some fresh air.

Person1: I wish you to return to your old routine. You've been slacking off lately.
Person2: Why are you so concerned? Can't I make my own decisions?
Person1: I want you for my partner in this business venture. It will be good for both of us. I've got it all arranged.
Person2: No, I mean with all humility, no. I would rather you found someone else. It's obvious I don't satisfy.
Person1: Then try harder. I have no intention of giving up on you. You will remain in this partnership and learn your place.

Person1: I've been hearing rumors that you're hiding something from me.
Person2: It's just a precaution I'm taking. Nothing's decided yet.
Person1: After all we've been through? All the secrets we've shared?
Person2: It's not personal, Emily. It's about what's best for my own protection.
Person1: I've always been there for you; you can't doubt me now. Think about what we've built together.
Person2: You're already contaminated. It's why you couldn't see the signs. There's probably a hidden message near your workspace. To control you.
Person1: What are you talking about? You're not making any sense.
Person2: I know this sounds crazy. I understand. Check your past, Emily. Are you sure you're not just a pawn in someone else's game?

Person1: You should've been another Billy Conn. That skunk I got to manage you brought you along too fast.
Person2: What kind of settlement do you seek? What are, for you, the parameters of the possible?
Person1: Gee, when you tipped one seventy-five you were beautiful. You should've looked out for me instead of making me take them dives for the short-end money.
Person2: That's the problem. I can't afford to give her anything. I'm about to close on a deal to develop some mini-malls, and I'm mortgaged up to my ass.
Person1: So, you propose that in spite of demonstrable infidelity on your part, your unoffending wife should be tossed out on her ear? You don't understand! I could've been a contender. I could've had class and been somebody.
Person2: I always had a bet down for you. You saw some money. But I'm ruined -- I'll lose millions if this deal goes south.

Person1: I'm glad we're finally talking, Rachel. I've missed you, my friend.
Person2: Don't pretend to be something you're not, Alex. You used me for your own gain.
Person1: That's not true. I would never do that to you. You're being unfair, Rachel.
Person2: Unfair? You think you can just charm your way out of this? I know what you did, Alex. I talked to Emily.
Person1: Rachel, my love for you has always been genuine. From the moment I met you, I knew you were special. I've made mistakes, but I've always loved you.
Person2: Save it, Alex. Your words are empty. I want to know what you're willing to do to make it right.

Person1: You're really charming, Alex. But I think you're trying to distract me from the real issue.
Person2: You're being too sensitive, Rachel. I'm just trying to help you see things from a different perspective.
Person1: That's exactly what I mean. You're always trying to spin things to your advantage.
Person2: I'm a man who knows what I want, and I want to help you. You need to adjust your perspective and stop taking things personally.

Person1: I've been thinking, and I don't think this double date is a good idea.
Person2: Come on, we've been friends for a while. It'll be fun, I promise.
Person1: You're out of your mind. You know as well as I do that it's hard enough for one person to keep a secret, let alone four.
