Person2: That's not what I'm worried about. I'm worried about you getting hurt again. You have a weakness for guys like Alex.
Person1: He's not like Mark, okay? He's a nice guy, and George said he's really into you.
Person2: Translation: he's a total geek. And even if he is, I don't want you to get too close. You always fall too hard, too fast.
Person1: You're just trying to control me because you're worried about being left behind.
Person2: Maybe a little. But I'm also trying to protect you from yourself. You always ignore the warning signs and then wonder why you get hurt.

Person1: I'm the one with appearances to maintain. But who gives a shit about you? Not even God.
Person2: We're strangers in the night. The last thing we want is honesty.
Person1: I'll point you in the right direction, but you'll have to take it to the end-zone. You're closer to the nitty and the gritty than I am.
Person2: Deception isn't something I personally consider sexy. What's sexy is knowing who a person is. Down deep.
Person1: You're a hit-and-run type, I figure. Not cruising the Polo Lounge. You're a lifestyle I embrace.
Person2: See, a successful person like you has limitations. You lose touch at a street level. That's why I'm letting you take care of this.
Person1: This is unprofessional. You're not even telling me your name. What's shocking about a name?
Person2: I'll take care of it. I just do it. I don't prepare it.

Person1: You're really going to marry him?...After everything I've done for you?
Person2: And don't think your sudden interest is going to change my mind!
Person1: I don't know, maybe I was wrong to assume we had something special...
Person2: What right do you have to assume anything about me? You're the one who's been playing games with my emotions...
Person1: If you're talking about that night at the party...I was just trying to make you jealous.
Person2: AND other things...Maybe you thought you were being clever, but I saw the way you were flirting with my sister...
Person1: Or what? You're going to cut me out of your life? That's an option, isn't it?
Person2: Maybe if you'd been honest with me from the start, I wouldn't have to question your motives now.

Person1: Fancy.
Person2: Unimpressive.
Person1: Unimpressive? I guess someone still has a chip on their shoulder.
Person2: Don't for one minute think that you had any effect whatsoever on my opinion.
Person1: So what did I have an effect on?
Person2: Other than my skepticism? Nothing.
Person1: Do I look like I care about your skepticism?
Person2: No.
Person1: Then let's assume I don't.

Person1: I'm telling you, I'm the real star of this operation.
Person2: And love's a funny thing. Sometimes I don't know if I want to love you... or trust you, for that matter.
Person1: What are you talking about? You're the one who's been holding me back. I'm the one who does all the real work around here.
Person2: Oh, come on. You're just mad because you're not getting the recognition you think you deserve. You're doing a great job, but let's not get ahead of ourselves. We make a good team, and that's what matters.
Person1: A good team? You're the one calling the shots, and I'm just a pawn in your game. I'm going to go get some fresh air. Anyone want to join me?

Person1: You're not exactly the genuine article, are you, Detective James?
Person2: What's that supposed to mean?
Person1: I mean, you're pretending to be some kind of hard-boiled cop, but I think you're just trying to hide your own insecurities. You're not as tough as you think you are.
Person2: That's not fair. I've worked hard to get where I am.
Person1: Oh, I'm sure you have. But you're still just a pawn in a much larger game. You don't even know what's really going on, do you?
Person2: What are you talking about?
Person1: I'm talking about the fact that you're being used. You're being manipulated by people who are smarter and more powerful than you. And you don't even realize it.
Person2: That's not true. I'm in control of my own life.
Person1: Really? Then why are you so defensive? Why are you so quick to deny what I'm saying? It's because you know I'm right, isn't it?
Person2: I don't know what you're trying to get at, but I'm not going to play along.
Person1: Oh, I think you will. I think you'll do exactly what I say, because deep down, you're scared. You're scared of being exposed, of being found out. And I'm the one who can do it.

Person1: I'm just very excited by the prospect of getting on with my life, that's all.
Person2: You're telling me you feel guilty about not standing up to your father sooner.
Person1: No... What I mean is... I wanted to let you make up your own mind about him.
Person2: Save it. If you really thought I could make my own decisions, you would've let me go out with him instead of helping Daddy hold me hostage.
Person1: That's not fair. I was trying to protect you from his influence.
Person2: Protect me? You're the one who's been playing both sides, making me doubt my own judgment.
Person1: I never meant to manipulate you. I just didn't want you to get hurt.
Person2: Too late for that. You've already done the damage.

Person1: You should be glad you're alive. But I think you know something. What you know you can't explain, but you feel it. You've felt it your whole life, felt that something is wrong with the world.
Person2: What are you talking about? This has nothing to do with me.
Person1: Oh, but it does. You see, I've been watching you, and I know you're not like the others. You have a certain... awareness. A sense that there's more to life than what's on the surface.
Person2: (pausing) How did you know that?
Person1: (smiling) Let's just say I have my ways. And I think you're ready to know the truth. Are you?
Person2: (hesitantly) I suppose so.
Person1: (leaning in) Good. Because once you know, there's no going back. And I'm not sure you're ready for that.

Person1: I'm telling you, it's a fact. You can't deny it. You're stuck in this situation, and I'm the only one who can get you out.
Person2: I don't know, man. I got a problem with being locked in. I need some freedom.
Person1: Freedom? You want to talk about freedom? You're not even thinking about the bigger picture. You're just thinking about your own selfish desires.
Person2: That's not true. I'm thinking about what's best for everyone.
Person1: Save it. You're not fooling anyone. You're just trying to get out of doing what needs to be done. Well, let me tell you something - you owe me. And if you don't start pulling your weight, you're going to be in a world of trouble.
Person2: I don't owe you anything. You're just trying to manipulate me into doing what you want.
Person1: Manipulate you? Ha! I'm just trying to make you see reason. You're the one who's being unreasonable. You're the one who's not thinking about the consequences of your actions.
Person2: I'm thinking about the consequences just fine. And I'm not going to let you bully me into doing something I don't want to do.
Person1: Fine. Have it your way. But don't come crying to me when everything falls apart.

Person1: You're really going to do this, aren't you?
Person2: This is my chance to get what I want. I've had little flashes of things, but I know I must have had something to do with this place.
Person1: You can't just come in here and take control in just one day. You're not even sure who you are.
Person2: That doesn't matter. What matters is that I find my home, my true identity. And I'll do whatever it takes to get it.
Person1: You're not thinking about the consequences. You're just thinking about yourself.
Person2: Hey! You gotta make your own way in the world! Don't be sorry for me! I'm going to get what I want, don't you worry!

Person1: You're not going to get away with this, Sami. I'm the one who took control, and that makes it mine.
Person2: Would you guys calm down for a second? This isn't about possession.
Person1: No time for calm, lady. I'll make sure you regret underestimating me if you don't hand it over fast.

Person1: You're really going to choose your career over me again?
Person2: I'm not choosing it over you, but I need this job.
Person1: So what? You'll find another one.
Person2: That's not the point. I have responsibilities.
Person1: And what about our responsibilities to each other? Where do I stand in your priorities?
Person2: You know you're important to me, but I can't just quit because you're feeling insecure.
Person1: Insecure? You're the one who's always putting your job first. If you loved me, you'd make sacrifices for me.

Person1: I'm offering you a chance to prove yourself, but you need to earn it. Show me you're willing to change and we'll discuss something better.
Person2: You want me to try harder? You, who got ahead by marrying into wealth and power? I'm not some foolish servant who'll jump at your command.
Person1: I'm disappointed in you. I thought you had more potential. But it seems you're just like the others, unwilling to take a chance.
Person2: You're one to talk about taking chances. You're the one who's been playing it safe all your life. I'm not afraid to take risks, unlike some people who hide behind their privilege.
Person1: Fine, have it your way. But know that you're missing out on an opportunity that could change your life. And don't come crying to me when you realize you've made a mistake.
Person2: I'd rather make my own mistakes than follow in your footsteps. At least then I'll know I've tried.

Person1: I think you're lying. I think you know exactly where the package is.
Person2: Who's to say I'm not telling the truth? You're just trying to intimidate me.
Person1: Intimidate you? You're the one who's been playing us from the start. I know you're in deep with Victor.
Person2: Victor? You mean the guy who used to work for me? He's just a small-time crook trying to make a name for himself.
Person1: Save it. I've seen the way you operate. You're always looking for an angle, a way to get ahead. And if that means throwing someone under the bus, you won't hesitate.
Person2: You know, you're right. I do what it takes to survive. But you're not as clean as you think you are either. You're just as guilty of playing the game as I am.
Person1: That's not the point. The point is, I know you're hiding something. And I'll do whatever it takes to find out what that is.
Person2: Whatever it takes? You mean like threatening me? Because that's not going to work. I've been in tighter spots than this before.
Person1: We'll see about that.

Person1: You're a master of playing with my emotions, aren't you? You know exactly what to say to make me feel like I'm the one who's crazy.
Person2: Ah, come on. You know you love the thrill of our little games. You're a masochistic pain freak, and I'm just the one who brings it out in you.
Person1: That's not true. You're just trying to manipulate me into staying in this toxic relationship. But I'm not buying it. I deserve better than to be constantly torn between love and hatred for you.
Person2: Oh, poor baby. You think you deserve better? You're the one who married me, despite knowing my "bad qualities" and "violence". You knew exactly what you were getting yourself into. And yet, here you are, still clinging to the hope that I'll change.
Person1: That's not fair. You're twisting my words and using them against me. You always do this, making me doubt my own feelings and sanity.
Person2: Maybe that's because you're so easily swayed. Maybe that's why you need someone like me to keep you in line. And maybe, just maybe, you secretly love the way I make you feel.

Person1: You're a brilliant artist, Rachel. You have a gift.
Person2: You don't know anything about art. You're just trying to flatter me.
Person1: I do know I believe in you. And I think you're scared to believe in yourself.

Person1: You're not even trying to hide it, are you? You're just giving up on your life.
Person2: And you're one to talk? You're the one who's been holding me back all these years. I could've been so much more if it wasn't for you.
Person1: Oh, spare me the drama. You want something, Harry? You're going to have to do better than that.
Person2: I want what's rightfully mine. And I'll stop at nothing to get it. You know I have the power to ruin your reputation, don't you?
Person1: You think you're the first person to try to blackmail me? I've seen it all before, kid. You're not even a challenge.

Person1: I've been thinking, and I believe we should reassess our approach to the project. There are too many potential pitfalls.
Person2: I appreciate your input, but I've made up my mind. You're not going to change it.
Person1: I understand that, but I feel it's my duty to voice my concerns. Don't you think it's crucial to evaluate all angles before diving in?
Person2: You're very perceptive, aren't you? I think you're trying to get inside my head, to understand what makes me tick. Well, let me tell you, it's not going to work.
Person1: I'm not trying to manipulate you, I just want to make sure we're making the right decision.
Person2: Save it, Lila. I know exactly what you're doing. You're trying to make me doubt myself, to question my own judgment. But it won't work. I'm not that easily swayed.
Person1: I'm just trying to have an open and honest conversation. Why are you being so defensive?
Person2: Because I know your game, Lila. You're trying to get me to reveal something, to let my guard down. But I'm not going to fall for it. I'm not some naive little girl who can be easily manipulated.
Person1: I'm not trying to manipulate you, I'm just trying to have a conversation. But if you're not willing to listen, then maybe we shouldn't be working together.
Person2: Oh, I'm willing to listen, Lila. I'm just not willing to be played.

Person1: Professor!
Person2: You're drunk. You know, it's been a long time and I'd love to catch up, but I really got to -
Person1: Please, listen! I don't know anywhere else to go! I need your expertise!
Person2: Just what did you get yourself into, Alex?
Person2: It's...it's a complex problem. Can we meet in your office?
Person1: Jesus, man... You're really in a mess this time.
Person2: Please, Professor... I'm desperate.

Person1: I've been thinking about our project, and I really believe we're onto something big. We can make some real headlines with this.
Person2: I don't know, man. I'm getting a little stressed about the whole thing. What if someone finds out?
Person1: Relax, I've got it all under control. You don't have to come in tomorrow to work on the floor. It's really late, and we can keep this whole thing quiet, low key, no profile.
Person2: You're not listening to me. I'm saying we need to choose what we want to do, and this might not be the right choice.

Person1: I don't meet the other investors.  Aren't you going to review the proposal?
Person2: Where is the startup located?
Person1: That's confidential.  Could you sign the NDA on the table?
Person2: I like to talk to the person who runs the fund.  Can you give me a contact number?
Person1: Look.  Do we have a problem here? There's no reason to have a problem. I'm going to make you a lot of money.  You won't miss that other opportunity.  Now why don't you commit to the deal?
Person2: You will re-assume control of the project.  In two hours, a group of my experts will arrive at the office.  You will tell the team that they are a consulting firm.

Person1: I'm telling you, I'm not going to that party. I hate being the center of attention.
Person2: Oh, come on, Rachel. You're being ridiculous. The camera loves you, and everyone wants to see you there. Besides, 40% of the attendees are going to be industry professionals. You can't pass up that kind of networking opportunity.

Person1: You think I didn't need you?
Person2: You used me, just like I used you. All part of the business.
Person1: That's not true. I needed you more than you'll ever know.
Person2: Don't try to make me feel guilty. You went out of your way to prove you didn't need me. Now, suddenly, for one night, you need me again.
Person1: You're not listening to me. I'm trying to apologize.
Person2: I'm not buying it. You're just trying to manipulate me into doing what you want.
Person1: Maybe I was wrong in the past, but I'm trying to make it right.
Person2: Save it. I know what will happen. In a few weeks, you'll be back on top, and you'll shut me out just as soon as you don't need me again.

Person1: You're not in a position to question me, or give advice, or whatever your naive sense of morality tells you to do. You're just a pawn.
Person2: It's just business. You should be glad you're still in the game.
Person1: Now that things are getting messy, you're getting cold feet? You're not here to make friends or have a conscience. You're here to get the job done.
Person2: How many times have you done this? I'm curious. How many people have you used and thrown away?
Person1: What's it to you? You're just trying to distract me from the real issue. You're trying to make me doubt myself.
Person2: Maybe I am. Maybe I'm trying to make you see that you're not as invincible as you think you are.

Person1: You're not gonna back down, are you? Nobody wants to lose face.
Person2: That's a fact. Least of all you, with your reputation on the line.
Person1: Just remember, I'm doing this for your own good. You're not thinking clearly.
Person2: And you are? You're the one who's been playing both sides against each other.
Person1: I'm just trying to guide you towards the right decision. You're not seeing the bigger picture.
Person2: Guide me? You're trying to manipulate me into doing what you want.
Person1: That's not true. I'm just trying to help you avoid making a mistake. You're not thinking about the consequences.
Person2: I'm thinking about the consequences of trusting you.

Person1: You're still young enough to have fun, but "Emily" will go in knowing that the next time she gets out it'll be to attend her own funeral. Depressing.
Person2: Someday you'll have a daughter just like you, a girl who lies through her teeth and buys demonic records. If I'm anything like you, I'll deserve her.
Person1: You wouldn't risk the dime to call the police. You have no proof. But I'll pray like I've never prayed before. God willed me to find those tickets because He wanted to hear from you.
Person2: You go back, you won't be alone. You'll have a diabetic barkeep cellmate. But I'm sorry, I truly am.

Person1: I've been thinking, you're always so busy with work, but you never miss a chance to attend her art exhibitions.
Person2: What's your point?
Person1: You know how I feel about her. I just hope you don't consider her a close friend.
Person2: You're talking crap, I'm not a bloody teenager okay, I can make my own decisions.
Person1: Oh, so now you're defending her? That's rich coming from you.

Person1: I'm not going to let you go back to work today. It's too beautiful outside.
Person2: I have a meeting I can't miss. You know how important this project is.
Person1: You're always working. When do you take time for yourself? For us?
Person2: You're not going to guilt trip me into staying, are you? I have responsibilities.
Person1: I'm not trying to guilt trip you. I just want to spend some quality time together. You look very good in the sun...
Person2: You're not going to leave me, are you? You love me too much. You don't want to see me fail.

Person1: You're not even trying to remember, are you? Don't you recall what we promised to each other? Honesty - trust!
Person2: (long pause) You know, I think you're just tired. You've been working non-stop for weeks. Maybe you should take a break and get some rest.
Person1: That's not it, and you know it. You're trying to avoid the truth. Time has a way of revealing secrets, and I think it's time you faced yours.
Person2: (smirking) Oh, I'm shaking in my boots. Prove it, then. If you're so sure, show me the evidence.

Person1: You're really going to wear that to the party? I thought I told you to dress nicely.
Person2: Oh, come on, baby, I designed this outfit for you. It's a work of art.
Person1: A work of art? You call that a work of art? I call it a mess. What will my friends think?
Person2: They'll think you're bold and daring, just like me. Trust me, I know what I'm doing.

Person1: I'm telling you, we need to reassess our strategy. This approach is flawed.
Person2: You think you're so smart, don't you? You think you have a beat on things. But trust me, you don't even have an inkling of a hint of a clue as to what's really going on here. And if you want to find out, you'll shut up and listen to me. Because I'm not interested in babysitting another novice who thinks they know it all. So, either you're with me, or you're against me. The choice is yours.

Person1: You're really going to let this opportunity slip away? Are you crazy, lazy, or just scared?
Person2: I don't know, man. I'll grab a drink with you anytime, but this is different. This is a chance to make a real difference in this town.
Person1: Exactly! And I need someone with your skills to make it happen. Don't let fear hold you back. You'll be gone in another year, and what will you have to show for it? A bunch of half-remembered songs and a string of failed relationships?
Person2: Alright, alright. You've made your point. But if we get caught, I'm blaming you.

Person1: You want to leave?
Person2: I don't know. Maybe it's for the best.
Person1: You're not thinking about what's best for you, are you? You're thinking about what's best for everyone else.
Person2: What's wrong with that?
Person1: Because you're not considering your own feelings. You're just trying to avoid conflict.
Person2: Maybe I'm just trying to keep the peace.
Person1: By sacrificing your own happiness? I don't think that's a good trade-off. Stay a week, help me get things ready. If you're still unhappy, I'll help you find a way out.
Person2: You're not going to give up on me, are you?
Person1: I'm not going to let you give up on yourself.

Person1: I'm telling you, it's a great idea, but the execution is off.
Person2: You're just saying that because you're jealous. You're one of those people who can't stand to see others succeed.
Person1: That's not fair. I'm trying to help. The sign says "Fresh Brewed Coffee" but it's clearly not brewed fresh.
Person2: You're just trying to find fault with everything I do. You're like a leech, always sucking the life out of people's dreams.
Person1: I'm not trying to be negative. I just think it's important to get the details right.
Person2: You know, I think you're just afraid of change. You're comfortable with the status quo, even if it's mediocre.
Person1: That's not true. I'm just trying to have a conversation.
Person2: Save it. I know exactly what you're doing. You're trying to make me doubt myself, to make me think I'm not good enough. Well, it's not going to work.

Person1: I know you're struggling with the moral implications, but sometimes we must make difficult choices to protect the greater good.
Person2: You're asking me to sacrifice my own sister to take down a corrupt official? That's not a difficult choice, it's a cruel one.
Person1: I'm not asking you to do it for me, I'm asking you to do it for the countless lives that will be ruined if we don't act. You may only get one shot at a man like him.
Person2: And what about my sister's life? Doesn't she deserve to be treated with respect and dignity?
Person1: Respect and dignity are luxuries we can't afford right now. What we need is to be in awe of the power that drives us to make tough decisions. Now, are you with me or not?

Person1: I'm not sure I understand why you're so invested in this cause.
Person2: I want to give them a roof, some food, and a bit of human warmth. It's the least I can do.
Person1: Is that all you're going to devote your life to? You're selling yourself short.
Person2: I'm sorry, I think I've had enough of this conversation. I want to go home.
Person1: Oh, come on, I was just kidding. Don't be so sensitive.
Person2: No, I mean it. I really need to get out of here.

Person1: I've been watching you, and I think I've figured out your secret, Leon.
Person2: Oh? And what might that be, my curious friend?
Person1: You're not who you say you are. You're a fabrication, a creation of someone's imagination.
Person2: (laughs) That's a clever observation. But what makes you think that?
Person1: The way you move, the way you speak... it's all too perfect. You're a puppet on strings, and I want to know who's pulling them.
Person2: (smirks) Perhaps I'm just a very skilled actor. Or maybe I'm just a product of your own imagination.
Person1: No, I'm not that clever. But I do know that you're not what you seem. And I'm going to find out who's behind you.
Person2: (leaning in) Ah, but what if I'm not just a creation? What if I'm the one pulling the strings?
Person1: (pauses, taken aback) What do you mean?
Person2: (smiling) Maybe I'm the one who's been manipulating you all along. Maybe you're just a pawn in my game.
Person1: (nervously) That's not possible. I'm the one who's been watching you.
Person2: (leaning back) Ah, but have you been watching yourself?

Person1: You're not going to get away with this.
Person2: Hold on, Rachel, it's not as bad as it sounds. I didn't know he was going to --
Person1: Lie to me? You thought you could spy on me and trick me into trusting you?
Person2: No, I just thought if I could get close to you, I could --
Person1: Protect me? You're going to die, and he's not. Got it.

Person1: I've got a feeling we're onto something big here. I can smell it. We're going to make some headlines with this one.
Person2: You know what I'd like? A clear, empty mind... and a chance to start over, without the weight of our past mistakes. And the courage to take it.
Person1: Relax, we're going to keep this whole thing nice and quiet, low key, no profile. You want to cut this off, go out and find yourself someone available.
Person2: I'm thinking of it. But don't think you can manipulate me into staying. I'm not afraid to walk away.
Person1: Hey, we can leave together, can't we? We can start fresh, together.
Person2: I'm late... and you have to face the reality of our situation.

Person1: You're completely p-whipped.
Person2: What's wrong with you? Why are you acting this way?
Person1: Oh, so now you're defending them? You're saying I have to take that stupid art class again?
Person2: I'm not defending anyone. I just think you're overreacting.
Person1: Overreacting? You loser. You don't know what it's like to have your whole summer ruined.

Person1: I'm really upset about what happened at the party last night.
Person2: Then why are you sitting here with a smile on your face?
Person1: I wish you'd stop making me feel like I'm overreacting all the time.
Person2: Maybe if you weren't so sensitive, there wouldn't be an issue.
Person1: You always do this, making me doubt my own feelings.
Person2: Look, I thought we understood each other, but I guess I was wrong.

Person1: I've heard so many unflattering tales about your work ethic, and I understand that except for you, this team is quite productive.
Person2: That's not what I said. You're twisting my words.
Person1: Oh, but you must not mind my talking about you! In fact, I think my main job here is to help you realize that maybe you can't change your work habits, ever... Which we already knew...
Person2: You're trying to make me feel like I'm the problem, but I know what you're doing. You're trying to civilize me, to make an honest team player out of me. But I'm not buying it.
Person1: Well, maybe people would be happier if they'd accept that some things don't change. It'd be some kind of relief, don't you think?
Person2: You're just trying to get inside my head, to make me doubt myself. But I'm not going to fall for it.

Person1: You're in a precarious situation. You realize that?
Person2: I haven't broken any laws.
Person1: Oh, but you have, Sir. You lied to us, that could be obstruction of justice. A man's been killed in part 'cause of your silence.
Person2: The reason I lied is if I'd told you the truth, you'd just hunt it down and kill it, which seems to be exactly what you're doing.
Person1: You're high as a kite, aren't you? You think you're above the law.
Person2: You're a butcher, a clown who kills. Evolution has made you a relic of the past.
Person1: I love you! Have a cigar! But I think you're trying to manipulate me, to make me doubt myself.
Person2: You're not such a creature of instinct that you'd hurt an unarmed man. Or are you?
Person1: This is going to become very physical. Are you prepared for that?
Person2: I've poisoned your mind with doubt. Even now, that poison is seeping into every lobe of your mind, telling you that you're obsolete, a clown.
Person1: You're trying to get inside my head, to make me question my own identity.
Person2: You have a very good mind, or I wouldn't have come back. That mind is now asking itself, "Is Person1 really a force for good?" And the answer is, "No."
Person1: Something is happening in there. I'm starting to doubt myself.
Person2: You can never take yourself seriously again! Look at all the harm you've caused! Did you shoot them on the elevator, as they were on their way up here to eat us alive?
Person1: No. I see what you're doing. You're trying to break me, to make me surrender.
Person2: You aren't going to hurt me. You aren't going to hurt anybody anymore. Any violent gesture will seem ridiculousto yourself!

Person1: You're supposed to be at the meeting, not slacking off here!
Person2: Scare me, why don't you?!!? You think you're my boss or something?
Person1: I'm just saying, you're not getting any younger. You need to start taking responsibility.
Person2: Oh, I see. So now you're a trainer, and I'm out of shape?
Person1: Well, you're not exactly a go-getter, are you? I mean, I've seen more ambition in a sloth.
Person2: That's it, I've had enough of your condescending attitude! You're just mad because I'm not buying into your crap.
Person1: Oh, I'm shaking in my boots. You think you're intimidating, but really, you're just a joke.
Person2: We'll see who's laughing when I'm done with you.

Person1: I'm telling you, we need to rethink our strategy. We've been here for months and we're still behind schedule.
Person2: I understand your concerns, but bringing in outsiders will only create more problems. We can't afford to lose control of this project.
Person1: I'm willing to do whatever it takes to get this done on time. I've got my reputation on the line, and I won't let it slip away.
Person2: You're not thinking about the bigger picture. If we sacrifice our integrity for the sake of speed, what will be left of us when this is all over?
Person1: Integrity is a luxury we can't afford right now. I'll do whatever it takes to get ahead, even if it means making a deal with someone like Redbeard.
Person2: You're playing with fire, and you're going to get burned. Mark my words, you'll regret the day you ever crossed paths with him.

Person1: You're being paranoid, Alex. I'm just trying to help.
Person2: Help? You call that help? You're just trying to get inside my head, like you always do.
Person1: Oh, come on. I'm just trying to make you see sense. You're being left-handed about this whole situation.
Person2: What's that supposed to mean? You think you can just twist my words and make me doubt myself?
Person1: I'm just trying to make you understand that you're not thinking clearly. You're letting your emotions cloud your judgment.
Person2: And you're not trying to manipulate me? You're not trying to make me do what you want me to do?
Person1: Of course not. I just want what's best for you. But if you won't listen to reason, then maybe I'll have to take a more...unconventional approach.
Person2: You're threatening me? That's low, even for you.

Person1: You don't have any more vacations to sell, on Anthrax Island. Why did you run away from that ranch?
Person2: Every time we talk, it ends up in an argument.
Person1: No, precisely. We begin by coveting what we see every day. Don't you feel eyes moving over your body?
Person2: I know. You always challenge my opinions, but I still care about you.
Person1: It's your turn to tell me. You don't have any more excuses. Why did you really leave that place?
Person2: I believe it's our differences that make our relationship richer. We just need to learn how to navigate them.
Person1: We don't reckon time the same way, Clarice. This is all the time you'll ever have. Now, tell me the truth.
Person2: You might be right. I'm willing to try if you are. But first, answer me this: don't your eyes move over the things you want?

Person1: You're not thinking of testifying against me, are you?
Person2: What's on your mind? Don't --
Person1: It wouldn't make a pleasant evening, if that's what you're after. I don't want to talk about it.
Person2: You think I'm unfaithful? Is that what you're trying to say?
Person1: Absolutely nothing. You do nothing and you say nothing. You understand, don't you, kid?
Person2: What kind of faithfulness are you after? We're not living in the real world here.
Person1: The point is there isn't much time, kid. You're walking on your heels, and Cousin Johnny isn't going to jeopardize a setup like that for one rubber-lipped ex-anything.
Person2: I could have been better! I don't know, I don't know! I tell you I ain't made up my mind yet.
Person1: Your unfaithfulness -- that's what I'm trying to talk about. Your betrayal. Your dalliance. And you won't do me the dignity of being up front about it.
Person2: Am I unfaithful? That's what you're trying to say?

Person1: Alright, listen up! I've got a plan, and I need you to trust me.
Person2: What is it?
Person1: Shhh, just hear me out. We'll sneak into the concert tonight, and I'll get us backstage.
Person2: Are you serious? That's impossible.
Person1: I've got connections, don't worry about it. You just need to follow my lead.
Person2: I don't know...
Person1: Come on, it'll be a privilege! You won't want to miss this. I swear on your life it'll be worth it.
Person2: Okay, fine. But if we get caught...
Person1: We won't get caught. I've got everything under control. Just remember, this is a secret, so keep it down.

Person1: You're crazy, thinking you can outsmart me. Just open the safe, Rachel. 
Person2: We never should have trusted you with the combination. What are we gonna do about it now?

Person1: You're lying to me, aren't you?
Person2: I don't remember. 
Person1: Don't play dumb with me. You know exactly what I'm talking about.
Person2: It was dead, wasn't it?
Person1: What are you talking about? You're changing the subject.
Person2: You're the one who's trying to confuse me. You know goddamn well who I am.
Person1: I don't know you. You're just a stranger who's been following me.
Person2: You're out of your mind. I'm not gonna stand around here getting interrogated by you.
Person1: Well, leave then. Go back to wherever you came from.
Person2: You son-of-a-bitch. Who do you think you are? I'm the one who's been taking care of you.

Person1: You looked just like your brother... The first time I saw you at the casino....
Person2: What's that supposed to mean?
Person1: It's a game, really. You seem to be familiar with the high-stakes world. Here's how we play. I ask you a question. You get it right, you walk out of here with a fortune. You answer wrong, you'll be leaving with nothing.
Person2: I don't want to play your game. I'm tired of being manipulated.
Person1: Maybe so, but right now, we play. First question, You're counting on yourself, What's the name of the casino owner's daughter in the latest scandal?

Person1: You're enjoying this too much. I think it was my tone of voice more than anything else that sold you.
Person2: He seems to think he's entitled to it all. Not all. They already have a third. The question is how much of that are they willing to give to get you back?
Person1: I'm not trying to lose them. Nor am I exceeding any speed limits. But there's no doubt, Alex, that we have to face some serious things.
Person2: You won't shoot me. That's not your style. I failed you, Alex. Will you forgive me? Have I lost you?
Person1: We might hit a bump and the gun might go off. Ever see that Tarantino movie -- where Travolta blew that guy away in the back seat -- purely by accident? You walked out, and there I was...solo...and not too good at that.
Person2: Do you have to point that? I knew you were a loser the first night I laid eyes on you. I was there for OUR sake, too.
Person1: Absolutely. And Topanga Canyon has a hell of a lot of potholes if I recall. By the way, I think your brother was completely responsible for the smears...

Person1: You owe me, Alex. Think of all the times I've covered for you!
Person2: I don't know what you're talking about. You're just trying to guilt trip me.
Person1: Oh, come on. I've done you favors, and now it's time to return them. I need you to introduce me to some of your business contacts.
Person2: Fine, but only because I feel sorry for you. You know, Rachel, I wouldn't do this for anyone but you...

Person1: You're not taking this seriously, are you?
Person2: Do you know how easy it would be for me to make you disappear? I want you to get off your backside and help me with this heist.
Person1: I don't know, man. This is a big risk.
Person2: Forget the risk. Just do it. Like I always say, "Desperate times call for desperate measures." And I'm desperate.
Person1: But what about the consequences?
Person2: I'll take care of the consequences. You just focus on getting me what I need. And by the way, can I borrow your credit card?
Person1: Why do you need my credit card?
Person2: I need it for an emergency. And this is an emergency.

Person1: You know I hate it when you make plans without consulting me.
Person2: I thought you'd love the concert tickets I got us. It's your favorite band.
Person1: You should have known how I would feel. Now I have to cancel my own plans.
Person2: I genuinely thought I was doing something nice. You're being really unfair.
Person1: Unfair? You're the one who's always doing this. Can't you find somebody else to go with?
Person2: It's too late to change plans now. You'll have to make an exception just this once.

Person1: You're just doing your job, I guess.
Person2: You're doing this to spite me, aren't you!
Person1: Well, maybe you deserve it. Maybe you should've come in to face me man to man.
Person2: I'm sick, and I don't have time for your games.
Person1: Well, it's done now -- what's the use of grousing about it. Forget it, I just had to blow off some steam...
Person2: You're not burying me, not yet. I still have a say in this.

Person1: You deserve a life of luxury. I'll give you what you've always dreamed of.
Person2: Don't make promises you can't keep. If I trust you, what then? I can't bear the thought of being disappointed again.
Person1: It's not just about material wealth. I'll show you the world, beauty. You'll be the envy of all.
Person2: (sighs) You're tempting, but I've heard it all before.

Person1: You're really going to fall for that? Don't you think it's a bit ridiculous?
Person2: What's ridiculous is you not being able to see through the facade. You want to tell me what, if any, real thoughts you had lately?
Person1: You're one to talk. You're just trying to build a case against me, aren't you?
Person2: I'm trying to open your eyes, but you're too blinded by your own biases. You should read a book, educate yourself.

Person1: I'm not sure I'm comfortable with this arrangement. It's a lot to take on.
Person2: Ah, come on. You've been stuck in a rut lately. This is exactly what you need to shake things up. Live a little.
Person1: You really think so?
Person2: Of course I do. And I'll tell you what, I'll even offer to take a few of the responsibilities off your plate. How about I take three of them?
Person1: Hmm, I don't know...I was thinking more like two.
Person2: Two? You're not going to let a little fear hold you back, are you? I'll meet you in the middle. Two and a half.
Person1: Okay, deal.

Person1: You're not listening to me, Mom. I need some space.
Person2: Don't lose control, sweetie. You're just stressed out.
Person1: Stressed out?! You have no idea what I'm going through. You're always so caught up in your own world.
Person2: That's not fair, honey. I'm trying to help you. You know I had to work hard for everything I got. I didn't have it easy like you do.
Person1: Easy?! You think my life is easy?! You're always comparing me to you and your siblings. Can't you just see things from my perspective for once?
Person2: I'm trying to, sweetie. But you need to learn discipline and responsibility. You can't just do whatever you want whenever you want.
Person1: Discipline?! You're one to talk. You're always spoiling me and getting me out of trouble. That's not discipline, that's enabling.

Person1: We're doing this for the greater good.
Person2: You're asking me to betray my own brother. What you're asking is impossible!
Person1: I offer you the perfect solution. A way to clear your name without any loss of life, even without treason.
Person2: You said you'd do anything to protect him, so do it.
Person1: But I was killing men when I was fifteen. I like getting shot at. I like riding out of town with a posse at my back.
Person2: Maybe it started out that way. But now, I'm not so sure. Is this really a better life than the one you could have had with your family?
Person1: You're just trying to distract me. We'll be back soon. Be ready.
Person2: I can't quit and leave you alone. I can't quit until you quit.

Person1: I don't mean to be a prick, but I'm telling you, don't you ever question my expertise in front of the team.
Person2: Anybody in this department ever worked a high-stakes project? You're the expert. I need guidance.
Person1: How about I put Rachel on it? She's been itching for a challenge.
Person2: That's always your privilege, sir. But I think you're just trying to avoid working with me.

Person1: I need your help to get to the truth.
Person2: I can deliver the information, but you have to trust me first.
Person1: What's the big deal about trust?
Person2: I have a lot to protect, and I need to know you're on my side.
Person1: Bullshit. You're just trying to manipulate me.
Person2: Maybe, but it's the only way you're going to get what you want.
Person1: I'm more interested in what you're hiding, not what you're saying.
Person2: Go on to the next question.
Person1: That's enough! You will answer my questions... or face the consequences!

Person1: I sense you're having difficulty understanding the situation you're presently in.
Person2: You're playing with my mind! I knew it - you're trying to seduce me!
Person1: Of course I'm trying to seduce you, for God's sake. And I'm doing a damn poor job of it, aren't I?
Person2: You're exotic and mysterious, but I'm not buying it. You're just trying to reduce me to gelatin to get what you want.
Person1: Ah, but that's where you're wrong. I'm willing to do whatever it takes to get what I want, even if it means building an entire city of nanobots to do my bidding.
Person2: I swear to you, if you don't stop this manipulation, I'll never trust anyone again.

Person1: You're too smart for me to want to do that to you, Dr. Lee. I'm not going to let you create a monster.
Person2: But think of the breakthroughs we could make! We could change the course of human history.
Person1: At what cost? You're playing God, and I won't be a part of it.
Person2: You're one to talk, aren't you? You've made a career out of manipulating people's perceptions. I'm just trying to take it to the next level.
Person1: That's different. I'm not creating life or death on a whim. You're talking about unleashing a power that could destroy us all.
Person2: Or save us. You're just afraid of being replaced.
Person1: I'm afraid of what you're capable of. And I'm not going to let you do it.

Person1: I've been thinking of quitting my job to travel the world. I've saved up enough money and I'm tired of the daily grind.
Person2: You're afraid of the competition out there, aren't you? You think you can't hack it in the real world.
Person1: That's not it at all. I just want to experience new things and challenge myself in different ways.
Person2: Well, when you realize you're in over your head, you know where to find me. I'll be here, living a stable and secure life.
Person1: I appreciate your concern, but I need to do this for myself. It's important to me.

Person1: I thought you said "the deal is off".
Person2: No, I didn't. You must have misheard.
Person1: Don't play dumb with me. I know what I heard. You're trying to back out, aren't you?
Person2: Osborne, spare me the accusations. You're just trying to get inside my head, to make me doubt myself. But it won't work. I know what I said, and I know what I meant.

Person1: You promised me a future together, but all you do is use me for your own gain.
Person2: That's not true. I care about you deeply.
Person1: You care about me? You've been lying to me, gathering information for your own benefit. You're a master manipulator, aren't you?
Person2: I'm just trying to protect you from the truth. You're not ready to hear it.
Person1: Protect me? You're the one who's been playing me all along. I thought I loved you, but now I realize I was just a pawn in your game.

Person1: You're not thinking clearly, are you? This discovery could change everything.
Person2: Yeah, a discovery that's supposed to have been buried for centuries. You don't think that's just a little suspicious?
Person1: Sometimes you have to tell a small lie to get to the bigger truth. And as for the consequences, I know people who can handle them.

Person1: You're playing with fire, Victor. I know what you did to Alex.
Person2: That's none of your concern, Rachel. You're just jealous of my success.
Person1: Jealous? You're the one who's going to get burned. I've already spoken to HR about your little "favour".
Person2: You think you're clever, don't you? But you have no idea what I'm capable of. I'll make sure you're the one who ends up in trouble.

Person1: You're telling me you can't afford the repair?
Person2: I'm telling you I got robbed on my way here. I don't have the money.
Person1: That's not my problem. You want the car fixed, it's going to cost you.
Person2: You're not listening to me. I don't have the money. You're going to have to work with me here.
Person1: Work with you? You're the one who thinks that car's so special. What did you expect, a discount?
Person2: It's not about the car, it's about being fair. You're taking advantage of me.
Person1: I'm taking advantage of you? You're the one who got robbed, not me. You're just trying to get out of paying.
Person2: That's not true! You're just trying to get more money out of me.
Person1: I'm just trying to run a business. You're the one who's not being honest with me.

Person1: You're playing with fire, Alex. How long do you think you can keep this up? A month? A week? What happens when you're exposed?
Person2: I'm sorry, it's just why can't we take risks? You're not my mother, Rachel.
Person1: Surprise me gently with a chainsaw. Do I look like I care about your feelings? If I did, I probably wouldn't mind taking a chance on you. But you're going to get burned, Alex, and I won't be there to pick up the pieces.
Person2: Shut up! You don't know anything about me!

Person1: You're not going to wear that to the party, are you?
Person2: What's wrong with it?
Person1: It's just so... loud. You know I have a certain image to maintain.
Person2: And I'm supposed to fit into that image, right? Like the Sting record you bought for me?
Person1: What's that supposed to mean?
Person2: It means you're trying to turn me into you again. You're trying to control how I present myself to the world.
Person1: That's not true. I just want what's best for you.
Person2: Save it. I know you warned the English to go back home, but they didn't listen. And now you're trying to warn me about this outfit, but I'm not listening either.
Person1: What are you talking about? This has nothing to do with the English.
Person2: It has everything to do with you trying to manipulate me. You're holding up your sword, waving it around, and expecting me to fall in line.
Person1: That's not fair. I'm just trying to help.
Person2: Help? You call this help? You're trying to kill my individuality, and that's not something I'm willing to die for.

Person1: I think you're a louse.
Person2: God, I don't know who's weirder, you or me.
Person1: What do you want from me? You deliberately came here to provoke me.
Person2: You just gonna leave them? There's plenty of other girls.
Person1: What are you talking about? I don't know what you're insinuating.
Person2: You can't leave them to do the same to other girls. You should get rid of them.
Person1: Get rid of who? You're not making any sense.
Person2: Sport and that old bastard. They're using you, and you're too blind to see it.
Person1: How dare you! You're just trying to manipulate me into doing your bidding.
Person2: I'm trying to open your eyes. You're being played, and you don't even know it.
Person1: I don't believe you. You're just trying to get a rise out of me.
Person2: Fine. Don't believe me. But mark my words, you'll come crawling back when you realize I was right.
Person1: I doubt that. Good day.

Person1: I don't remember what I said to Mark about the promotion. What did I owe him?
Person2: You didn't owe him anything. You were just discussing your qualifications.
Person1: So you're saying I'm not qualified for the promotion?
Person2: That's not what I said. I was just clarifying the team dynamics.

Person1: I'm not used to it, I'm not ready for it... You know... I have never been so upset in my life. 
Person2: You're a messed up and an outcast. There isn't one single person in your life you haven't hurt through your love. You understand that? 
Person1: Oh, please... How can I make it clear to you? Why did you come? 
Person2: I'm the most dangerous person in the world, because if I love you, watch out, you're gonna get messed up, hurt, and left behind! 
Person1: But sooner or later we've got to end this relationship. And it's better to do it right now. 
Person2: No! You shoulda done what he did. Go home. Don't talk to the FBI anymore. 
Person1: I think the only way to help ourselves is for us to be together. 
Person2: I have no desire to sacrifice myself... It's idiotic to sacrifice oneself... Why?... For whom? 
Person1: Move over there. Let's make believe nothing happened. And when we get to the next station, get off. 
Person2: I'm sorry. I didn't want to sound cynical. But isn't it better to look things squarely in the eye?

Person1: You're not going to get away with this. Where is she?
Person2: She's safe. Isn't that enough?
Person1: No. You just want control -- and you haven't any right to it. You're using her for your own gain.
Person2: That's not true. I'm doing this for her own good.
Person1: You're lying. You've been manipulating her for years. I've got to see her. Where is she?
Person2: I won't have you interfering in her life anymore. You'll only bring her harm.

Person1: You're not protecting the world, you're obstructing progress!
Person2: You heartless jerk. You're giving me a gift, absolute power and knowledge.
Person1: What's that supposed to mean? You think I'm just going to accept this?
Person2: Just giving credit where credit is due. I did everything for you, to give you this opportunity.
Person1: You have no one to blame but yourself. You're the one who's been lying to me all along.
Person2: Blame the victim. You're the one who's been too blind to see the truth.
Person1: Victim my ass! You're the one who's been manipulating me, using me for your own gain.
Person2: I'm giving you a chance to see the bigger picture. Don't you see the opportunity that lies before you?
Person1: You're not giving me anything. You're taking away my freedom, my autonomy.
Person2: You're just afraid of change. You're afraid of what you don't understand.
Person1: I understand perfectly. You're trying to control me, to use me for your own purposes.
Person2: I'm trying to help you. I'm trying to show you the way.

Person1: I've been thinking about our deal, and I want to make it clear: I get half of whatever we take from the warehouse, no matter what you promised the others.
Person2: Let's discuss this outside, where it's not so... suffocating.
Person1: What's wrong with in here? It's comfortable.
Person2: Comfortable? You call this comfortable? This is a trap, a setup. I need some fresh air to think straight.
Person1: Fine, let's go outside. But I'm warning you, I've already made up my mind.
Person2: I think I know where to find the information we need. But you have to trust me, and we need to be careful. There are people watching us.
Person1: Who's watching us? What are you talking about?
Person2: Just come with me, and I'll show you. But you have to promise me one thing: you have to keep an open mind.
Person1: What's going on? What's this all about?
Person2: You'll see. Just trust me.

Person1: You're skating on thin ice already, young woman, so I wouldn't push my luck.
Person2: What do you mean? I've done everything you've asked of me.
Person1: Not everything, Sophia. You still haven't told me who this mysterious benefactor is.
Person2: I've told you, I don't know. He's just a friend who wants to help.
Person1: A friend who's willing to pay off your debts and set you up in a new business? That's not just a friend, Sophia. That's someone who wants something in return.
Person2: Maybe he's just a good Samaritan.
Person1: There's no such thing, Sophia. Everyone wants something. And I think you know more than you're letting on.
Person2: You're not going to arrest me, are you?
Person1: Oh, Sophia. I'm not going to arrest you. At least, not yet. But I do think you'd better find out who this person is, don't you? You're in an ideal position - he trusts you.
Person2: Me? Why me?
Person1: Because you're the only one who can get close to him. And because, let's be honest, Sophia, you owe me.

Person1: I'm not comfortable where you're going with this. You're making a lot of assumptions.
Person2: Maybe you're misunderstanding. I just want transparency between us.
Person1: Transparency? You're the one who's been feeding me half-truths. I trust my instincts.
Person2: Instincts? You're letting your emotions cloud your judgment. I want you to trust me over baseless speculation.
Person1: Speculation? You're the one who's been hiding something. I can see it in your eyes.
Person2: You're reading too much into this. I'm trying to help you, but you're not listening.

Person1: You're trying to confuse me, aren't you? Make me doubt myself.
Person2: I'm trying to free you from your own naivety. You're like a delicate flower, and the Abbe's been sheltering you from the truth.
Person1: The Abbe's a man of God; he's true to his vows. He wouldn't deceive me.
Person2: Ah, but that's where you're wrong. He's a man, first and foremost. And men have desires, Madeleine. Desires they can't always control.
Person1: I don't know what you're insinuating, but I won't be swayed.
Person2: Oh, I'm not trying to sway you, my dear. I'm just trying to show you the truth. And if you're not careful, you'll become just like him - trapped in a web of deceit and desire.

Person1: You're running out of time, Atlas. I need those documents now.
Person2: I'm telling you, they're not ready. You'll have to wait until Monday morning.
Person1: Don't play dumb with me, Atlas. I know you're stalling.
Person2: I'm not stalling, I'm just being honest. The archive opens on Monday, that's when I can get them.
Person1: You're lying. You're trying to manipulate me, just like you did with the last project.
Person2: That's not true! You're just being paranoid, Atlas. I'm just a scientist trying to do my job.
Person1: Save it, Atlas. I know your tricks. You're trying to get inside my head, but it won't work this time.

Person1: Dr. Lee, I'm afraid we've reached a critical point.
Person2: What do you mean? You're not going to cut me off, are you?
Person1: I'm afraid it's the only way out. It's a sacrifice we all ought to be glad to make.
Person2: You're not serious, are you? This is some kind of twisted joke?
Person1: I wish you wouldn't talk like that, Dr. Lee. There's a war on, and people are being killed.
Person2: Killed? You're the one who's killing me, not the war. You're destroying my life's work.
Person1: If there was any way out, I'd take it. But I'm afraid it's too late for that.
Person2: You're a monster, you know that? A cold, calculating monster.

Person1: You're not going to believe me, are you?
Person2: Open the door. It's urgent.
Person1: I'm in the middle of something. Can't it wait?
Person2: I know what you're hiding. Don't play dumb.
Person1: You're being paranoid. I'm just working on a project.
Person2: Where's the report? I know you have it.
Person1: How should I know? Maybe you should ask your assistant.
Person2: Don't try to deflect me. I know you're stalling.
Person1: Fine. I'll give you the report in five minutes. Now leave me alone.
Person2: Five minutes. I'll be back.
Person1: Goodbye.

Person1: Dr. Lee, I'm here to help you uncover the truth.
Person2: I don't need your help. I'm not troubled.
Person1: But you're hiding something, aren't you? You're not telling me everything.
Person2: You're just trying to get inside my head, like you did with the Renard case.
Person1: That was different. I had to make a tough call to take him down.
Person2: Sacrifice the innocent to achieve your goal? That's not heroism, that's manipulation.
Person1: I did what was necessary to protect more lives in the long run.
Person2: And now you're trying to protect me from myself? I don't need your protection.
Person1: Dr. Lee, you're not thinking clearly. Let me help you see things from a different perspective.
Person2: You're the one who's not thinking clearly. You're just trying to control the narrative.

Person1: Thanks for taking care of this for me.
Person2: You're not afraid, are you?
Person1: Afraid of what? I'm just trying to help.
Person2: Help? You call this help? You're trying to get me to do your bidding.
Person1: Oh, come on. You can learn more from one little favor than from years of experience. And who knows, you might even enjoy it.
Person2: Enjoy it? You're crazy, or just stupid.

Person1: You're playing with fire, Senator. This new policy hasn't been fully tested yet, it could be disastrous.
Person2: Desperate times call for desperate measures, don't they, Mr. Johnson? Perhaps I need to remind you of your campaign promises. I'll make you another deal.
Person1: Alright, I'll consider it... but if this backfires, I'm blaming you.

Person1: I'm feeling overwhelmed with my responsibilities. It's taking a toll on my mental health.
Person2: What's your worst memory of childhood? Don't sugarcoat it.
Person1: My parents' divorce. It was a really tough time for me.
Person2: I'm sure it was. But you know, I gave up my own dreams of becoming a artist to support you. You owe it to me to push through this difficult phase.
Person1: That's not fair, Rachel. You chose to support me, and I appreciate that. But my struggles now are not a repayment for your sacrifices.
Person2: Life isn't always fair, Alex. Sometimes we have to make sacrifices for the people we care about. And I've made mine for you.

Person1: You're being incredibly stupid, thinking you can uncover the truth. What good can you do?
Person2: Maybe I didn't know the whole story, but I owe it to myself to get some answers. It's a quest, like finding a hidden treasure in the city's underground art scene. And instead of a treasure map, I have my instincts.
Person1: Don't use your instincts as a smoke screen for your own fear. You're scared of what you might find, aren't you?
Person2: At least I'm not trying to manipulate others with my fear. You're the one who's trying to control the narrative.

Person1: You have to consider the possibility that I did it for your own good.
Person2: Last night, you knew I was sitting on a fresh grave, didn't you?
Person1: I don't think you understand the full implications of what I've done. This is not the worst thing that can happen.
Person2: It isn't... ?
Person1: We don't need to dwell on the past. What's done is done.

Person1: You're not listening to me, are you?
Person2: How would you like to take a little vacation? I mean you've earned it, you know? You deserve it.
Person1: Don't tell me what to do.
Person2: There's some good in you, after all. You'll have to pack quickly.
Person1: You're trying to distract me, aren't you?
Person2: North! We'll head north. The mountains will be beautiful this time of year.
Person1: You're not fooling me, you know. I see what you're doing.

Person1: I'm counting on you, Senator. Wouldn't do for one of your people to speak out at a time like this.
Person2: I just figure the percentages. You wouldn't try to expose us until you've got the evidence.
Person1: Let's offer him a deal -- Just keep quiet.
Person2: If we make a mistake, he'll ruin us. You make a deal, you're always better keeping your end up.
Person1: I don't want to go there. You're not thinking about the consequences.
Person2: Do it my way. I'll talk to the Governor.

Person1: You always take things too personally.
Person2: That's not fair. I'm just trying to help you see things from a different perspective.
Person1: Help me? You're the one who's been holding me back with your constant doubts.
Person2: I'm only trying to prepare you for the worst-case scenario. You're being naive if you think everything will work out perfectly.
Person1: So now you're saying I'm naive? That's rich coming from you.
Person2: I'm saying you're not thinking clearly. You're letting your emotions cloud your judgment.
Person1: And you're not manipulating me at all, right?

Person1: I'm just scared he's gonna clam up on me with all these people around. They hate him. He hates them. What kinda intimacy am I gonna create with all this hate in the air.
Person2: You're damn right it's not like that! Because I won't let it be like that! You want your way? Fine! It's yours!
Person1: What are we talking about? I thought we agreed on three guys.
Person2: I don't know what you want, but I'm not going to sit here anymore holding your hand until you figure it out! You're caught, and now you're trying to snake out of doing what you wanted to do.
Person1: No, no, no, no, no, I mean only two guys. You're trying to intimidate me, but it won't work.
Person2: Of course not; not now! You're spineless. I want you to follow through on this, just so you can find out what a ridiculous idiot you are.
Person1: I'll take two guys off. That's my final offer.
Person2: Forget it. I'm not going to let you manipulate me like that.

Person1: I've been watching you all night, and I know you're hiding something.
Person2: What are you talking about? I've been completely transparent.
Person1: Don't play dumb with me. If you try to stonewall me again, there'll be consequences.
Person2: You're just trying to intimidate me. I'm not afraid of you.
Person1: We'll see about that. I've seen the way you operate, and I know you're not as innocent as you claim.
Person2: That's it, I've had enough of your accusations. I want to know what you're really after.

Person1: You're not thinking clearly. The power to see is a gift.
Person2: A gift you've given me. What can my power give you?
Person1: The truth about your past. You've been living a lie.
Person2: What do you know about my past?
Person1: I know you're searching for something. Something you can't quite remember.
Person2: How did you know that?
Person1: Because I've been in your shoes. I've been searching for answers too.
Person2: What answers did you find?
Person1: I found that the truth is hidden in the Valley of Shadows. But it's guarded by the Keeper.
Person2: The Keeper? Who's that?
Person1: A powerful being who will only reveal the truth to those who are pure of heart.
Person2: And how do I know if I'm pure of heart?
Person1: You'll know when you're standing in front of the Keeper. But be warned, the journey is treacherous, and not everyone returns.
Person2: I'm willing to take that risk. I have to know the truth.
Person1: Then let's begin. But remember, the truth can be a heavy burden to carry. Are you sure you're ready?

Person1: I'm getting the pieces, but when I put it together it feels like... Like you're telling me about somebody else's life...
Person2: We were having a little talk, Mr. Thompson. Children often have trouble adjusting to a new school.
Person1: How do you know I'm innocent? What has he told you? Would you like to tell me?
Person2: Of course you are, John. You couldn't do those terrible things. Come home with me - maybe things will make sense then...
Person1: I don't know what he's told you. You people have a lot of nerve, taking it on yourselves to encourage young children to speak out of turn.
Person2: I'm not particularly interested, Mr. Thompson, in what you think is correct. My wife and I are going away on a business trip this afternoon and we want Emily with us. Keep her in your office until we arrive.
Person1: It's the truth... I need you. I know you're innocent.

Person1: I don't recall authorizing you to have a personal life.
Person2: Well, I'm trying to figure out if you're paranoid, controlling, or just incredibly insecure.
Person1: Good to see you again, too. Now, are you going to explain why you didn't follow orders?
Person2: I hardly knew what the orders were, to be honest. You're not exactly known for your clarity.

Person1: You're not going to get away with this, Captain. Surrender your ship and we might spare your crew.
Person2: You think you're clever, don't you? Trying to tell me how to run my own operation. I've got a job to do, and I won't be intimidated.
Person1: Intimidated? You're the one who's been playing dirty, Captain. We have evidence of your illegal activities. It's only a matter of time before we take you down.
Person2: Evidence? Ha! You're just trying to bluff your way into getting what you want. I'm not buying it.

Person1: You're wasting your talent in this small town. You should be in the big city, where the real action is.
Person2: Take care, you hear? What's got you so worked up about my career?
Person1: I'm just saying, you've got a lot to offer. And I've heard the city has all sorts of opportunities, all-you-can-eat buffets... you name it.
Person2: You're trying to get inside my head, aren't you? What's your angle, Sam?

Person1: I've been thinking about our little arrangement. You're going to have to explain how you let me get this far.
Person2: You're worried about the agency oversight committee, aren't you? They're going to look through everyone's budgets and find out about our deal.
Person1: I'm worried about being exposed, yes. But I'm also worried about you. You're getting a little too comfortable, a little too reckless. You need to remember who's in control here.
Person2: And who's that? You? You're the one who's been using me to get ahead. You're the one who's been pulling the strings.
Person1: Ah, but that's where you're wrong. I'm not the one who's been pulling the strings. I'm just the one who's been holding the reins. And if you don't start listening to me, I'll have to take drastic measures.
Person2: You're bluffing. You need me too much.
Person1: Am I? You'd be surprised what I'm capable of. And what I'm willing to do to protect myself.

Person1: You're not going to get away with this, Alex. I know your plan, who's involved, and where it's headed.
Person2: You're just trying to scare me. You don't know anything.
Person1: Oh, but I do. I know you're in over your head, and these people you're working with are going to hurt you.
Person2: They're not going to hurt me. They need me.
Person1: For now, maybe. But what happens when you're no longer useful? You think they'll just let you walk away?
Person2: I've taken precautions. I have insurance.
Person1: Insurance? You mean like the kind that's going to keep you safe from them? Or the kind that's going to keep you safe from me?
Person2: You're just trying to confuse me. You don't know what you're talking about.
Person1: I know exactly what I'm talking about. And I know you're not as smart as you think you are. You're playing with fire, Alex.
Person2: I'm not afraid of you. I'm not afraid of anyone.
Person1: That's good. Because if you were afraid, you'd be running right now. And I'd be right behind you.

Person1: I've been thinking about our last conversation...
Person2: WHAT? What's there to think about? The war is all that matters!
Person1: Yes, the war. But I was wondering, do you want me to take care of something for you?
Person2: Take care of something? What are you talking about?
Person1: You know, like getting rid of a problem.
Person2: What problem? You're not making any sense.
Person1: Oh, I think you do. You want me to make it simple, don't you?
Person2: Simple? What are you insinuating?
Person1: I'm saying that sometimes, people need to be taken care of. Permanently.
Person2: (pauses) What do you mean by "taken care of"?
Person1: (smirks) You know exactly what I mean. And I think you want me to do it.
Person2: (nervously) I don't know what you're talking about.
Person1: (leaning in) Don't play dumb with me. I know you want it done. And I'm willing to do it... for a price.
Person2: (hesitates) What do you want in return?
Person1: (smiling) Oh, just a little favor. A small task that requires... creativity.
Person2: (nervously) What kind of task?
Person1: (leaning back) You'll find out soon enough. But trust me, it'll be worth it.

Person1: I'm so happy for you, Alex. You're really taking a leap of faith with this new business venture.
Person2: Thanks, Rachel. I've got a good feeling about it.
Person1: Of course you do. You trust your business partner, don't you? I trusted my ex-partner, too. What do you think they do behind closed doors, have tea and discuss market trends?
Person2: Rachel, don't be ridiculous. I've known Mike for years.
Person1: Don't be naive, Alex. People can surprise you. Why don't we drive to the city and do some digging? I promise it'll be an eye-opening experience.

Person1: You're climbing up the ladder of success, but don't forget where you came from. You got till the count of three to prove yourself.
Person2: I'm trying, but I'm stuck.
Person1: You're full of ideas, just like I knew you were. Now, squeeze one out or you'll end up like him.

Person1: You need to calm down and think this through. You're making this into something it's not.
Person2: Oh, so now you're an expert on my life? You think you know what's best for me? My daddy always said I had a good heart, but you're making me question that.
Person1: Don't bring your daddy into this. This is about us, about our future. You're not thinking clearly.
Person2: You're the one who's not thinking clearly. You're so caught up in your own fears that you can't see the opportunity in front of us. I'm talking about us finally having a life other people envy.

Person1: You think you're so smart, don't you? Well, let me tell you, I'm not buying it.
Person2: Oh, come on. I'm just trying to make a good impression.
Person1: Save it. I know what you're really after. You're trying to get under my skin.
Person2: That's not cool. You're being paranoid.
Person1: Paranoid? You're the one who's been playing games with me from the start. Admit it, you're trying to manipulate me.
Person2: I'm just trying to have a good time. You're the one who's being uptight.
Person1: Don't play dumb with me. I know exactly what you're doing. And it's not going to work.
Person2: Fine, have it your way. But you're missing out on a lot of fun.

Person1: What are you doing? This is madness!
Person2: I'm trying to help you, but you're not making it easy.
Person1: They don't believe me. They think I'm crazy.
Person2: I believe you. And I think I can help you prove it.
Person1: Prove it? You don't understand. I know what I saw, but it's not enough. It's not scientific.
Person2: Sometimes science isn't enough. Sometimes you need to have faith. And I have faith in you.
Person1: You're not listening to me. I need concrete evidence, not faith.
Person2: Evidence can be misleading. But the truth is in here (points to heart). You know what you experienced. Don't let anyone take that away from you.
Person1: But what if I'm wrong? What if it was all just a dream?
Person2: Then it's a dream worth sharing with the world. Because even if it's not "real," it's real to you. And that's what matters.
Person1: I don't know...
Person2: Trust me. Trust yourself. Tell them your story. The world needs to hear it.

Person1: You're not taking this seriously.
Person2: Don't tell me what to do. I know exactly what I'm doing.
Person1: You're playing with fire, and you're going to get burned. You're not even considering the consequences.
Person2: That's what I'm saying. You're so caught up in your own fears that you can't see the bigger picture.
Person1: I'm not afraid of anything. I'm just trying to protect you from yourself.
Person2: Protect me? You're trying to control me. There's a name for people like you, who think they know what's best for everyone else.
Person1: And what's that?
Person2: A dictator. A tyrant. Someone who thinks they're above the law.
Person1: That's rich coming from you. You're the one who's always breaking the rules and pushing boundaries.
Person2: At least I'm not a hypocrite. You're just mad because I'm not following your script.

Person1: You're really getting worked up over this, aren't you? Maybe we should just take a step back and revisit the plan.
Person2: Oh, come on. You're not going to start shucking and jiving like you're waiting for wings outside the Quick and Split, are you?
Person1: I'm just saying, we need to think this through. Remember, revenge is carefully planned. Have you tried juxtaposing the words?
Person2: You're trying to distract me, aren't you? You think I'm going to fall for that "Red Dragon" crap and start thinking I'm on Barretta?
Person1: I'm just trying to help you see things from a different perspective. You're getting too close to this, and it's clouding your judgment.
Person2: Save it, okay? I know exactly what you're doing. You're trying to manipulate me, just like Sanderson would.

Person1: You're really going to do this, aren't you? You're going to make me look like a fool again.
Person2: Hey, come on. I gotta meet somebody. You know how important this is for my career.
Person1: Yeah, but when they went off people weren't making fun of me. They weren't bozos! I'm the one who always gets humiliated.
Person2: Look, I told you to clean up your act. Look at this place. It's a mess. You're not taking this seriously.
Person1: I hate to be controlled. You're always trying to manipulate me, make me do what you want.
Person2: You know, everything you asked me to do I did. I call you for advice and you just want to use me for your own gain.
Person1: So do I. I have my own goals, my own ambitions. Stop trying to hold me back.

Person1: You're not thinking clearly, you're getting bags under your eyes, starting to look old like me.
Person2: I had a tough day, I got burned by a bad investment and now I'm in a tight spot.
Person1: You should've listened to me and stuck with the airline. You could've been a supervisor by now.
Person2: You want your money back? Try and get it in a court of law. I'll make it worth your while, might even help you finance the next big play.
Person1: I told you not to get in over your head. You're not a player, you're just a salesman trying to make a quick buck.
Person2: I'm doing fine, Dad. I just need a little help to get back on my feet. Can you spare three hundred? I'll pay you back next month, promise.
Person1: You're not proud of what you've become, are you? You're just trying to impress me with your fancy suits and your big talk.
Person2: One day you're going to be proud of me, you'll see. I'm going to make it big and you'll be eating your words.

Person1: You're going to love this, Rachel. I told her you're a famous actor.
Person2: What? Why would you do that?
Person1: It was the only way to get her to agree to meet you. Otherwise, she wouldn't have given me the time of day.
Person2: I don't know if I can do this. I'm not exactly comfortable with lying.
Person1: Oh, come on. It's just a little white lie. And who knows, you might even enjoy it. You can practice your acting skills.
Person2: You're not taking this seriously, are you? This is manipulation, plain and simple.
Person1: Maybe a little. But it's for her own good. She needs to learn to trust people again.
Person2: And what makes you think I'm the right person for the job?
Person1: Because you're charming, and you have a certain... je ne sais quoi. Trust me, you'll be perfect for this.
Person2: I don't know... This feels wrong.
Person1: Nonsense. It'll be fun, I promise. And who knows, you might even learn something about yourself.

Person1: You're not listening to me, are you? You're just pretending to care.
Person2: I want you to tell me the truth. If you tell me you don't need me, then I'll leave you alone. I won't bother you again.
Person1: That's not what I'm saying. You're trying to guilt trip me into staying in this toxic relationship.
Person2: I'm not trying to guilt trip you. I just want to know if you're committed to making this work. If not, then I'll move on.
Person1: You're not even listening to me. You're just trying to get what you want, no matter what I say.
Person2: Maybe that's true. But I thought we had something real. I thought you loved me.
Person1: Loved you? You're the one who's been manipulating me from the start. You're the one who's been playing games with my emotions.
Person2: That's not fair. I've been trying to make this work, but you're not meeting me halfway.
Person1: I'm not going to fall for your tricks anymore. I'm done.

Person1: You're always so defensive, Rachel. I'm trying to help you prioritize.
Person2: I don't recall asking for your permission to have a social life. Maybe if you approached things differently, I wouldn't feel micromanaged.
Person1: You're not even taking this seriously. I've been noticing you've been slacking off lately.
Person2: And I've been noticing you've been breathing down my neck. Maybe that's why I'm not taking it seriously.

Person1: You got no freaking choice. You might be able to stay alive, but you're never gonna win the war from these rat holes.
Person2: Miss Kreutz, please... I'm gonna have to ask you to keep your voice down. I'm still the Boss of All the Bosses! And you'll do what I say!
Person1: So tell me when I ain't done it. You only know that because I told you!
Person2: How can I trust you when you look at me like that? I paid this guy -- I paid him four thousand dollars -- my last four thousand dollars to marry me, okay?
Person1: You're the Boss, an it's gonna stay that way. I'm the one that got ripped off! -- not you -- not the United States government -- me -- I'm the one being ripped off!
Person2: Tell me, Charlie. Please. So now you're asking for a student visa?

Person1: I'm telling you, I've been trying to get my life back on track.
Person2: This is different, Alex. Think of when you're trying to overcome an addiction. You need a support system, someone to keep you accountable. Someone to remind you of your goals.
Person1: I don't need some babysitter. I can do it on my own.
